loans.name: Zahida Begum's Group

texts.en:
Zahida Begum has lived in Multan city for the last 12 years in a three-room brick house. Multan is the fourth largest city of Pakistan.
 
A very caring lady, Zahida stays at home to manage the household chores and take care of her family. She is an illiterate lady. She couldn’t get a proper education because her parents were not in a position to afford her education expenses.
 
She got married at the age of 18 and has given birth to two sons. Both of her sons are not of school-going age yet. She has a dream to send her kids to school so they never face the hard time she faced without being literate.  

Her husband's name is M. H. and he is a private entrepreneur who purchases clothes from different cities and sells them in both his native city and in different communities as well. He has been doing this work for over seven years. He has obtained a good reputation among his customers. His selection in clothes is always admired by his customers. He also keeps himself aware of the new designs and fabrics in clothes to attract more customers to his work. 

He generates an income of approximately 15,000 Pakistan rupees, which enables him to meet the financial expenses. Zahida has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy clothes in bulk, which will cut his traveling expenses. He will be able to re-invest the profit amount in his business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for reselling

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena D. is 58 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a business as a dealer of French ice cream. She lives in Vallega Street, Brgy. 1, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her ice cream business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Magdalena is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Magdalena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Ana Agentina

texts.es:
Ana de 48 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Orquídeas” fue llamada así porque encontraron una gran cantidad de flores orquídeas en su descubrimiento. Ella tiene una “ferretería” tienda de repuestos y artículos de construccion.  

Hace 4 años atrás ella trabajaba como empleada en un almacén de repuestos pero como se enfermo tubo que abandonar su trabajo e iniciar una actividad que le generara ingresos y que le ayudadaza a ganar dinero para poder mantener a su familia. Ahora ella tiene una ferretería pequeña, trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Vende tubos, pinturas, materiales de construcción. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar zinc, clavos, ladrillos para surtir mas su ferretería. En el futuro quiere aumentar su ferretería para que los ingresos aseguren la vejez de ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old and lives in the urban zone called "Orquídeas." The area is called this because they found a large quantity of orchid flowers here when it was discovered. Ana has a hardware store that sells spare parts and construction materials. Four years ago she was working as an employee at a warehouse of spare parts but she got sick and had to stop working there and begin a different job that would generate income and help her bring in money to be able to support her family. Now she has a small hardware store and she works from 7:00am to 11:00pm everyday. She sells tubes, paint, and construction materials. With this loan she wants to buy zinc, nails, and bricks to supply her store. In the future she wants her hardware store to grow so her income will provide for her and her husband in their old age.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tubes, nails, zinc

loans.name: Florigen

texts.en:
Florigen N. is a married woman who lives in Ponta Tagda Zone 5, Brry. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a dried fish business. Her husband, Felomino N., is 46 years old and works as a fisherman to earn his living. He also helps with his wife's business activities. The couple has four children who are 19 to 28 years old.
Florigen joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florigen has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 49,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 30,000 PHP, thus raising her family's standard of living.
This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing 50,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more dried fish to resell so that she could continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and have savings for future use. Florigen N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish for resale

loans.name: Fenie

texts.en:
Fenie M. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 30 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Fenie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fenie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Fenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fenie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Fenie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Fenie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He is doing that because at the moment he is riding another person’s motorcycle and now he wants to own one. He is 28 years old, married with one child aged 3 years. He looks after a family of four people living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the last 10 years. 

Vincent adds that fuel shortage is a major challenge to the motorcycle business sector. He says he has always hoped to have his own motorcycle and with access to this loan, he will be able to acquire one for himself for income generation.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Jazmin

texts.es:
Jazmín Ramírez de 29 años de edad, dice que su negocio inició debajo de un árbol a la intemperie, cuando solo contaba con una pequeña maquina para corte de cabello, un espejo, y eso si,  muchas ganas de salir adelante. Hoy en día y desde el año 2007, ella dice  que “es su propia jefa" y que su disciplina, dedicación y su buen humor, han sido los ingredientes de su crecimiento empresarial y personal. Ella cuenta con un local sillas, espejos, vitrinas lava cabezas, insumos y herramientas adecuadas, televisores para distraer a  sus clientes cuando esperan,  aunque trabaja en jornadas extendidas no desfallece, porque su familia es su motor e inspiración para hacer de cada día el mejor.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en su peluquería "Jehová Shalon" comprando   insumos como tintes, ampollas, masajes para cabello y enjuague, no solo para usarlo en su servicio, sino también para venderlos a sus clientes, a quienes además de prestarle el servicio,  los asesora, porque en materia de estilo y belleza Jazmín se las sabe todas y cada día se perfecciona mediante seminarios a los que asiste. Ella está muy contenta con su negocio, porque siempre está rodeada de clientes, que son sus vecinos, referidos, familiares,  amas de casa, jóvenes y niños y además porque el producto de este trabajo y el de su esposo,  le ayuda a aumentar los  ingresos familiares, con los cuales quieren brindar una educación con mucha calidad a sus  3 hijos que ahora están en las edades de 5 a 10 años.
 ,
texts.en:
Jazmín Ramírez, 29, says that she started her business outside under a tree.  She had only one small haircutting tool, a mirror, and a strong desire to get ahead.  Today, and since the year 2007, she says that "she is her own boss" and that discipline, dedication and a good sense of humor have been the foundations of her growth as a person and as a businesswoman.  She has a salon with chairs, mirrors, glass display cases, hair washing stands, supplies, adequate tools, and television sets to distract her customers as they wait.  Although she works very long days, she does not falter, because her family is her motivation and inspiration to make each day the best.

This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will invest it in her beauty salon, called "Jehová Shalon," by purchasing supplies such as: hair dyes, hair treatment ampules and hair massages and rinses, to use in her business and also to sell to her customers.  In addition to providing beauty services, Jazmin also advises her customers, because in the area of style and beauty Jazmin knows everything, and she is constantly improving her knowledge by attending seminars.  She is very content with her business, because she is always surrounded by her customers, who are her neighbors, relatives, referrals, housewives, young people and children.  In addition, as a result of this work and that of her husband, she can increase the family income and provide a quality education to her 3 children who are now between the ages of 5 and 10 years.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as hair dyes, ampules, hair massage, shampoo and rinse, not only to use in her salon but also to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To solve the problems of his family.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald has been practicing mixed farming for the last 24 years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans, which he sells locally. He also earns income from providing carpentry services to the locals. He says that his biggest challenge has been mostly the government's restriction on cutting down trees, which makes it difficult for him to manage his trade.

He has requested this loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a power saw. He says that the income from this loan will enable him to see his children through school. In the future, he would like to concentrate more on dairy farming to supplement his other sources of income. 

Ronald (pictured with his dairy cow) is 46 years old. He is a single father of four school-aged children who all attend school. He says that he is looking forward to being financed by Juhudi for many years to come.

loans.use: To purchase a power saw

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
The man shown in the picture is Mr. Sam S., 46, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches around eight kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market.

His wife’s name is Pech Rath; she is 40 years old and works with him in the fishing business. This couple is blessed with nine children and all of them are single.

Mr. Sam S. will use his loan to purchase nets, traps and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Allahkanben Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association ALLAHKABEN du village de Kassene. Il regroupe 9 femmes  qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 5  enfants, elles mènent différentes activités : vente de diverses marchandises et condiments. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Kassene, dans la préfecture de TOMINIAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers depuis plusieurs années. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année.  Il est à son premier prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM SOLO T. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de petit mil, dans les villages environnants et effectue ses ventes au marché de TOMINIAN. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 19500FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group with an association with Allahkaben of the village of Kassene. The group is made up of 9 women members who are known through family and as neighbors. On average they are 48 years old. They are married and they each have at least 5 children. They carry out different business activities: sale of various merchandise and condiments. They live in large traditional families in Kassene, in the quarter of Tominian (Region of Segou in the Republic of Mali). 

They have been merchants of various articles for many years. With the hope of meeting the demands of their growing clientele they have come together as a group this year to request a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first loan together. 

Mariam Solo T. plans on investing her loan to purchase 1 ton of millet from the neighboring villages. She sells her products in the market in Tominian. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 19500 FCFA. It will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase millet.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo C. is from the village of Aurora. He is 45 years old. Ronaldo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over nineteen years and earns approximately $158 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ronaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Llenitas De Amor Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Llenitas de Amor, debido a que tienen mucho amor a su negocio. El grupo se encuentra ubicado en el pueblo de Mexicltzingo, se llama así ya que cuenta la historia que el aguila se paro primero ahi y significa México chiquito, el grupo esta coformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Silvia V. D. es una de las integrantes del grupo tiene 35 años, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 9 y 7 años, uno de sus hijo quiere ser piloto aviador y ella quiere poder brindarle la carrera, por eso cuida mucho su negocio le invierte y trabaja todos los días, lleva 12 años dedicandose a la produccion y venta de chicharron, comenzó con un puesto heredado por su madre ya que fue ella la que le enseño el oficio, ahora cuenta con dos puestos que miden metro y medio cada uno, en uno de ellos la apoya su marido los sábados y domingos ademá de trabajar de lunes a viernes, la señora quiere darle carrera a todos sus hijos para que tengan un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Llenitas de Amor” (Filled with Love) because they have a lot of love for their business.  The group is located in the town of Mexicaltzino whose meaning derives from the tale that the eagle alighted here first and it means “Little México.”  The group has 10 members.

Mrs. Silvia Vázquez D. is one of the members.  She’s 34 years old, married and has four children who are 12, 10, 9 and 7 years of age.  One of her children wants to be a Pilot and she wants to provide him with this career so she cares for her business with dedication investing in it and working every day.  

She has been making and selling chicharrones (fried pork skin) for 12 years.  She started out with a stand passed down from her mother since she taught her everything about the occupation.  Now she has two stands measuring a meter and a half each.  Her husband helps her in one of them on Saturdays and Sundays after working all week from Monday through Friday.  She wants to provide careers to all her children so that they will have better life styles.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the fried pork.

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es: La Sra.  Sulma es cliente nueva de la institución ella sola esta sacando  adelante a tres de sus pequeños hijos ya que se esta separando de su esposo ella vive en casa propia tiene su pequeño hijo quien estudia en el colegio de la zona y sus dos hijas mayores estudian derecho en la facultad de derecho Su hija mayor de 19 años es quien le ayuda mas puesto que viaja constantemente  a chile  la Sra.  Sulma es peinadora y su sueño s poner su salón de estética personal y así dejarles con negocio a sus hijos el crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de material para el salón (rasuradora eléctrica e insumos del salón), e s una persona muy trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Sulma is a new client of the organization. She is raising her three young children by herself, having separated from her husband. She lives in a house of her own. Her young son is in school and the two eldest daughters are studying law in the faculty of law. Her eldest daughter is 19 years old and she is the one that helps her the most because she frequently travels to Chile. Sulma is a hairdresser and her dream is to set up her own beauty salon, to leave the business to her children. The loan that she requests is to purchase materials for her salon (electric hair clipper, and salon products). She is a very hard working person and she is thankful to the organization for the support they provide her, by granting her a loan.

loans.use: To purchase salon products and appliances.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun S. is 39 years old and has two children who are single and still living under her care. At the beginning of 2008, Yun S. has built a small wooden store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells snack products, perfume, soft drinks, cooking ingredients and other products to sell to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. She is married to Mey Somrorl, 37, an internal staff at HALO organization, in Kompong Cham province. In order to earn extra profit and make the business more successful, recently, the part of Yun S.’s item has been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan to accumulate amount of her inventory to continue selling.

loans.use: to buy more snacks, perfumes, soft drinks and cooking ingredients to sell

loans.name: Petita

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. Este cantón es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Petita, ella tiene 78 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 13  hijos, cuatro de ellos fallecieron y los restantes ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene un local en su casa en el que trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00 con la ayuda de una de sus hijas. Su mercadería  se la envían desde New York o de Santo Domingo y ella la recibe en Portoviejo. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio ocho años y que gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas.  Ella está en el Banco Comunal 15 años y le gusta todo. Su sueño  tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Madre Para Un Futuro Mayor" (Mother for a Better Future) meets every 15 days in the canton 24 de Mayo in the Manabí province. This canton is known for its beautiful landscapes, for its forests, for the variety of its wildlife, and for its kind and hard-working people, of whom the majority work in agriculture and raising livestock.

In this place we met Señora Petita. She is 78 years old. She is married and from this relation has 13 children; four of them are deceased, and the others are adults. Two of them still live with her. Her husband is a businessman.

Señora Petita sells clothes. She has a shop in her house where she works every day from 8 am to 6 pm with the help of one of her daughters. Her merchandise is sent to her from New York or Santo Domingo and she receives it in Portovieho. She tells us that she has had her business for eight years, and thanks to God it has always gone well for her.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, and underwear, among other items. She has been in the communal bank for 15 years and she likes it. Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Duo La Alameda Group

texts.es:
DUO.  LA ALAMEDA

MARLENA T. V.. , TIENE 34 AÑOS  DE EDAD,TIENE DOS HIJAS PEQUEÑAS, , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA TIPICA, PERO ELLA VENDE SU PRODUCTO AMBULANTE NO TIENE NINGUN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO NI EN SU CASA, ELLA DICE QUE NECESITA SU CREDITO, PARA PODER SURTIR SU NEGOCIO Y COMPRAR ROPA TIPÍCA POR MAYOR. VIDALIA USEN,  ELLA  TIENE 59 AÑOS DE EDAD ELLA TIENE VARIOS HIJOS, PERO LA MAYORIA SON CASADOS ELLA YA SOLO MANTIENE A TRES DE ELLOS, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO, Y SU CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTO COMESTIBLE DE CONSUMO DIARIO  Y PODER SURTIR SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
La Alameda Duo

Marlena T. V., 34, has two little girls.  She sells typical clothing in an itinerant manner; she does not have a fixed sales stand either in the market or at home.  She says she needs financing to stock her business and buy typical clothes at wholesale.

Vidalia Usen, 59, has several children but most of them are married.  She still supports just three of them.  She sells daily consumption items.  She needs the loan to buy more foodstuffs to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy typical clothing at wholesale and to buy daily consumption foodstuffs.

loans.name: Loboko Plus Group

texts.en:
Esperance is a leader of the community bank named “Loboko Plus” which is composed of 16 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Esperance sells women’s clothing and fish and meat at a market located in the eastern area of Kinshasa. She likes her business because it helps her support her family. Currently, through her sales, Esperance makes about $80 per week. Her plans are to use the next loan to purchase some baskets of fish to resell in order to increase her income. 

Esperance is a trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having four times received and properly repaid loans. She dreams one day of having her own significant working capital. Esperance is 47 years old, married and the mother of five children whose ages vary between 14 and 28. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase baskets of fish for resale.

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.fr: Théobard Sinzabwakwira est agriculteur de riz dans le secteur du Ruhuha, membre du groupe Twisungane, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il a 65 ans, il est marié, et il a 8 enfants entre 21 ans et 42 ans.  Il est né au Rwanda, dans le secteur de Ruhuha, et il a fini 3 ans d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son troisième cycle avec ACB, et il a une très bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat d’urée, NPK, et main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz.  Il voudrait devenir grossiste ou fournisseur de riz dans le secteur de Ruhuha, payer des frais médicaux pour sa famille, et aussi acheter une parcelle pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Théobard Sinzabwakwira is a rice cultivator, a member of group Twisungane, and has been a customer of Kiva's partner, ACB, since 2010. He's 65 years old, married, and has eight children, aged 21 to 42. He was born in Rwanda, in Ruhuha sector, and completed three years of elementary school.

He is seeking his third loan from ACB, and has a very good repayment history. He will use the loan to buy urea and NPK (fertilizers), and to pay for labor for his rice cultivation business.

He would like to become a wholesaler or a rice provider in Ruhura sector, pay his family's medical expenses, and also buy a lot of land for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor for his rice cultivation business

loans.name: Deisis

texts.es:
Deisis tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera vive en casa de su madre, es peluquera hace más de cinco años, además de eso se dedica al macate (vendedora ambulante) por la ciudad y en especial recorriendo las escuelas de la zona de alrededores de su casa.
Deisis es muy sacrificada debido a que terminó su curso de peluquería, habilitó para su propio local y a la mañana realiza sus ventas recorriendo las escuelas. Hace un año terminó su carrera de docencia que lo está ejerciendo en el turno noche en el colegio cerca de su casa.
Hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada por su buena atención y por la buena calidad de sus productos.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías (ropas de temporada, camperas, busos, etc.)
texts.en:
Deisis is 25 years old. She is single and lives in her mother's house. She has been a hair stylist for more than five years. She also works as a "macate" (street vendor) in the city, in particular around the schools in the area near her house.      

Deisis is very dedicated. She finished her hair styling classes, managed to open her own locale, and does her sales in the morning around the schools. A year ago, she finished her degree in education and is practicing her profession at night in the high school near her house. Today she has an established customer base due to her good service and the high quality of her products. She needs the loan to buy merchandise (seasonal clothing, jackets, sweaters, etc.).

loans.use: to buy clothes such as jackets, sweaters, t-shirts, pants, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Biviana; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también en su tienda de abarrotes vende verduras como cebollas, tomates, zanahorias, papa entre otras verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite y leche al por mayor y también para comprar verduras.
                                                                
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Biviana, 50, is a member of the “MUNAY TIKA” communal bank which is located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department. 

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a grocery store where she also sells vegetables like onions, tomatoes, carrots and potatoes, among other vegetables.  She works from 6am until 10pm and supports her children with this work.  She wants to expand the grocery store and is asking for a loan to buy stock items for it like: rice, sugar, oil and milk at wholesale and also to buy vegetables.

She is happy about the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Wangnignigbe Ste Rita Group

texts.fr: WANGNIGNIGBE STE RITA est un groupe constitué de quatre personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Christine Ayaba. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Christine Ayaba est née en 1949 dans une ville du Bénin et est mariée à  un certain Adolphe. Le couple à cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont un reste encore à leur charge. Christine Ayaba a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Christine Ayaba mène comme activité la vente des céréales (maïs, riz, haricot) et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Christine Ayaba exerce cette activité depuis près de dix ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Christine Ayaba s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Ce quatrième prêt permettra certainement à Christine Ayaba et aux autres membres du groupe WANGNIGNIGBE STE RITA, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Wangnignigbe Ste Rita is a group made up of four people, whose president (with her hand raised in the photo) is called Christine Ayaba. The group members live in the same quarter in Benin. In order to boost their working capital, they are seeking a fourth credit from ALIDé. Christine Ayaba was born in 1949 in a town in Benin and is married to a man called Adolphe with whom she has five children, who all attend school. They have another child in their care. Christine Ayaba attended school up to secondary level. 
In order to meet her family's needs, Christine Ayaba sells cereals (corn, rice and beans) and charcoal from her home. She has worked in this field for nearly ten years, and the business that she generates enables her to see to her family's various needs. She sources her goods from one of the main markets in Benin.  This fourth loan will enable Christine Ayaba and the other members of the Wangnignigbe Ste Rita group to boost their business levels and to grow their customer base and revenues.

loans.use: to purchase cereals (rice, corn and beans) and charcoal

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; el Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Benedicto; el socio tiene 46 años de edad;  es casado y tiene 7 hijos de 22, 20, 12, 17, 4, 3, 2 años de edad; el socio trabaja en su propia casa el tiene una carpintería y su conyugue una chichería en la misma casa, el socio desea el crédito para poder comprar madera la por mayor y poder realizar trabajos como catres, roperos para exhibirlos y venderlos a sus vecinos, el socio trabaja más de 20 años en carpintería y con su propio negocio trabaja 10 años. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en a compra de madera.

El socio agradece el préstamo que se le otorgara y se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas de manera disciplinada.
texts.en:
Benedicto belongs to the communal bank, "Cristo Asención de Rumichaca."  The bank is located in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Benedicto is 46; is married; and has 7 children who are 22, 20, 12, 17, 4, 3, and 2.  He works in his own home as a carpenter.  His wife has a "chichería," (a place for making a corn beer) in their house as well.  He would like this loan to buy wood wholesale to make his projects like folding beds and wardrobes to display and to sell to his neighbors.  He has worked in carpentry for more than 20 years and has had his own business for more than 10 years.  He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of wood.

He is thankful for the loan that is being offered him, and he promises to comply with his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es: Ana Maribel D. 54 años D. edad habita en su casa con sus tres hijos que ya son mayores D. edad y su esposo José santos L.. Ana posee una pequeña tienda cerca D. su hogar D. residencia. La zona es D. fácil acceso y es muy concurrida por los habitantes del lugar. Ana es una mujer emprendedora y ella desea ver su negocio florecer con el objetivo D. mejorar su condición D. vida y la D. su familia. Este negocio ha sido la principal fuente D. ingreso para Ana desD. hace 10 años y gracias a la ayuda que le brinda su esposo han logrado mantenerlo activo todo este tiempo. Ana desea abastecer su negocio con variedad D. productos D. tienda para atraer a más clientes y D. esta forma lograr su objetivo. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en variedad D. artículos como: granos básicos (azúcar, arroz, frijoles y maíz), aceite, detergente, productos D. belleza, papel, etc. que son los productos más atractivos para los clientes y los más demandados. No pierD. la fe que D. esta manera logrará aspirar a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Ana Maribel is 54 years old. She lives in her house with her three children who are grown, and her husband José Santos L.. Ana has a small store close to her house. The area has easy access and is frequented by its residents. Ana is an enterprising woman and she wants to see her business flourish in order to improve her lifestyle and that of her family. This business has been the main source of income for Ana for 10 years. Thanks to her husband's help, they have been able to keep it going all of this time. Ana wants to supply her business with a variety of store products in order to attract more customers and meet her goal. This has motivated her to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in a variety of products such as: basic grains (sugar, rice, beans and corn), oil, detergent, beauty products, paper, etc. These are the products that are the most attractive for the customers and have the highest demand. She hasn't lost faith that in this way she will be able to have a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains (sugar, rice, beans and corn), oil, detergent, beauty products, paper, etc.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children. 

Firas has owned a cafeteria since 2007; he prepares popular Iraqi food. He has a lot of experience in this field and a good reputation. His cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $1500 loan to purchase new furniture, a refrigerator, and a split air conditioner. He is aiming to make more profit to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture, a refrigerator, and a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Many Cambodians make their living as farmers. One of them is Phin, who is 44 years old and has been working in this sector since 1998. Currently, Phin and her husband grow rice on farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. Phin is able to earn about 2 USD per day. This humble couple has two children, one of whom is school-aged and another who works in a Phnom Penh factory as a garment worker and earns a low monthly salary. 

The couple planted rice during this growing season but it is not doing well due to crop disease and the lack of fertilizer. Because of this, Phin and her husband are requesting a Kiva loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticide. Their increased income will improve the family’s standard of living. Phim is very thankful to all the lenders that help her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Hooks

texts.en:
Hooks is a 29-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife. He is an experienced construction worker. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 15 years. He works on his own and he is talented at creating original gypsum decorations. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools. In that way, he will be able to carry out more work. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening his own shop and working with some construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to renew his business tools

loans.name: Mirian Del Rosario

texts.es: Este cliente era originario de  Quezalguaque y se desempeña como conserje del instituto Rubén  Darío de la misma población con 23 años  de laborar, además también tiene un pequeño negocio atravez de ahorro de su salario, el que tiene 10 años de ejercerlo como es la venta de Ropa y Calzados, esto en busca como tener otros ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, su unidad familiar está compuesta por  2 hijos de los cuales 1 está bajo su cargo y estudia en el colegio de la localidad, también ha sido cliente de esta empresa desde el 2004, con 4 créditos recibidos.
texts.en: This client is from Quezalguaque and works as a receptionist in the Instituto Rubén  Darío in the same area. She also has a small business which she started with her savings from her salary. She has had this business for ten years, selling clothing and shoes. She does this in order to make an extra income and improve her living conditions. She has two children, one of whom is under her care and attends school in the area. She has been a customer of this foundation since 2004, and has taken out four loans.

loans.use: to purchase varied clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi est une femme  âgé(e) de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un technicien dans une société de la place. Elle a 01 enfant âgé de 02ans non scolarisé. 
Essi travaille comme coiffeuse et ajoute à cette activité la vente de charbons de bois (un combustible utilisé par les femmes togolaise) et  du mais. Elle vend à tout le monde à la maison. 
Essi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons et du maïs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité avec les profits réalisés. 
Dans les prochaines années, Essi voudrait augmenter son niveau d’activité.
texts.en:
Essi is a 32-year-old woman who is married to a mechanic in a local company. She has a 2-year-old child, who is not in school. Essi works as a hairdresser and has included with this business the sale of charcoal (a fuel used by Togolese women) and corn. She sells to everybody from out of her house. 

Essi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy sacks of charcoal and corn. She wants to reinvest in her business by using the profits she makes. In the next few years, Essi would like to increase her level of business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and corn

loans.name: Ma'rifat

texts.ru: Маърифат проживает в районе Пяндж. Она замужем. Ей 43 года. Она имеет шестерых детей. Ее муж находится в России. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Более 20 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает овощи и еще она занимается нарезкой и торговлей моркови для приготовления плова. Она берет кредит для покупки овощей и фруктов.
texts.en: Ma'rifat lives in the Pyandj district.  She is 43 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband is in Russia.  She has a secondary education.  Ma'rifat has been involved in sales at a market for over 20 years.  She primarily sells vegetables and is also involved in cutting and selling carrots for preparing pilaf.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives now with her beloved husband. Jocelyn sells a variety of products in her general store to earn a living, and she has been in this type of business for two years. Each month, she is able to earn revenue in the amount of 3,500 Philippines pesos (Php). She requested a loan in the amount of Php 7,000 to buy additional goods to vend. 

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC. She is now in her second loan cycle. Jocelyn hopes to expand her business to earn supplementary revenue for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase basic goods for her general store.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz  de 36 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Durán”.
El negocio de ella es la venta de cosméticos como: perfumes, desodorantes, cremas, etc.
Ella inicio esta actividad hace 3 años con la ayuda de una vecina. 
El horario de ella es de 9:00am hasta 16:00pm.
La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia y que a veces los clientes no le pagan en la fecha indicada, entonces esto la atrasas.
Tiene una hijo de 13 años, estudia en colegio público.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y para la compra de mercadería como: cremas, prendas de vestir, perfumes.
El sueño de ella es aumentar sus ventas y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Luz is 36 years old and lives in a suburban area called Durán. She has a business selling cosmetics such as perfumes, deodorants, crèmes, and other products. Luz started this business three years ago with the help of a neighbor. Her schedule is from 9am to 4pm. The difficulty she must face is crime. Sometimes her customers do not pay on the date they promised, so this sets her back.

Luz has a 13-year-old son who attends a public high school. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business so that she can buy merchandise such as crèmes, jewelry, and perfumes. Her dream is to increase her sales so that her business can continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, jewelry, and perfumes.

loans.name: Sisimukha S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sisimukha Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Sisimukha SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice  takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sisimukha SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 22 años es una mujer luchadora. Pues vive en compañía de su mamá Reina y su hijas Idania a la que cuida sola; en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Aymará. Cuando apenas tenía 2 años falleció su papá, desde entonces su vida no fue muy sencilla. Pues tenía que apoyar a su mamá. Por lo que aprendió de ella el cuidado de animales. Ahora se dedica a la compra y venta de ovejas y cerdos, siempre tiene 20 ejemplares de las que poco a poco va incrementando y vendiendo en la feria agropecuaria de cotocoto, donde obtiene buenas ganancias; pues es conocida entre los comerciantes. Asimismo comparte su actividad con la siembra de tubérculos como: papa, olluco, mashua y oca, los cuales siembra en sus 2 terrenos productivos. Con la ganancia que obtiene, compra los alimentos de sus animales, como también comida balanceada para sus cerdos. Con ello espera obtener unos animales de calidad. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los pinos” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Sonia, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa y alfalfa.
texts.en:
22-year-old Sonia is a tenacious woman.  She lives with her mom, Reina, and her daughter, Idania, who she cares for alone in their own home, which is located in the small village of Aymará.  When she was barely 2 years old her dad died.  From then on, Sonia's life wasn't very simple as she had to support her mom.  She learned how to care for animals from her mom.  Now her business is buying and selling sheep and pigs.  She always has 20 animals and she is gradually increasing this number.  She sells her animals in the livestock market in Cotocoto where she makes good profits as she is well known amongst the traders.  In addition to this work, Sonia also grows tubers such as potatoes, olluco, mashua and oca (native tubers).  She grows these on her two plots of farmland.  She uses the profits that she makes to buy feed for her animals.  She also buys nutritionally-balanced feed for her pigs.  She does this in the hope of obtaining good-quality animals.

Sonia belongs to the 'Los Pinos' community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can realize her plans.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Sonia enjoys being a member of her bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  With your support, Sonia will invest the money she has requested in buying natural fertilizers to spread over her potato and alfalfa crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Brigido

texts.en:
Brigido is a simple farmer with simple dreams in life.  He has been planting rice crops in his one hectare of rice fields for 31 years. He is married with three children.  Of his three children, two of them are settled in marriage and live separately, while the youngest is still studying. 

Brigido works hard to sustain his family's daily needs and to send his youngest child to a higher level of education.  He plans to increase his rice production so that he can generate greater profits every crop season.  Brigido has been spending his income on his family's daily needs; children's allowance; electricity bills; irrigation fees and his obligations to traders who have high interest rates.  Thus, to avoid having debts to traders with high rates, Brigido is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 which would allow him to purchase farm supplies from traders with low interest rates to improve his farming business. This would mean a lot to him, because he could proviD. the necessary plant care for his rice crops.  He hopes to have an ongoing partnership with the lenders so that he can support his youngest child pursue his studies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es: Melchora es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte, tiene 65 años, es madre de 3 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de Artesanías en la ciudad del Cusco, es socia de Finca desde hace 14 años, los créditos que saca lo invierte siempre en su negocio, ella se siente muy agradecida con Morenita (Fundadora de FINCA Perú) porque le enseñó a invertir bien su dinero, a ahorrar, a dirigir su negocio, a ser puntual y responsable con el dinero y la familia. A Melchora le gusta las charlas que dan en cada reunión. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de lana de Ovino para sus artesanías. Su meta es seguir creciendo para apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Melchora is a member of the communal bank "Buena Suerte."  She is 65 years old, and is the mother of 3 children.  She has a business selling handicrafts in the city of Cusco.  She has been a member of FINCA for 14 years, and she always invests the loans she takes in her business.  She feels very grateful to Morenita (the founder of FINCA Peru), because he taught her to invest her money well, to save, to manage her business and to be punctual and responsible with the money and with her family.  Melchora enjoys the talks that are given at each meeting.  She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of sheep's wool for her handicrafts.  Her goal is to continue to grow so that that she can support her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep's wool

loans.name: Ovadan

texts.ru: Овадан проживает в районе Джиликул. Она не замужем. Ей 27 лет. Овадан живет вместе с родителями. Ее отец находится на заработках в России. Сама она имеет средне - специальное образование. Уже девять лет как она преподает в средней школе района. Кроме того она занимается растениеводством. В этой области Овадан 11 лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Ovadan lives in the Jilikul region. She is not married.  She is 27 years old. Ovadan lives with her parents. Her father is away earning money in Russia. She has a vocational education. For the last 9 years she has been teaching in the regional high school. In addition to that, she has been growing crops for the last 11 years.  The purpose of the loan is to purchase mineral fertilizer for the planting of winter wheat.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Agustin

texts.es:
José Agustina tiene 53 años es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

José Agustín  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa.
Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
José Agustín, 53, is married and lives with his wife and children in the Aguas Frías de Mocache rural community in the Mocache Canton.

The communal bank EL PROGRESO is located in the same community and belongs to the Mocache Canton.  Its members are short-cycle crop farmers who grow corn and rice.

José Agustín is a farmer who grows corn and rice on his own land.  He buys supplies in Mocache and sells his produce at the market in Mocache.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and compost for his crops.  The loan will help him increase his income to provide for his family and to invest in planting.  His dream is to buy a house.

He enjoys playing sports in his free time.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and compost for his crops.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is 50 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. He is single. Mario has a fish vending business, earning approximately PHP 3,000 each month from it. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell. Mario has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, he hopes to save money to own a fishing boat. Mario is an honest and responsible person and a hardworking son. Mario is an active member of PMPC, willing to particapate in any of PMPC's activities.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.pt:
A senhora  Halima é assistente técnica da saúde tem 39 anos de idade é casada e mãe de 3 filhos todos a estudar vive na casa própria e sustenta também sua mãe enviando lhe dinheiro .
Diz que com este crédito irá legalizar o seu espaço , comprar cimento,  areia, pedra para dar inίcio a sua  obra. 
Diz ter aplicado o empréstimo anterior na construçāo de sua casa e que a mesma se encontra numa zona de dificil acesso devido as chuvas que actualmente assolam a zona, dai a necessidade de um novo espaco e tem como sonho fazer mais um filho, adiquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal.
Desafios: insuficiência de fundos e elevado custo de vida para ultrapassá los faz uma conta onde faz depósitos como forma de poupar, diz ainda vai solicitar mais emprestimos como forma de atingir seus objectivos.
texts.en:
A senhora  Halima é assistente técnica da saúde tem 39 anos de idade é casada e mãe de 3 filhos todos a estudar vive na casa própria e sustenta também sua mãe enviando lhe dinheiro .
Diz que com este crédito irá legalizar o seu espaço , comprar cimento,  areia, pedra para dar inίcio a sua  obra. 
Diz ter aplicado o empréstimo anterior na construçāo de sua casa e que a mesma se encontra numa zona de dificil acesso devido as chuvas que actualmente assolam a zona, dai a necessidade de um novo espaco e tem como sonho fazer mais um filho, adiquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal.
Desafios: insuficiência de fundos e elevado custo de vida para ultrapassá los faz uma conta onde faz depósitos como forma de poupar, diz ainda vai solicitar mais emprestimos como forma de atingir seus objectivos.

loans.use: para comprar cimento,  areia, pedra e legalizar o seu espaco

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 54 years old. He is married with three children. He has had a motorcycle transport business for five years. He will be using the loan to purchase another motorcycle to be able to serve more customers in the area. He hopes this will help him to get more income to educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy more motorcycles and expand his transport business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle to be able to serve more customers in the area and get more income to educate his children.

loans.name: Rember Saturnino

texts.es: Rember es un hombre trabajador de 39 años que tiene 3 hijos y vive en la localidad rural de Cabanaconde, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva; Rember además se dedica a la agricultura orgánica, especialmente al cultivo de papa, así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder sembrar papa orgánica, es decir, para comprar semilla orgánica de papa y para preparar el terreno agrícola con abono orgánico. En el futuro espera poder brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y contar con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.

loans.use: Para comprar semilla orgánica de papa y abono orgánico para obtener una cosecha de mejor calidad y mayor rendimiento

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 46 years old is a resident who from Kratie province. For her living condition, she is growing cassava and soybean to get income. She can earn more income for her family via rice cropping. She has been with her businesses for 28 years and it returned her to save from daily income about 5 USD per day. Because of lacking fertilizer, she could not get good yield from her farm in this year. For Mom, this is her second micro loan with VisionFund and she has paid back her past loan. She can improve her family’s business and her living condition better than before. Mom will use her loan portion to buy more fertilizer, seed input her farm and pay for plowing fee in order support her farmland grow well. She hopes that this new loan can make her family’s standard live in better condition than last year.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer, seed input her farm and pay for plowing fee in order support her farmland grow well.

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en: Mihail had been a soccer player in Bulgaria for 10 years, before, in his own words, “things started to fall apart.”  For the past several years, he has been playing the drums in several bands in Sliven, performing at weddings and other celebrations.  While he has no formal music education, his entire family was comprised of musicians growing up, and it seems as second nature to him.  He is 30 years old and has two kids.  When not playing music or touring, Mihail and his wife operate a hamburger-like stand in the Roma section of town.   Every summer for the past several years, Mihail and his wife have gone to the Black Sea coast for work.  Last summer, Mihail began to play with “Southern Nights” orchestra in Sunny Beach.  While Mihail plays, his wife does hair braiding and styling on the street for tourists.    This loan will be used to finance the upfront costs for this summer’s work; travel expenses, instrument tuning and the purchase of this year’s uniform.  The loan duration is 1 year, although we expect the preponderance of the loan to be repaid in a shorter time frame.   Lenders interested in learning more about the Roma culture in Bulgaria might find “Bury Me Standing: The Gypsies and Their Journey” by Isabel Fonseca to be helpful.  The book was published in 1995 and is widely available.

loans.use: Instrument repair and uniform

loans.name: Leutu

texts.en:
Leutu tells that when she heard about the SPBD loans, she thought of starting a business so she can join the SPBD Centre at Vailoa Tai. Leutu’s family have a store and it was run by the auntie. Towards the end of the year, the auntie decided to move to New Zealand and therefore Leutu and the husband looked after the shop. When she got the shop, she joined the Vailoa Tai Centre.

Leutu’s first loan was 750 tala (US$ 300), and she used it to buy more stock for her small shop. The amount was not enough for any further improvements. On her 2nd loan of 1,250 tala (US$ 500), she thought of extending the building, and she did so with the help of her husband who is a good carpenter. The business went well. With the extra profit she had in her purse, she thought of saving it.

After the second loan, Leutu was entitled to a 2,250 tala (US$ 900) loan, and thought of another business. She tried the pancakes but it didn’t work, so she saved the rest of the loan. She said that one day while she was in the shop, a car stopped by her shop and asked if there’s any nearby Laundromat in the area. That is when she got the idea of extending the building for the Laundromat. So she hurriedly paid up her loan, and ready for the next loan.

On Leutu’s 3rd loan that she saved, plus this 4th loan, she was able to buy 2 washing machines. With the profit from the shop plus her savings, she was able to buy two Dryers. “Two washing machines and two dryers are good enough to start up with,”  she said.

loans.use: Purchase of washing machines and dryers for a laundromat business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum K. is 44 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 3 children.  Her husband is a mirror cutter, and can make $9/day, while Chum K. makes close to $10/day selling fried noodles along the road.  She is using this loan to buy some equipment for her restaurant.  As she earns more money, Chum K. would like to start a clothing shop with 10 sewing machines, and also to build a house to rent to garment factory workers.  If these businesses are successful, she would very much like to pay for all 3 of her children to go to University.

loans.use: To buy cooking equipment for her foodstall

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 23 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband works outside the city in the fields, and therefore she has to sustain her family selling clothing. She travels to offer her merchandise in several communities close to San Cristobal de las Casas. She is a member of the "10th of April" group #4, together with Ms. Lucia Huacash Moshan (who has a grocery store).

Ms. Cristina wants to invest the loan to buy more clothing to increase her sales, and Ms. Lucia wants to buy non-perishable food to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

CRISTINA TIENE 23 AÑOS , CASADA CON TRES HIJOS SU ESPOSO ESTA FUERA DE LA CIUDAD TRABAJANDO EN EL CAMPO , ES POR ESO QUE ELLA SOSTIENE AHORA SU HOGAR CON SU TRABAJO VENDIENDO ROPA Y SALIENDO A OFRECER SU MERCADERIA A LAS DISTINTAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS A SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS.PERTENECE AL GRUPO 10 DE ABRIL 4. JUNTO CON DOÑA LUCIA HUACASH MOSHAN ( TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES )

CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR DOÑA CRISTINA COMPRANDO MAS ROPA PARA AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y DOÑA LUCIA COMPRANDO ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES PARA ABASTECER SU LOCAL .

loans.use: Clothing Sales

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.en: Maria Etelvina

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is a single mother of 6 children. At this time, only the last girl, who is 8 years old, lives with her. She is solely in charge of the care and education of this girl as her other children are now responsible for the well being of their respective families.

She started raising pigs on her own initiative some years back, and started by buying a couple pigs. Little by little with patience and dedication, she has been successful and thanks to her profits, she has been able to improve the area where her pigs resiD. and to repair the corral so they have a suitable place to keep them safe.

Maria Teresa is worried about the daily feeding and upkeep of the pigs, due to the fact that she now has a considerable amount of animals and in addition to the anticipated requests of her clients. To alleviate her concerns, she’s asking for a loan of $350 with a promise to pay it back in 6 months. This amount will allow her to buy food to proviD. her pigs with a balanced diet so that she can fulfill the demand. Let’s do what's possible to fulfill her request so that she can continue to better herself.

Translated from Spanish by, Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Teresa es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales sólo la ultima niña D. 8 años permanece con ella; encargándose enteramente del cuidado y la educación D. la misma, ya que sus otros hijos velan por el bienestar D. sus respectivas familias.Empezó con el negocio D. la crianza D. cerditos por iniciativa propia hace unos años atrás, compró para este fin una pareja D. cerditos, y poco a poco con paciencia y dedicación fue viendo los resultados, gracias a los logros que obtuvo se dedicó D. lleno a esta actividad aprovechando el espacio que tiene en su huerta y acondicionó un corral adecuado para tenerlos a buen recaudo.La preocupación D. Maria Teresa es el D. alimentarlos diariamente, debido a que tiene una cantidad considerable D. animalitos y esto se suman las peticiones anticipadas D. sus clientes.Para contrarrestar esta preocupación solicita 350 dólares con un compromiso D. pago D. seis meses esta cantidad le permitirá comprar los alimentos balanceados para sus cerditos a fin D. cumplir con la demanda que se ha presentado. Hagamos posible su petición para que siga cobijando dentro D. su corazón esperanzas D. superación.

loans.use: To buy food and provide a balanced diet for her animals

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther I. is a businesswoman who has a shop in which she sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She is 50 years old, the married mother of 6 children. She is a native of Benin, Edo State and has been in this business over 4 years. She has been a LAPO member over 3 years. Esther is requesting a loan of US$ 1,175. This will enable her buy provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for resale.

loans.use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is 29 years old, married and has two children who are 8 and 5 years old.

She is a teacher on the Warnes faculty, and she also sells clothing on the side. He husband is a driver for the KASKOTE company.

Cecilia has enough experience in both businesses and has some competition because there are other people who offer the same services and products in the same area.

This petition for a loan is so that she can purchase clothing and stock her business because the demand for these articles grows at this time of year, and also because the prices depend on the quality of the fabric and the finishing. The origin of the clothing also affects the price.

Cecilia’s loan history is financially sound.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Cecilia es una señora de 29 años de edad esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad.

Cecilia es maestra en el magisterio de Warnes, adicionalmente y de forma paralela se dedica al comercio de ropa. Su esposo es chofer de la empresa KASKOTE.

Cecilia tiene experiencia bastante experiencia en las dos actividades que realiza, su competencia es de nivel medio ya que también hay otras personas que ofrecen los mismos servicios y productos en la misma zona inclusive.

La presente solicitud es para que pueda adquirir y surtir su negocio de ropa ya que la demanda de estos artículos incrementa en esta época del año, por otra parte los precios de los mismos dependen de la calidad de la tela y acabado, tambien prepondera en el precio la procedencia de la prenda.

Los antecedentes de Cecilia son buenos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Aged 27, Madame Yawa K. is married and mother of two children. She runs a very profitable business selling dried chillis. The income from her business goes towards her household expenses. To increase the profit from her business, Madame K. is asking for a loan of $250 to build up a substantial stock of chillis, which can be resold during times of shortage. This will allow her to increase her revenue and better provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 27 ans, Madame K. Yawa est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente du piment séché qui est très rentable. Les revenus de son commerce lui permettent de contribuer aux charges du foyer. Pour mieux rentabiliser son activité, Madame K. sollicite un financement de $250 pour faire un stock consistant de piment et revendre en période de pénurie. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock up on chillis

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Mrs. Yang K., 50, is a mother of eight children who works as a farmer, making about $2 a day of profit. To supplement the household income, her husband, Mr. Chreo Chroeun, 53, also works as a farmer and earns $2 a day of profit. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a plot of land to farm in order to produce more income.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for farming in order to produce more income.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen S. and Mr. Tom Sothi live together with their two children in the Kork Chombak Village, Phnom Penh City. They are garment workers in the Hope Well garment factory, earning an average of $5 per day. Their children are students. Because of her business, S. can further her children’s studies and pay for her family’s living expenses. She is now asking for a $1200 loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and to convert her old house into a grocery-selling business location.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and to convert her old house into a grocery-selling business.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia is an excellent client. In addition to being very humble, she is responsible and punctual in her payments. She previously received a group loan with a group named ‘Pensamiento,’ in which she had no problem in the repayment of her loans since they were all paid on time.

To help maintain her family, she sells plants and has her own nursery where she grows all types of plants. She also helps her husband, who is a carrier, with the maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Hortencia Y. es una excelenta cliente, ademas D. ser muy humilD. es una persona responsable y muy puntual en sus cuotas, la Sra. trabajó con un Credito D. grupo el cual se llamaba Pensamiento, en el mismo tampoco tuvo problemas en el pago D. sus cuotas, ya que todas las canceló puntualmente. Para ayudar a mantener a su familia ella trabaja vendiendo Plantas, posee su Vivero donD. cultiva todo tipo D. plantas, además ayuda a su esposo - que es transportista - con el mantenimiento D. su vehiculo.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and plants for her nursery.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
Saida Q. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. She stays at home and takes care of their family animals - she breeds cattle. Now, she decided to purchase couple of bull calfs, feed them to prepare them for the season, and sell them in Fall for a better price. This will give her an opportunity to earn additional income and contribute to development of farming sector in her region. If calfs will be well fed, then the buyer will be able to purchase quality product. To achieve all that, she needs to obtain a credit. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонова Саида житвет в городе Вахдат. Ей 37 лет, замужем и имеет 5 детей. Домохозяйка , которая занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. На данный момент решила купить пару молодых бычков , откормить их в сезон , осенью продать по более выгодной цене. Это даст возможность ей заработать , а так же помочь развитию животноводческого сектора. Если телята будут хорошо откормлены , то покупатель сможет купить хороший товар. Чтобы всего этого достичь ей необходимо получить кредит. А погасить его она сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the amount of livestock

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Mr. Ham E. is a motorbike-taxi driver in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Phal Num, is a farmer. They have five children: three are attending school; while two others remain at home because they are too young to work or study. The family members live under poor conditions because Mr. Ham E. and his wife can only generate a small income. Thus, Mr. Ham E. would like to start a pig breeding business, and is asking for a loan to buy pigs. He hopes this new business will help improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Because of the variety and taste of the delicious breads they bake, the family of Luz Marina is very popular in their locality; to the extent that their bread has become an essential part of their customers’ daily diet. As a result, Luz Marina built a clay oven in her house and every day, with the help of two junior assistants, she bakes and delivers delicious bread to various grocery stores in her town, Juliaca.

With your support, this diligent and enterprising mother would like to purchase flour and enlarge her oven so that she can bake and sell more bread.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La familia de Luz Marina es muy popular en su localidad debido a que siempre se caracterizó por los deliciosos y variados panes que elaboran, complaciendo de esta manera el paladar de sus asiduos clientes, quienes encuentran en este producto uno de sus indispensables alimentos.Es por ello que sin pensarlo dos veces, Luz Marina decidió instalar su propio horno de barro al interior de su casa, todas las mañanas, con el apoyo de 2 jóvenes trabajadores, se encarga de hornear y elaborar deliciosos panes que son distribuidos en las diferentes bodegas de su ciudad, Juliaca, el deseo de esta diligente y emprendedora madre es ampliar su negocio, ella espera recibir vuestro apoyo, préstamo que le permitirá adquirir materia prima (harina) e implementar su horno, para así aumentar el volumen de producción de sus panes.

loans.use: Purchase of flour and enlargement of her clay oven for baking bread.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Madame A.  Afi est née à Agomé-Tomégbé en 1965. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du foyer grâce aux revenus tirés de son activité : le commerce de cola. Elle a beaucoup d’expérience dans les travaux et maîtrise bien la conservation de cola et d’autres fruits. Ainsi, sollicite t-elle un financement qui va lui permettre d’étendre son commerce. Elle pourra donc augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi A. was born in Agomé-Tomégbé in 1965. Married and the mother of three children, she is able to defray household expenses with the earnings from her cola business. She has a lot of experience in this trade and is highly skilled at making preserves from cola and other fruits. She is requesting a loan that would permit her to expand her business. She would then be able to increase her income to improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cola Trade

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok P. (pictured with her nephew) is a widow with one daughter, who lives in a small village along National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sok has been a garment factory worker for over one year. She wants to create another business rearing pigs. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase pigs for raising and to repair her nephew's motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase pig for raising and repair motorbike.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia pertenece al Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Mujeres Lideres”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco de diferentes variedades en una mesa ubicado en una de las calles del mercado Nº 02 de la ciudad. 

Con este crédito de S/.700, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará pescado fresco de diferentes variedades y tamaños que le permitirá variar sus precios y vender más, sobre todo satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

La señora Lidia tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 05 hijos. Trabajan duro para salir adelante sacrificando otras necesidades pero poco a poco están viendo los resultados. Más adelante quiere contar con un puesto fijo en el interior del mercado porque donde vende no es un puesto seguro y no es propio.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to the Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto "Mujeres Lideres" and lives in San Martín region and province, Tarapoto district. She is 50 and lives with her husband and five children. She sells different varieties of fresh fish from a table in one of the streets of the city’s no. 2 market. With this 700 sol loan, which she will repay in six months, Lidia will buy different varieties and sizes of fresh fish, which will allow her to vary her prices, sell more, and, above all, meet her customers’ needs. She and her family are working hard to get ahead, sacrificing other necessities but gradually getting results. Later Lidia wants to have a set location inside the market because where she is selling now is not secure or clean enough.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different varieties of fresh fish

loans.name: Nesiba

texts.en:
Nesiba was born in 1948. She lives in Kotorsko, an agricultural village in Bosnia. She is married and lives with her husband who receives a retirement pension of 400KM/month, (about $261USD). She also has an adult son, who continues to live with her.

To support her family, Nesiba grows vegetables and raises chickens and cows.  She has had four microfinance loans in the past, all of which she repaid successfully. She used the first two loans to buy calves, the third loan to buy chickens, and the fourth loan to buy food for her cows. Her husband helps her in the field and with taking care of the animals.

Nesiba requests a loan of 1,500KM from Women for Women, International, to purchase food for her three cows. In the future, she hopes to use another loan to purchase another calf.

loans.use: To purchase food for cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of a large quantity of goods for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase of raw materials for their dyeing business

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de klinkamé non loin d’agoè à lomé, elle a pour activité la vente des articles de mercerie, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004 et s’approvisionne au marché de hedzranawoé, elle a une boutique qu’elle a appelé « EL SADAI ».
