Actuellement la demande de sa clientèle a beaucoup augmenté, elle est une cliente régulière de wages qui a déjà obenu 03 prêt de 500000F qu’elle a bien remboursé, pour satisfaire ses clients, elle demande à wages un crédit de 300000F. Pour acheter 40 fils à broder, 25 rouleaux de sortie, 100 boutons. Elle est mariée et a 03 enfants, son mari est un commerçant
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Klinkamé district, not far from Agoè in Lomé. She sells sewing notions, a business she began in 2004. She does her buying in the market at Hedzranawoé. She has a shop that she calls « EL SADAI ». Presently the needs of her clientele have grown a lot. She is a regular client of WAGES and has already received 3 loans of 500,000 F which she has correctly reimbursed. In order to satisfy her customers, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 300,000 F to buy 40 spools of embroidery thread, 25 rolls of sortie, and 100 buttons. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a merchant.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. makes a living selling foodstuffs and soup ingredients. She has been in this business for a long time.

She is now requesting a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell.

Grace is 45 years old and married with 7 children. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es muy empeñosa en las cosas que realiza, pues tiene que alimentar a tres pequeños hijos y hacerse responsable de su educación, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, de quien está separada hace varios años. Una de las actividades que realiza con más frecuencia es la venta de tamales, los cuales son consumidos a la hora del desayuno, pues son unos deliciosos aperitivos a base de maíz con relleno de carne muy solicitados por las madres de familia. Doña Juana hace 12 años se dedica a la preparación de estos productos, pues tiene el don de la cocina y sus  tamales son lo mejor que sabe preparar, es por ello que son muy solicitados en los mercados y las ferias. Además cuando ha habido oportunidad, los ha preparado para grandes eventos o ferias de gastronomía. Juana desea seguir preparando estos deliciosos tamales, pero su mayor limitación es que no tiene una movilidad para trasladar sus productos a los diversos lugares donde tiene que entregar sus pedidos, es por ello que su máximo sueño es adquirir un auto para movilizarse, minimizando de esta manera sus gastos de producción. Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP, y desea seguir perteneciendo a este grupo de trabajo, pues junto a sus amigas aprendieron administrar su dinero, ya que tienen autonomía para organizarse y desarrollar habilidades dentro de su banco comunal. Juana  tiene pensado invertir 3500, por lo pronto, en la compra de un molino para agilizar la preparación de sus tamales, pues el que tiene es muy antiguo y necesita algunos repuestos.
texts.en:
Juana is very tenacious with the things she does, as she supports three small children and is also responsible for their education, and can no longer count on the support of her partner, with whom she separated many years ago. One of the activities Juana does frequently is to sell tamales, which are eaten at lunch time. They are delicious snacks made with corn and filled with meat and are very sought-after by other mothers.

Juana has been preparing these products for 12 years. She has a gift for cooking, and her tamales are the best she knows to make. It is because of this that they are so sought-after in the markets and fairs. She also has made them for large events and food festivals.

Juana would like to continue to prepare these delicious tamales, but her biggest limitation is that she is unable to transport her products to fill her orders. Due to this, her greatest dream is to acquire a vehicle to move her products, minimizing the costs of production.

This is her tenth loan with MFP (a Kiva Partner), and she wishes to continue her membership with this group, as together with her friends, she was able to learn to administer her money, and she had the autonomy to organize and develop her skills with her community bank. Juana hopes to invest 3500 as soon as possible, to buy a new mill to speed the production of her tamales, as the one she has is very old and needs repair.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new mill for corn

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny es una mujer soltera, que a sus 25 años lucha por mejorar su futuro, vive en un cuarto que alquiló cuando llego a Puno desde su natal Desaguadero (Distrito de Puno) y espera forjarse una buena vida. Desde muy niña le gustó la cocina, sentía mucha felicidad jugando con los utensilios de su madre y le encantaba verla cocinar para toda su familia, actualmente tiene una tienda de utensilios de cocina en el centro de la ciudad, ella trae los utensilios desde Desaguadero y los vende a muy buen precio a los clientes que concurren a su tienda. Lleva ya 5 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es escoger los novedosos modelos que traerá para vender a Puno, ya que le gusta ver que sus clientes tengan una gran variedad de dónde escoger. Lo que no le gusta es tener que viajar constantemente para adquirir los utensilios, puesto que se cansa mucho en el camino. Fanny desea que su tienda sea más grande en el futuro y se convierta en una de las más importantes de la ciudad. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, puesto que sabe que ellas confían plenamente en ella. Fanny invertirá los mil trescientos nuevos soles solicitados en comprar más mercadería de para abastecer mejor sus tienda de utensilios.
texts.en:
Fanny is a single woman, who at her 25 years of age fights to improve her life in the future. She lives in a room she rented when she arrived in Puno from her native Desaguadero (Puno District) and she hopes to forge a good life for her. Since she was a little girl he liked cooking, she was very happy playing with the tools of her mother and she loved watching her cook for all her family. At present, she has a store of kitchen tools in the center of the city, she brings the tools from Desaguadero and sells them at very good price to her clients. She has had her business for 5 years and what she likes more is to choose the novelty products that she brings to sell to Puno since he likes seeing her clients having a big variety to choose from. What she doesn't like is having to travel constantly to acquire the tools, since she gets very tired from the trip. Fanny wishes to have a bigger store in the fututre and to turn into one of the most important of the city.This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva's partner) and she is ready to repay all of her quotas on time, since she doesn't want to affect the other partners of her communal bank, because she knows that they trust her. Fanny will invest the loan in buying more merchandise to better supply her kitchen tools store.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine O. A. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through junior high. Augustine is a plastic molder who makes lots of things, including car lights, for sale at Siwdo (near Cape Coast), which he has done since 1999. His wife is a trader. Augustine uses his income to pay for food, clothing, fees, bills, etc. Augustine will use the loan to purchase more raw materials for plastic products. With the new profits from his expanded business, Augustine plans to reinvest back in the expansion of his plastic molding business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for the making of the plastic products

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S. is 55 years old and the divorced mother of two children. One of her children sells groceries while the other one attends the local public school.

Mrs. S. is a domestic nurse who owns a pharmacy with different kinds of medicine for sale. She also examines the patients who live near her house in the village. She has had this business since 1972. In order to meet patient demands, Mrs. S. would like a loan for $1100 to purchase additional medicine. She plans to use the rest of the loan for her child's grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase additional medicine.

loans.name: Redemtda

texts.en:
Redemtda has been a tomato and vegetable seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for two years. She belongs to the Serengeti loan group (code 2080). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works at her business for seven hours.

Redemtda is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more tomatoes and vegetable for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Redemtda is 30 years old, married, and has four children: ages 10, 8, 5 and 2. She also cares for five dependents.

loans.use: Buy tomatotes and vegetables.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
el señor Romulo M. A. tiene 45 años de edad,  esta casado con la señora Silvia Posada quienes viven en la aldea el Jocote a un kilometro de la fuerza naval de Honduras. Tienen una hija de seis años de edad y esta en la escuela.
 
don Romulo y doña Silvia trabajan juntos, se dedican a la venta de mariscos y tambien tienen una pulperia, los mariscos los vende en el amatillo, nacaome, langue. Los transportan en autobus.
 
Romulo necesita el prestamo para cubrir varios pedidos de camaron, pescado ya que con el dinero que dispone no cubre con todos los costos de la mercaderia a comprar.
 
su mayor sueño es comprar un carro para transportar los productos ya que la distancia donde compran la mercaderia esta muy largo.
texts.en:
Mr. Romulo M. A. is 45 years old and married to Mrs. Silvia Posada. They live in the village of Jocote, about one kilometer away from the Honduras Navy base. They have a daughter who is six years old and in school. Romulo and Silvia work together selling seafood, which they transport on a bus to amatillo, nacome, and langue. They also have a small store. Romulo needs a loan to cover various orders of shrimp and fish. His current cash supply can't cover all the costs of buying merchandise. His dream is to buy a car to transport his products, as the distance to the market is very long.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shrimp and fish

loans.name: Ulalia

texts.en: Ulalia L., 40, is married with 3 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to the public and village people 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Ulalia expects her weekly net cash flow to be 190 Tala (~ 110USD).  SPBD loans are Ulalia’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knives and weed killer.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (1422040498) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 50 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by T. from TYM Fund.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam is applying to Kiva for a second loan. He would like to buy tires and other necessary things for improving his business and he needs a loan of 2000 AZN for bringing about his plans.

loans.use: To buy tires and other necessary things

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban tiene 34 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso; vive con su esposa Silvia de 24 años y sus dos pequeños niños, Rosemary de 5 años y Juan de tan solo 9 meses, y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida. Su actividad es el transporte de pasajeros, es por eso que Esteban pasa sus días en busca de clientes que deseen abordar su motocarro, Él despierta muy temprano para realizar su trabajo y se queda hasta altas horas de la noche trabajando, con el único fin de llevar un buen dinero a su hogar, ya que es consiente que su familia lo necesita y tiene que velar por su tranquilidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros y hacerles pasar un momento agradable, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que dejar a su familia todo el día, pero sabe que lo tiene que hacer para darles mayores comodidades. Para el futuro espera poder comprar un nuevo motocarro para trabajar con él y tener mejores ingresos. Este es el cuarto préstamo al que accede Esteban con MFP, siempre ha sido puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere crearle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual participa activamente y es un socio muy querido. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las actuales ya están muy gastadas.
texts.en:
Esteban is 34 years old and a loving family man. He lives with he wife Silvia, 24, and his two small children Rosemary, 5, and Juan, just 9 months old. What he wants most is to give them a good life. His activity is passenger transportation, which is why Esteban spends his days looking for customers who want to take his motorcycle taxi. He gets up very early to do his job and stays working until late at night so that he can bring home money. He is aware that his family needs him and he is responsible for them. What he likes best about his work is talking to his passengers and helping them pass the time. He has been doing this for 9 years and thinks that the most difficult part of his work is having to leave his family all day, but he knows he has to do it to provide for them. In the future he hopes to buy a new motorcycle taxi to work with so he can have more income. This is Esteban´s fourth loan with MFP. He has always been on time with he payments since he does not want to cause problems for his communal bank. He actively participates in his bank and is a very well-liked member. With the money requested he will buy new tires for his taxi, since the ones it has are quite worn.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
X. Nguyễn Thị (20213050010) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  X. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đức Lân 01 (1).


X. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, X. works in a family member's business raising pigs for sale.  X. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.200.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, X. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  X. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the third loan taken out by X. from SEDA.  X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trần Thị T. (20213050011) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị S. (20213050012) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business running a general store.


3.  Đỗ Thị H. (20213050013) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


4.  Vũ Thị T. (20213050014) is a 36-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business making & selling food.


5.  Đăng Thị D. (20213050015) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 1.120.000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


X. Nguyễn Thị (20213050010) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  X. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đức Lân 01 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  X. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, X. kiếm được khoảng 2.200.000 VND.  Vào 2008, X. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  X. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trần Thị T. (20213050011) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị S. (20213050012) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


3.  Đỗ Thị H. (20213050013) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  Vũ Thị T. (20213050014) là 36 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


5.  Đăng Thị D. (20213050015) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.120.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: But

texts.en: But S., 31, is married and resides in Kompong Cham Province. She is engaged in the agriculture sector of growing few types of vegetable to serve the market’s need. She is able to earn an income of US $0.7 per day. To make a living, her husband is employed as a worker at the market in his village with an income of US $2.5 per day. S. really wants to improve her living standard and generate more income for the future’s education of her children. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US $300 to purchase fertilizer to make her crops grow efficiently. She hopes that her proper plan of expanding the outputs of the crop will help her to achieve the successful goal for the family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mondong

texts.en:
Mondong M. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and pulses, such as lentils, beans and peas, to sell. Mondong is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has five children who all go to school. With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a clinic in the nearby market.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of rice and pulses

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 24 years old and single. He lives with his parents and four siblings. He started his business as a way to look after himself and his family. Mohammed owns a small store with various products such as mirrors, paintings, and other decorations. Lately, Mohammed has seen an increase in his number of clients, and he needs a $2000 loan to buy merchandise so he can provide a greater variety of products for his clients. He appreciates your belief in him and your support in improving and expanding his business.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Gulaya

texts.en: Gulaya M. is a 59-year-old woman who is engaged in the poultry breeding business. She has more than 20 years of experience in this field and poultry is the only financial source for her family. She raises and sells turkey, which is very popular among local people. Gulaya has had a very difficult life.  She is an internally displaced person who suffered during the Azerbaijan-Armenian war in 1992. During the war, she lost everything, her house, her business and most important, her child. Gulaya and her husband do believe that a new loan will help them to improve their living conditions and bring more income.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ly O. leads a group of four people.  All four live in Prey Lieb village in Takeo province. Mrs. O. is a farmer who owns a plot of land, where she cultivates rice. She does not have enough money buy fertilizer for the rice field, so she is seeking a loan to buy the fertilizer. Mrs. Ly O. is widowed, and has a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support a rice field.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es una joven madre de 22 años, vive con su pareja (Leonidas) que tiene 24 años, y con sus 2 pequeños hijos: Salvador de 4 y María Fernanda de 3. Ellos viven juntos, muy felices en su acogedora casa que es propia.

Ella se dedica al cultivo de papa y alverja en las tierras que trabaja con su esposo, Lucila lo ayuda en ocasiones, sobre todo cuando  la crianza de sus hijos le permite tener un tiempo adicional. Le gusta apoyarlo en la chacra porque sabe que es un trabajo bastante cansado, pero obtienen buenas ganancias económicas que les permite vivir holgadamente y no pasar ningún tipo de necesidad económica. Adicionalmente, Lucila cría toros, chanchos y gallinas, y con la venta de estos animales también genera ganancias diA.. Esta joven familia ya tiene pensado en el futuro tener una chacra más grande y propia, en la que puedan cultivar más vegetales y tubérculos.
A pesar de su juventud, Lucila piensa en trabajar y salir adelante, porque sabe que la vida en el campo no es fácil y quiere que sus hijos tengan asegurada su educación, es por eso que tanto ella como su esposo se sacrifican y han aceptado muy seriamente el rol de padres que les tocó empezar tan jóvenes. 

Este es el segundo préstamo de Lucila con MFP y está segura de ser puntual en cada pago, porque desea tener otros créditos para llegar a concretar sus planes. Además, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, porque está integrado por personas que ella conoce de hace mucho tiempo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono y fertilizantes para que su chacra pueda producir sin problemas.
texts.en:
Lucila is a young, 22 year-old mother who lives with her 24 year old husband (Leonidas) and her two small children: Salvador (4) and María Fernanda (3). They live together in their own cozy home. She and her husband grow potatoes and peas. Lucila helps whenever she can, when she is not too busy caring for their children. She likes helping her husband on the farm because she knows that it’s tiring work, but they make a good living which allows them to meet their financial needs and live comfortably. Lucila also raises cattle, pigs, and chickens. The sale of these animals provides a daily income. This young family is already looking toward the future and wants to have a larger farm on their own land where they can raise more vegetables and tubers. Despite her youth, Lucila plans to work to get ahead because she knows that life in the country is not easy and she wants to be able to pay for a good education for her children. This is why she and her husband sacrifice so much and have seriously taken on the role of parents. This will be Lucila’s second loan through MFP and she is certain to be on time with every payment because she would like to be able to obtain additional loans in the future in order to help meet her goals. She is also very happy with her communal bank because it is run by people she has known for a long time. She will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer so that her farm will be more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es: María Carmen P. D. F. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos menores D. edad. Ella es propietaria D. un negocio en el cual hace y venD. tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado D. Santa Tecla y cada medio día ella se encarga D. hacer y repartir las tortillas, con la ayuda D. sus hijos, los cuales van D. puesto en puesto en el mercado dejando su productos el cual se entrega por encargos. D. esta forma es como María ha logrado mantener su negocio D. una manera estable, y ha podido ayudarle a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. María solícita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz, el cual es la materia prima D. su negocio, así mismo poder comprar más cilindros D. gas propano.
texts.en:
María Carmen P. D. F. is 40 years old. She lives in Santa Tecla, in the La Libertad district, with her husband and her five young children. Her business is making and selling tortillas, which she runs from the Santa Tecla market. Every day at noon, she makes the tortillas, and distributes them with the help of her children, who drop off the number ordered at stands in the market. Her business has been stable, and she has been able to help her husband with household expenses. Maria requests a loan to buy corn (her raw material) as well as additional cylinders of propane.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 43 years old, widowed, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jovito owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products such as processed soya milk, locally called "taho" (a combination of soya milk and sugar syrup), in the local community. Jovito has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Jovito joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jovito is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 40 years old and married with seven children, between the ages of 6 months and 17 years, 5 of whom are attending school. He's been a dairy farmer in the Litein area of the South Rift Valley of Kenya for ten years and previously owned a "hotel" (small restaurant). He sells his milk at "hotels" in the local community and also runs a small retail shop and sells his tea crop. He says that the main challenges to his business are lack of water and feed for the cows and diseases that infect the animals.

He requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 50,000 to purchase a dairy cow. In the future, he would like to have three good quality cows producing over 60 litres of milk per day and to own his own chaff cutter to cut feed. He says that this loan will help him improve his family's health through better nutrition and enable him to pay his children's school fees.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers access to medical aid. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su padre y una hermana en el sector Licapa del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se desempeña como mototaxista, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace cinco años, el nos comenta que alquilaba mototaxis (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) y que con las ganancias de esta actividad solventaba sus gastos personales y ayudaba al sostenimiento de su hogar.

Hace ocho meses pudo adquirir una mototaxi nueva y actualmente trabaja desde las cuatro de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche. Su vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad.

Marcos es un joven muy conocido y estimado por sus vecinos, los que lo consideran un chico responsable y tranquilo. En la fotografía aparece apoyando a su padre en la refacción del techo de su vivienda, ya que su vehículo se encuentra actualmente en el taller.
texts.en:
Marcos, age 21, is single and lives with his father and a sister. They live in the Licapa sector of the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He works as a taxi driver in a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and people). He has been doing this for five years. He says that he rented mototaxis, and he used his earnings from this activity to pay personal expenses and to help support his household. Eight months ago he was able to get a new mototaxi. He currently works from four in the morning until nine at night. His vehicle has started to have problems from excessive use. That is why he has seen the need to request, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 PEN. He plans to use the loan for the repair and maintenance of his mototaxi. Marcos is a young man who is well known and highly regarded by his neighbors. They consider him to be responsible and calm. In the photograph he is helping his father repair the roof of his house because his vehicle is currently in the shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for his vehicle

loans.name: Aida Concepcion

texts.es:
Esta cliente es de la comunidad la quimera y se dedica a dar clase de primaria y tiene 15 años a dedicarce a esta actividad.
Y con los financiamientosn que ha adquirido ha logrado desarrollarce en su hogar y ademas a logrado venir preparando la educacion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client is from La Quimera. She has been a primary school teacher for 15 years. The loans she has had have made it possible for her to develop in her home and have also allowed for the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay university tuition and taxes.

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yuon Y. is 56 years old and she lives in Krang Roluos village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Savoeun Chey, are farmers who own a 1.50 hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Savoeun Chey is a palm juice collector from sugar palm, earning a small income to support his family.

Mrs. Yuon Y. is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming and to buy bamboo and firewood to support her husband's business. Mrs. Yuon Y. is the mother of three children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the last one is an electrician. 

Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to buy bamboo and firewood

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe L. works in someone else's business operating a motor transport service. He is a 26-year-old single man from the village of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Pepe has been  in this business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Pepe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Pepe is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Greisly

texts.es:
LA SRA GREISLY ESTA CASADA, VIVE EN CASA DE SU SUEGROS TIENE UN HIJITO QUE TIENE DOS AÑITOS, SU CONYUGE ES CHOFER DE TRUFI (TRANSPORTE URBANO QUE PRESTA SERVICIO A PASAJEROS EN LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA). eLLA VIVE EN SACABA UNA DE LAS PROVINCIAS MAS POBLADAS DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA, DONDE EMPRENDER ABRIO NO HACE MUCHO UNA DE SUS AGENCIAS. 

LA SRA. GREISLY SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO VENDE PRODUCTOS DE USO DOMESTICO EN UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO QUE TIENE EN LA CASA DE SU SUEGRADONDE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMO PAN, ABARROTES ( MACARRONES , ARROZ Y OTROS) , LA SUEGRA TIENE UN PUESTO DE VENTA EN EL MERCADO DE PAPA CANCHA EN EL DISTRITO DE SACABA LO CUAL DE DIO PRESTADO UNA TIENDA A GREISLY PARA QUE PUEDA VENDER ELLA. EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITO ES PARA AUMENTO DE CAPITAL Y PODER SURTIR EL NEGOCIO QUE TIENE. UNO DE LOS DESEOS DE LA SRA. GREISLY ES EL DE COMPRARSE UN TERRENO Y HACER CONSTRUIR SU CASITA, ES UN APERSONA JOVEN TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Greisly is married and lives with her in-laws and 2-year old son. Her spouse is a trufi driver (public transportation driver in Cochabamba city). She lives in Sacaba, one of the most highly populated provinces in Cochabamba, where Emprender recently opened a branch. Greisly sells household products in a neighborhood store, located in her mother-in-law's house. She sells bread and groceries (macaroni, rice, etc.). Her mother-in-law has a market stall in the Papa Cancha market in Sacaba district and lends the store space to Greisly so she can earn income. The loan Greisly is requesting will allow her to supply her business. One of Greisly's hopes is to buy land to build her own house. She is a hardworking, responsible young woman and is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for entrusting her with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Mrs. Thon C. is 43 years old. She is a villager who lives in Daom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Mean Ngoung, is a rice mill laborer who receives a small income to support his family. Even with both businesses, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Thon C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With a new loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions. This couple has three children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the last one is a student in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah C. is from the village of Magalalag, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 33 years old. Sarah is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Sarah owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Sarah has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. Sarah said the income earned in the business is of great help in supporting their daily needs.

In 2007, Sarah joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. Sarah is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feeds and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Sarah from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Ramani Chandrika

texts.en:
Ramani Chandrika is a 39-year-old married woman living with her husband and five sons, in the southern Sri Lankan town of Hikkaduwa. Her husband is helping her. They are very close and work well together.

Ramani manages a business of pot-making; ten  years ago she started this business. She has a very positive mood and is enthusiastic about her business.

She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy clay and a machine for handicraft production

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 33 year-old man who supplies water to local residents, hotels, restaurants and other food kiosks.  He has been in this business for 10 years and has 3 employees. He only has one source of water, and that limitation sometimes causes delays.  In addition to supplying water, Joseph also sells kerosene and paraffin. 

Joseph plans to use this loan to purchase an additional handcart and to buy additional stock of kerosene for resale.

In the future, Joseph hopes to secure a brighter future for his family through entrepreneurship.  In 5 years, his ambition is to purchase an automated pump machine for the sale of paraffin.

Joseph describes himself as hardworking, social, and honest.

loans.use: To purchase an additional hand cart and to buy kerosene for resale

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina M. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental Province.  Dorina is 35, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Dorina owns and operates "tricycle" (three-wheeled motorcycle taxi) transport services. Dorina has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Dorina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Dorina is requesting her sixth loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair a tricycle motorcycle engine. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a "tricycle" motorcycle taxi engine.

loans.name: Thelma Del Socorro

texts.es: Thelma del Socorro tiene 54 años, por lo que tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a su pulpería. Ya que esta es la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar por lo que siempre está pensando en ampliar su inventario. Esta no es su primera experiencia con financiamientos, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por mejorar su negocio. Ubicado en su actividad en su humilde vivienda, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar los granos básicos y otras cosas necesarias para el hogar. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima y así aumentar su inventario con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Thelma del Socorro is 54 years old, and she has had her local store for more than 5 years. As this is the means of generating income for her home she is always thinking of increasing her stock. This is not her first experience with financing, as she has always characterized it as a way of improving her business. Her business is located in her humble home, and the majority of her customers always come searching for basic grains and other things necessary for the home. This loan is for the purchase of raw material to increase her stock with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is a  resident in the city of Multan, the fourth largest city of Pakistan. She lives in a three room brick house with her family. Her husband runs a thread selling business. He supplies thread to different thread sellers to earn an income. Shamshad does embroidery work to financially support her family. She is very competent in her work and gets regular orders. 

Shamshad has five children: four sons and a daughter. All of them are illiterate except her daughter who is getting a religious education. Her first three sons work and one son stays at home. One of her sons has a business making bed-sheets A second son does labor work and the third is working in a factory. 

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan amount she will buy embroider material such as beads, clothes, sketches and colored thread in bulk and improve her embroidery business.  This is her first loan cycle with MFI. She is hopeful that this investment will help her business grow.

loans.use: Purchase embroideyr material in bulk to improve her embroidey business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda A. is from the village of San Juan. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Yolanda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) at Elmina. She has no educational background. She is married and lives with her four children.

Aba has been selling kenkey for some time now and responsibly supports her husband in educating her children.

Aba’s loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to prepare more kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of maize to prepare more kenkey for sale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. Amina established her restaurant business three years ago. Her main customers are neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is theft. Amina hopes to run a big restaurant in the future. In addition, she operates a video library business and a real estate rental agency. 

She decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures and accessibility to sustainable financial services. With the loan of Kshs 35,000, Amina wants to purchase a bundle of maize flour, a sack of rice and plates to serve food for her restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, rice and plates to serve food.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes S. is from the village of Brgy, Bangaan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old. Agnes is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Agnes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid her previous loan of 9,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP that she will use to increase the variety of products she sells. This loan will be Agnes' third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template which enables its field partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with two grown children. He is a farmer from the small town of Vodyanoye. There are basically no jobs to be found in this town which is why Alexander decided to try his luck in farming 10 years ago. He has constructed 5 big arch greenhouses to grow early spring vegetables and sell them wholesale. Alexander has already invested 70,000 Grivnyas in his business. Every year he spends about 10,000 – 12,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film to protect greenhouses. 

Alexander has recently purchased two farmland lots. He is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to build one or possibly two greenhouses on his new property. The agricultural business is very prospective in this region where there are barely any other employment options. Alexander is hoping to expand his venture and receive additional profit from increased sales.

loans.use: to construct an additional greenhouse

loans.name: Lidia Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Corao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Lidia Verónica; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende todo tipo de textilería como mantas, alfombras, la socia vende en las ferias que se realizan en el distrito de Corao, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Lidia Verónica is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Coylloritti de Ccorao”, which is located in the District of Corao, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 25 years old and a single mother with one child. Lidia Verónica divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling handicrafts. She sells all types of textiles such as blankets and rugs. Lidia Verónica sells at the fairs held in the District of Corao. She works from 9am until 6pm. Lidia Verónica wants to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts in bulk.

She is grateful to those who helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts in bulk to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene U. is 29 years old, married, and has one child. Married to Angelo U., a fish vendor, she makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough for them to have a better life. She has been managing her fish vending business for many years.

Mylene has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for over a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow a number of times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more fish to sell in the market.  She dreams that her business will continue to grow and she have her own stall.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother and father. Esther has a business sewing sponges. She has been in this business for 4 years, and works 7 days a week. She sells her products  from home. 

Esther has requested a loan of 600000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, to buy raw materials to make more sponges. Her main business challenges are transportation and defaulters. Her goal for her business is to own permanent business premises. She lives in a home that she rents, and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make sponges

loans.name: Pel

texts.en:
Pel M. is a 54-year-old married woman who currently lives in the province of Kompong Tom.  Pel M. and her husband have five children, two of whom are single and the remaining three are married.

 Pel M. has a piece of land that she inherited from her grandparents. She and and her husband earn an income by planting rice. She is currently growing a rice crop and a vegetable crop that she planted more than two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizer to get  her crop growing well.

loans.use: To buy  fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Alborada Group

texts.es: ESTA FOTO FUE TOMADA EN EL NEGOCIO DE LA SEÑORA  NARCIZA G. A. UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO ALBORADA QUE ESTÁ UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE PUEBLA EN MÉXICO.  ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS DE MAIZ QUE INICIÓ DESDE HACE 12 AÑOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAIZ Y GAS. SUS CLIENTES OPINAN  QUE LAS TORTILLAS DE DOÑA NARCIZA SON LAS MEJORES DEL PUEBLO YA QUE SIEMPRE ESTAN CALIENTITAS Y ADEMÁS DE QUE LAS REALIZA CON MUCHA HIGIENE. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE MUY CONTENTA  Y AGRADECIDA. DESEA QUE SUS HIJOS LOGREN TERMINAR SUS ESTUDIOS. TIENE 40 AÑOS, ESTUDIÓ SÓLO PRIMARIA, ES CASADA Y TIENE EN TOTAL 3 HIJOS: 2 VARONES Y 1 MUJER. QUIERE ESTE CREDITO PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACIÓN DE TORTILLAS. TAMBIEN ESPERA QUE CON EL PRESTAMO PUEDA MEJORAR SU LOCAL DONDE SE ENCUENTRA SU NEGOCIO. EL GRUPO ESTÁ CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Narciza G.A.'s business.  Narciza is a member of the 'Alborada' group that is located in the State of Puebla, Mexico.

Narciza's business is selling corn tortillas.  She started the business 12 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn and gas.  Her customers are of the opinion that Narciza's tortillas are the best in town since they are always nice and warm and she pays a lot of attention to hygiene.

As she requests this loan, Narciza feels very happy and grateful.  She would like her children to finish their studies.  Narciza herself only studied at elementary school level.  She is 40 years old, married, and has three children: two boys and one girl.  She would like this loan to buy supplies for making tortillas.  She also hopes to use this loan to improve her business premises.  This group has 9 members.

loans.use: To buy corn and gas

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is from the town of Banga. She is 27 years old, married and has two young children. To make a living, Annie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Annie works hard to provide her family with a better standard of living.
Annie is in need of additional seed and fertilzer. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her harvest.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon Y. was born in 1966 and she lives in Preaek Ta In village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Uon Thy, are farmers who own a plot that they use to cultivate rice to support their family. The couple has four children: one of whom is a soup seller, one is a laborer, and one is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the youngest child is two years old. 

Mrs. Lon Y. would like to request a loan to buy a water machine and rice seeds to support their rice farming.  She will use the remaining loan funds to buy two piglets for breeding.  Mr. Uon Thy also works as a fisherman, a job in which he earns a little additional income to support his family. The couple is together in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and rice seeds for growing rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase women's dresses, shorts, shirts, and denim skirts

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna C. (in the photo) is 32 years-old and his wife, Mrs. Sotom Soem is 35 years-old.  They have married since 1999 and have two young sons. The family lives in a small village along National Road number five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Veasna is a garment factory worker. His wife sells "sluch" or shaved ice dessert and cake in her village. He hopes to build a new house to live in, but he does not have money. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: to build a new house to live in

loans.name: Mary Love

texts.en:
Mary Love P. is from the city of San Roque Ozamiz City. She is 26 years old,  single, and has one infant child. To make a living, Mary Love owns and operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Mary Love has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Mary Love joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Love has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Mary Love is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be Mary Love's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con su familia y su hijo de 2 años y medio, él se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdo, lo realiza hace 3 años y lo aprendió de sus padres, comercializa los cerdos y el ganado los miércoles y domingo, que son los días de comercio de Corinto.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de concentrado para los cerdos y alimento para el ganado, este préstamo le ayudara a cubrir el gasto y tendrá como alimentar a sus animales durante un tiempo.
Su objetivo es ampliarse con el número de ganado y cerdos, ya que de él dependen sus ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old and resides in Corinto in the Department of Morazán. He lives with his family, which includes his 2½ year old son. José has been raising cattle and pigs for three years and learned this trade from his parents. He sells the animals on Wednesdays and Sundays since these are the designated trade days in Corinto.

At the moment, he is requesting a loan to buy feed for his pigs and cattle. This loan will help cover his expenses and provide enough food to feed his animals for a while. His goal is to increase the number of cattle and pigs in his possession. He depends on the income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his pigs and cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a peanut vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional peanuts to sell. 

Salvacion has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from retailing rice, fattening pigs, and wholesaling soft drinks. 

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and of being able to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Armanda

texts.es: Armanda, de 46 años, vive con Adan, de 48 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos pero solo viven con 2 de ellos José 20 y Jeancarlos de 12 años en su casa propia en el pueblo de Palcamayo. En sus tres terrenos de cultivo que posee, todos los días sale a sembrar arvejas y espinaca; los cuida, riega y fertiliza durante tres meses aproximadamente; tiempo suficiente para poder venderlos en el mercado central de su localidad. Menciona además que hay temporadas en los cuales la demanda es mayor, por ello viaja a la capital para poder ofrecerlos a mayor precio. Desde niña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y producirla, sabe cuando son las temporadas de cultivo, cuando venderlas y a que precio. Durante todo este tiempo siempre le disgusto ver como se malograban sus productos, debido a la constante helada que asota el sur del país. Pero eso no la desanima, al contrario desea seguir trabajando para poder progresar en el desarrollo tecnificado de la arveja y espinaca, además que aprendió a combatir la plaga de insectos y sacar productos de mejor calidad. Por ahora está trabajando con más incentivo, ya que muy pronto su pequeño hijo comenzará un nivel más en sus estudios, por lo que planea ahorrar más para brindarle un buen estudio universitario. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, y este es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece la ayuda que le brinda su asociación  ya que con ello puede trabajar e invertir más. Con el crédito solicitado comprará semilla de arveja y espinaca, asimismo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Armanda is 46 years old.  She lives with 48 year-old Adan and they have five children together.  They live with two of their children, 20 year-old José and 12 year-old Jeancarlos, in their own home, in the village of Palcamayo.

Armanda goes out every day to grow peas and spinach on the three plots of farmland that she owns.  She cares for the plants, irrigates them and fertilizes them for approximately three months.  She then sells them in the central market in her village.  She says that there are seasons in which demand is higher and during those seasons she travels to the capital to sell her products at a higher price.

Armanda was taught to work the land from an early age.  She knows when the growing seasons are, when to sell her produce and at what price.  During all these years, it has always upset her to see her crops fail owing to the constant frost that affects the south of the country.  However, she does not get discouraged.  On the contrary, she would like to continue working so that she can make progress, using modern technology to develop her pea and spinach crops.  She also learned how to fight pest infestations and produce better-quality products.

For now, Armanda has more incentive for her work as her young son is about to start a new level in his studies.  She plans to save more so that she can provide him with a good university education.

Armanda is a member of the "Patrón San Cristóbal" community bank and this is her tenth loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the help that her bank has given her since it has enabled her to work and invest more.  She will use her loan to buy pea and spinach seeds.  She will also buy several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy pea and spinach seeds as well as sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su familia, y tiene 6 años de estar dedicándose a la crianza y comercio de cerdos, con este negocio este cubriendo todas las necesidades de su hogar.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado y vacunas, con esta ayuda podrá velar por la salud de los cerdos y darles una buena alimentación, con la esperanza que le dé un mejor resultado la granja al comercializar los cerdos.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, tener un buen número de cerdos en la granja y velar por todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
José lives with his family and has worked raising and selling pigs for six years. He covers all of the household needs with this business. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of concentrated feed and vaccines and with this support, he will be able to watch over his pigs’ health and provide them with a good diet. As a result, he hopes that the pigs on his farm sell better.

His dream is for his business to grow, to have a good number of pigs on the farm, and to look out for their needs.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and vaccines for his pigs.

loans.name: Taitus

texts.en:
Taitus, a 27-year-old, is married and has three children.   He owns rental houses, which earn him a living.  He has been operating the business for nine years.  In addition, he does farming. Through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to save his money and service his loans. This has helped him to improve his business. 

Taitus hopes to build more rental houses for more income generation in the future.  He has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate his rental houses.

loans.use: To renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino tiene 52 años, casado con Ernestina de 49 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Para Marcelino, el trabajo que realiza lo vitaliza, la innovación, creatividad, y el ser mejor cada día ha sido la clave de éxito en su vida. Es así que posee un taller de fabricación de muebles, en  donde sus clientes se sienten satisfechos con el trabajo que realiza. Sin embargo en su carpintería le faltan algunas cosas, pero se las ingenia de manera eficiente y eficaz para cumplir con sus compromisos de entrega en un tiempo record, y ya lleva 20 años laborando de manera constante. A pesar de que va mejorando sus ventas con respecto a los meses anteriores, el planea en el futuro adquirir máquinas para su carpintería, con el propósito de darle un mejor acabado a sus muebles. Su negocio está ubicado en un lugar estratégico dentro de su misma localidad, donde él trabaja de manera independiente, pero cuando lo hacen grandes pedidos, tiene a cargo de sus trabajadores que le puedan facilitar la fabricación en un menor tiempo. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto pide la colaboración de ustedes para desarrollar su negocio. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles comprará más herramientas de carpintería.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 52, is married to Ernestina, 49.  They have three children.  They live in their own house located in the middle of Canayre settlement in Llochegua District.  

For Marcelino, his work energizes him.  Innovation, creativity and being the best he can be day by day have been the keys to his success in life.  He has a furniture making shop where his customers feel satisfied with the work he does.  However, his carpentry shop still lacks some things.  Nevertheless, he figures out ways to efficiently and effectively meet his commitments and deliver in record time.  He’s been working non-stop for 20 years.

Despite improving sales compared to previous months he plans in future to acquire machinery for his carpentry aimed at giving his furniture better finishes.

His business is located in a strategic spot within his own community where he works independently.  When he gets large orders, though, he hires employees to help him get the work done more easily in a short period of time.

This will be his third loan with MFP so he’s asking for everyone’s collaboration to develop his business.  He will use the 1000 new soles to buy more carpentry tools.

loans.use: to buy tools to facilitate furniture manufacturing.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban, de sesenta y siete años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia. El posee una venta de medicina natural y ya se hizo de mucha clientela porque lo que produce es muy confiable tiene muy buenas referencias de clientes anteriores. Don Esteban es un hombre carismático lleno de energía y con todo el entusiasmo de salir adelante; su trabajo constante y dedicación han hecho de él, una persona exitosa y triunfadora, está dispuesto a llenar de éxitos su vida es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ingredientes naturales como cola de caballo, manzanilla, llantén, sen, ajo, romero entre otros, asi podra seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de las personas que lo visitan.  Esteban tiene fe que su fuente de ingresos le ayude a darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esteban is 77 years old and lives with his life partner and son in his own home.  He owns a natural medicines business and has a lot of customers because what he produces is very reliable.  He has very good references from previous customers.

Esteban is a charismatic man who is full of energy and all the enthusiasm he needs to get ahead.  His constant work and commitment have made him a successful man.  He is ready to fill his life with success and, for this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy natural ingredients such as field horsetail, chamomile, greater plantain, cassia senna, garlic, rosemary etc. so that he can continue meeting the needs of the people who visit him.  Esteban is confident that his source of income will help him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy field horsetail, chamomile, greater plantain, cassia senna, garlic and rosemary

loans.name: Koulthoum

texts.en:
Koulthoum, 54, is a married mother of one. Since 2007, she has owned a grocery store, which is a major source of income for her and her family. Koulthoum helps her husband in making their living and she is a hard worker who is loved by most of her customers. Her son and husband provide her with a lot of support and she improves her business as much as she can.

Koulthoum is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary goods for her shop in order to be well prepared for requests during the month of Holy Ramadan. She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two consecutive cycles and has a good standing payback history.

Koulthoum hopes to keep on taking good care of her customers and improving her business.

loans.use: to increase the stock of goods in her shop.

loans.name: Jyambere Mugore Group

texts.fr: Marie Gorette  est agricultrice, elle membre du groupe Jyamberemugore(elle est le membre du groupe de producteurs des pommes de terre et des maïs dans sa region,et les membre du groupe ont des grandes champs pour cultuves ces deux produits . Elle est mariée, elle est  âgé de 29 ans. Elle a  3 enfants entre 2 ans, 6mois et  6 ans, 6mois et 2 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle est né au  Rwanda.son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser le prêt pour acheter 10kgs de pommes de terre, 300kgs de maïs comme des semences , 2kgs d’engrais chimique, et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est d’augmenter les  quantités des produits et acheter les champs pour produire beaucoup plus pour les marches. Dans l’avenir il voudrait être  une grande agricultrice connue dans sa région, elle voudrait payer le minerval pour ses enfants, et construire une autre maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Gorette is a farmer and a member of the group Jyambere Mugore, a group of people who produce potatoes and corn in her region; the group members have large fields to grow these two products). She is married and is 29 years old. She has three children between two-and-a-half and six-and-a-half years old, and two of her children attend school. 

Marie Gorette was born in Rwanda. She finished eight years of primary school. This is her second loan with ACB. She intends to use the loan to buy 10 kilos of potatoes, 300 kilos of maize,  2 kilos of chemical fertilizer, and pay for labor.  Her strategy in growing her business is to add to the quantities of products and buy fields so as to produce much more to sell. In the future, she would like to be an important farmer, well-known in her region. She would like to pay school fees for her children and build another house for her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 kilos of potatoes, 300 kilos of maize seeds,  2 kilos of chemical fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, neither of whom is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grand children).  Jesca  has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.   Jesca sells her products in a shop. 

Jesca has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, with which she will buy more boxes of tomatoes, oranges and onions.  The main business challenges for Jesca include defaulters and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also to build her own house.  

Jesca lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, oranges and onions

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De Pando Group

texts.es:
LOS EMPRENDEDORES DE PANDO, es un grupo que trabaja con EDAPROSPO desde hace 5 meses, sus integrantes son personas dedicadas a actividades de comercio.
Sonia es socia del grupo, tiene 26 años, tiene un hijo, es una joven madre soltera; para llevar el sustento a su hogar trabaja vendiendo verduras y además se encuentra estudiando Cosmetología, ya que su gran sueño es aperturar un salón Spa.
El préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra de mercadería e invertir en sus estudios.
texts.en:
“Los Emprendedores de Pando” (The Entrepreneurs of Pando) is a group that has been working with EDAPROSPO for five months. The members are dedicated people who engage in their business activities.

Sonia, age 26, is a member of the group. She is a single mother with one child. Sonia sells vegetables in order to support her household, but she is also studying cosmetology. Her greatest wish is to open a spa.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise and invest in her studies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and to pay for her cosmetology studies.

loans.name: Rysbek

texts.ru: Рысбеку 41 год, женат и имеет двоих детей школьного возраста. Рысбек закончил Сельхозинститут и проработав 15 лет, обрел репутацию целеустремленного и упорного человека. В 2000 году Рысбек открыл свой собственный магазин по продаже автозапчастей, использовав стартовую сумму в 50,000 сом (KGS).  Сегодня его магазин известен среди автолюбителей качественным товаром и приемлемыми ценами. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Рысбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом на расширение ассортимента товаров.
