Ana would like very much to one day own a small restaurant or “soda” as they say in Costa Rica. She feels that such an enterprise would allow her to better provide for her children. She hopes to send as many of them as possible to university. In the meantime, Ana says business is going well and she hasn’t had any problems yet.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase five sacks of chicken feed and poultry medicine.

loans.name: Mercita

texts.en:
Mercita F. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 55 years old. Mercita is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Mercita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mercita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mercita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mercita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena Muñoz V. tiene 37 años de edad es madre soltera con un hijo de 17 años de edad que estudia en nivel secundaria viven junto a sus padres en zona rural comunidad Canco hacia el norte del Municipio de Colomi, La señora Elena nos cuenta que mas antes su actividad principal era producción agrícola lo cual no le fue bien económicamente, de tal modo ahora se dedica más a la actividad pecuaria venta de queso y leche.
 
La institución CIDRE tuvo la oportunidad de pasar por la zona, lo cual la señora Elena se acerco a consultarnos que necesita un crédito para comprar una cabeza de ganado vacuno lechero con cría y avena (forraje) para sus ganados, en la actividad pecuaria obtiene mejores ingresos económicamente que permite mantener en su estudio de su hijo hasta que salga profesional ya que ella no tenia oportunidad para terminar ni nivel primaria porque sus padres eran de pocos recursos económicos,  finalmente ella piensa vivir más cómodos junto a sus padres que son ya de la tercera edad.
texts.en:
Elena Muñoz V., 37, is a single mother of a 17-year-old son who is in secondary school. They live with her parents in a rural area of Canco towards the north of Colomi. Elena tells us that she used to be primarily a famer but didn’t do too well economically so she decided to go into animal raising and cheese and milk sales. CIDRE had the opportunity to travel through the area and Elena approached us to consult regarding her need of funds to buy a nursing dairy cow and oats (forage) for her cattle. Raising cattle provides the higher income and makes it possible for her to keep her son in school until he becomes a professional since she never had the chance to even finish elementary school because her parents were of such scarce resources. She intends finally to live more comfortably alongside her parents who are now senior citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cows and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet W. M. is twenty nine years old, married to a business man and they have two children, aged eleven years old and four years old. They hope to give their children a good education to the university level. Her business is located at Jua Kali market in Nairobi. She makes and sells metal boxes to the local people mostly found within the industrial area and also customers coming from far like Kikuyu and Kisumu. She has been doing this business for the last seven years and he says that this business is profitable. 

The major challenge that Janet has is lack of raw materials to make her end products and the fact that customers are not loyal since there are other people in the area doing the same business as hers. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more scrap metal to make more items to sell and grow her business. She hopes that one day she will be able buy her own a big piece of land while still doing her business. She describes herself as hardworking and dedicated to her work.

loans.use: Scrap metal

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel S. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. He is 31 years old. Ruel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruel owns & operates a general store, selling different commodities in the local community. Aside from that he also sells frames as his additional source of income. Ruel has been engaged in his businesses for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ruel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ruel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ruel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary D. is currently in the business of selling bread along the roadside and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour.  Mary is 48 years old and is married to a doctor. She has five children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida N. is into the production and sale of palm oil at Elmina. Vida has been through junior high school. She is married and lives together with her four children. Vida has been selling palm oil for 12 years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She wishes to increase the production of her palm oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To increase the production of her palm oil.

loans.name: Kipkorir

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Kipkorir is a resident of Litein Town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has four children, two of whom are already attending school. He has been farming, and selling his milk produce in the local market.

He applied for this loan of KES 40,000, his third with Juhudi Kilimo (his first and second loans were for KES 22,500 and KES 20,000 respectively), to purchase a dairy cow. He plans to use the income generated to educate his children and build a dairy unit for his animals. He hopes to maintain three purebred dairy cows on his farm in five years' time. He earns additional income from employment as an accountant.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
Bashorat lives in Kanibadam, Tajikistan, with her husband and four children. Bashorat is a entrepreneur who has been in the grocery business for three years. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to use as capital and generate additional profit. Bashorat hopes to see her business expand she is planning to buy at least one more grocery site at her market. Bashorat is very good with finances and knows how to manage money and investments. Her current loan request will allow her to maintain good product selection and continue to earn an adequate income to support herself and her family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Machell

texts.en:
Machell C. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old. Machell is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Machell owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling ready to wear clothing & shoe products from NATASHA, AVON & BOARDWALK in the local community. Machell has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Machell joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Machell is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like blankets & pillow cases. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Machell from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like blankets & pillow cases

loans.name: Rosa Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa T. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, su gente es muy cordial y amable quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su centro histórico es conocido por la belleza arquitectónica.

La Señora Rosa tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Rosa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, actividad que desempeña hace 2 años y labora solo los fines de semana desde las 9 a de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, los demás días de la semana se dedica a la atención de su papelería, este local lo tiene hace 15 años, labora en el desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y de domingo a domingo, en este trabajo recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, ya que también trabaja de domingo a domingo en el cuidado de dos ancianitos.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de de mas productos para su papelería, es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas con quienes en cada reunión salen de sus rutinas diarias. Su meta es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa T. is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Triunfadoras."  She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and its people are very friendly.  The people of this city maintain their culture and traditions.  The historic center of this city is known for its beautiful architecture.

Rosa is 38 years old, married and has 2 children aged 15 and 6 years.  Her oldest daughter is in high school, and her youngest son goes to a school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They don't have their own home so they live in a rented dwelling.

Rosa is a trader who sells all types of clothing.  She has been doing this work for 2 years, and works only on the weekends from 9am until 5pm.  The other days of the week she works in her stationery goods store, which she has had for 15 years.  There she works from 8am until 7 at night.  Her store is open every day, and her children help her run the store, since she also cares for two elderly people on a daily basis.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of more products for her stationery store.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 6 years, and she likes it because she has very good friends in the group, and she is able to leave her daily routines to attend the meetings.  Her goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, paper and other stationery products

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a grown daughter, Yulya. She sells groceries in one of the markets of Melitopol where she lives with her family. Svetlana is an experienced entrepreneur. She has been working in the sphere of market vending for 13 years. Presently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Svetlana is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to increase assorted merchandise she offers for sale at her vending kiosk. She is hoping to continue expanding her trade and support her family, as well as her elderly parents who can barely survive on their retirement fees and are financially dependent on her. Svetlana believes additional merchandise will help her generate additional income and ensure better living conditions for her entire family as a result.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Siem

texts.en: Mrs. Siem K. was born in 1962. She lives with her family in Kor village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Lot Lorn, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice and morning glories to sell. Currently they don’t have enough money for planting, so Mrs. Siem K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for their farm. The couple are working hard at their farming business in order to support their two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other, a farmer. The couple are pictured together.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for cultivating rice and morning glories

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda L. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Imelda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venturer running a sari-sari (variety) shop.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Imelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Mujeeb Begum's Group

texts.en:
Mujeeb begum lives in Depalpur, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is famous for its agricultural industry. She has resided there with her family for the past fifteen years in a two-room brick house in the small colony named Fazal elahi. She is a housewife and stays at home doing her household work. She is a very responsible person and makes the utmost effort to manage all of her responsibilities effectively. 

Her husband’s name is M. T., and he is involved in a stamp papers selling business. Stamp papers are used for any legal documentation. Mujeeb has given birth to two sons. Her eldest son works with his father in his business and supports him in his dealing with his customers while her youngest son is studying in class 8. 

Mujeeb has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son, who wants to start his own stamp papers selling business. He will utilize the loan to buy stamp papers in larger quantities to create a good beginning for his business. This has become Mujeeb’s family business, and she is confident that the loan investment will bring good financial changes to her son's business. 

She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. She is a responsible client and has always paid her loan installments on time.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Mujeeb begum.

loans.use: To buy stamp papers to sell

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en:
Marilyn R. is from the village of Siempre Viva Norte. She is 42 years old and the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marilyn R.'s Group.

Marilyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns a general store selling a variety of different products. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Buenerge

texts.es:
Don Buenerge, es un señor dedicado a la siembra de maíz y frijol, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, tiene 56 años de edad y vive en compañía de su esposa, y tres hijos de 22, 20 y 16 años de edad, Él trabaja la agricultura desde hace 35 años, todos los días de la semana y más cuando es la temporada de siembra o de recoger la cosecha.
Él actualmente necesita un préstamo, pues iniciara el proceso de preparación de tierras y comprara materiales agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes) ya que se acerca el invierno y es propicio para iniciar el proceso de siembra. Estos fondos le ayudaran a cubrir el gasto y podrá contar con lo necesario para cuidar este nuevo cultivo y esperar una buena cosecha.
Para él trabajar en la tierra es su principal objetivo, pues lleva tantos años en este oficio y que no piensa en abandonar esta labor, y seguir ayudando a su familia sobre todo a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Buenerge is a gentleman who works growing corn and beans.  He is 56 years old and lives in San Rafael Oriente, in San Miguel department, together with his wife and three children aged 22, 20 and 16.  He has been farming for 35 years and works every day of the week.  He works longer during the sowing and harvest seasons.

Buenerge currently needs a loan as he is starting the process of preparing his land and he needs to buy agricultural supplies (manure and fertilizers).  The winter is approaching and the time is right to start sowing his crops.  This loan will help him to cover the expense and he will have everything he needs to care for his new crops.  He hopes for a good harvest.

Buenerge's main goal is to work his land.  He has been in this business for many years and he does not plan to stop.  He will continue helping his family, in particular he will support his children in their education.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Harriette

texts.en:
Harriette is 32 years old. She is married. She sells clothes and has been in this business for one year. She has one employee and works daily from 7am until 8pm.

Harriette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more clothes to sell. With her additional profits, Harriette will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school.  He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Said has operated a vegetable stall business for the past four years, selling at the market to his friends and neighbours. Said faces a major challenge of the perishability of products and seasonality in his business. He dreams of becoming self-reliant and establishing a grocery shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to renovate his stall and purchase sacks of cabbages, potatoes and onions. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to renovate his stall and purchase sacks of cabbages, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Virgen Concevida  de Arin” se reúne cada treinta días en comunidad de Arin de la ciudad de Calca. Lugar conocido por pertenecer al Valle Sagrado de los Incas, por ser una zona muy agrícola y ganadera y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elisa, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un  hijo. 

Elisa es ama de casa y para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella es proveedora de  maíz  y papa. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes. Este es el onceavo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la confraternidad de sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Concevida de Arin” cooperative bank meets every thirty days in the Arin community of the city of Calca.  This area is known for belonging to the Sacred Valley of the Incas, for being an agricultural and livestock zone, and for the cheerfulness of its people.

Here is where we meet Elisa, who is 26 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has one child.

Elisa is a homemaker and, in order to generate her own income, she dedicates herself to farming and raising livestock, growing corn and potatoes.  She has been in this business for 15 years, and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her enterprise.

At this point, she needs a loan to buy fertilizers for her crops.  This is her eleventh cycle with the cooperative bank, and she enjoys the spirit of fraternity with her colleagues.

loans.use: buy fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Maria Emilse

texts.es:
Maria tiene 33 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y sus 05 hijos menores de edad.  Cuenta con casa propia la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Charan Coposo en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura. Maria vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

Maria se dedica a la  comercialización de animales menores, aves de corral en variedad y además de ovejas, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio,  los cuales son muy espaciosos.

Este negocio lo desarrolla en el mercado de Piura, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 6 años, en los que a adquirido experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija a su negocio. También se dedica a la agricultura, junto a su esposo trabajan su parcela que han heredado de sus padres, en dicha parcela cuenta con limón el cual lo cosechan semanalmente.

Maria está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para poder comprar animales con su respectivo alimento balanceado.  

Maria desea mejorar su calidad  de vida, con esfuerzo y trabajo. Cuenta con buenas referencias laborales, las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
María, age 33, lives with her husband and their five minor children.  She has her own house in Charan Coposo, a rural community in the Tambogrande district in Piura.  Even though María lives in the rural part of the district, she does have electricity.

María sells small farm animals, a variety of poultry, and sheep.  She raises them in pens, which are very spacious, behind her home.  She carries out her business at the Piura market.  She has been doing this for over six years.  She has acquired experience in the field, and she has a fixed customer base in her business.

She also devotes herself to agriculture.  Together with her husband, she works the plot of land that they inherited from their parents.  This plot has lemons, which they harvest weekly.

María is requesting a loan for 1,5000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will be able to buy animals and balanced feed with the loan.

María wishes to improve her quality of life through effort and work.  She has good work references.  The people who know her describe her as a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old and lives in Pob. 2, larin, Mis. Occ.  She is married with 3 children.

Jane has a shop that sells a variety of products.  She has had this business for 8 years.  She requested a loan to
purchased more products for her retail store business.

Jane has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: To purchased more products for her retail store business

loans.name: Diamoral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Ledit groupe est  constitué de dix femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou Bintou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge un de ses neveux.

Elle s’active dans la vente de savon. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique  depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 3, 2010. The group is made up of ten women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small-scale retail. 

Mrs. Fatou Bintou, the group's leader,  is on the right in the photo, with her hand raised. She is 32, married, and the mother of two children. She is also responsible for one of her nephews. Her business is selling soap. She has been doing this for several years and has plenty of experience.  This loan will allow her to increase her capital and strengthen her level of activity. With the profits, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is married and a mother of three school-age dependents. She is 43 years old and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Susana has a retail shop at home to earn a living. She has been engaged in this type of selling for 8 years. She sells basic food items, like rice and corn grains, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee and food in pouches.  Each month, she earns a total average of PHP 10,000.00 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.  Susana has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Susana hopes to expand her retail business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, 35, who is married to Serah and the father of six children, has been a  crop farmer for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES.3000.  Having repaid his first loan, John is now requesting his second one with KADET LTD to buy maize seeds and pay school fees for his son. He hopes to educate all of his children and become a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and pay school fees for his son.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus  is 65 years old, married to Pauline, and they have two school-going children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fifth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future,he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en: Kuruthum, who is in her mid-20s is single with two children: one of them in school.  She has been selling sodas, juice and water for the past year.  She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a very small monthly profit. This will be Kuruthum's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use to buy more sodas, juice and water. Her dream is to one day be able to send her children to good schools. She will share this loan with her loan group "Juhudi" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more soda, juice and water to sell.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is 26 years old. She got married couple of years ago and now lives with her husband, Valerian, and her mother-in-law in the village Gulgula, Kakheti District. Tea is an English teacher who teaches local children and youth. She gives lessons at home and is busy five days a week, earning a monthly income of 450 GEL. Her family also farms which provides an additional source of income, led by Valerian and his mother. 

Tea is requesting a loan to purchase materials and renovate her bathroom and kitchen. These two rooms in the house are in bad condition and this renovation will provide her family with a better house and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a kitchen and bathroom renovation

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
This is Anh, 41, a resident of H. Chi Minh City. She is married with two sons. 

Anh and her husband operate a general store. Their store sells many kinds of household products to the people in her community, such as instant noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks and confectionery. To help her to expand her business, Anh would like a loan to buy toiletries and beverages to expand the quantity and range of products sold by her store. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business and she hopes that this will enable her to better provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy toiletries and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Kulmira's Group

texts.en:
Kulmira is the leader of this group. She is 52 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two children; both of them are married and live independently from their mom. 

Kulmira works in the Center of Children and Youth Tourism and she is also engaged in livestock breeding. She has big experience in this sphere; she has been running her livestock breeding business for 29 years. With the profits gained from this business she was able to purchase a piece of land in Bishkek and a vehicle for her son. With money received from the loan Kulmira wants to purchase sheep for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future she plans to start building a house.



--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 42 years old and married to Salome. He supports four people in his family. He has been running a food stall for a period of two years. He applied for a previous loan of Kshs.40,000 from KADET LTD which he invested in dairy cows and repaid on time. He earns an income of Kshs 20000 per month. This second loan will be used to buy potatoes to sell. His profit will be used to buy a plot of land as he hopes to build rental houses in the future and also educate his children

loans.use: to buy potatoes for sale

loans.name: Lisbellia Viviana

texts.es: La Sra. Lisbellia es casada, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, ella es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene una pequeña librería, eligió este tipo de negocio ya que le gusta el comercio, lleva trabajando alrededor de 1 año, gana semanalmente S/ 494 nuevos soles. La Sra. Lisbellia  va a invertir el crédito otorgado en la compra de más mercadería (ropa) para la temporada primavera- verano. Sus sueños de Lisbellia  es tener una librería bien grande y dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ella esta muy agradecida por la confianza depositada en su persona ya que con el crédito otorgado va a poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lisbellia is married and has a one-year-old son.  She is a hardworking, tenacious woman with a strong desire to get ahead.  She sells clothes and has a small stationery shop.  She chose this business because she likes commerce.  She’s been working about a year and earns 494 new soles per week.

Lisbellia will use the granted loan to buy more merchandise (clothes) for the spring-summer season.  Lisbellia’s dream is to have a larger stationery shop and to provide her family with a better quality of life.  She is very grateful for the trust placed in her since the loan will help her improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu, 36, is a smart entrepreneur. She is involved in buying and selling sweets, beverages, cookies and other food at a prestigious city market. She is a very active young woman. She likes providing good service to her customers and is satisfied by it. She sells a wide variety of candy and cookies and her monthly income from selling is 120 AZN. She has about six years of experience in this field. 

Arzu is married and has two sons. Her husband helps her in running the business. 

Now she has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in case to purchase more goods and increase her profit.

loans.use: purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, de 43 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Dionicia, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Javier y Fresia a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Tapo. El nació en Anta, un pueblo alejado. Sus ganas de crecer lo motivaron a llegar a Tapo, que es más cercano a la ciudad, ahí aprendió lo que ahora es su pasión. La agricultura sus principales cultivos constan de maíz y papa. Pero como es un hombre muy sabio, armó una pequeña huerta en su casa, donde siembra toda variedad de hortaliza, que consume como alimento. De esa manera minimiza los gastos de alimentación de su casa. En todo este tiempo logró adquirir 6 parcelas de terreno productivo los que cuida con mucha dedicación. Además de las ovejas y vacas que posee, los cuales enseba para venderlos a un mayor precio. Le va muy bien en sus actividades, por ello espera juntar lo necesario y así obtener una mejor calidad de vida, con agua y luz.  Él pertenece al grupo solidario “santa rosa” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Ignacio de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en: Ignacio is 43 years old and is a hard-working man.  He lives with Dionicia, his wife of 20 years.  The couple have 6 children, but only 2 of their children live with them: Javier and Fresia, who are still under their care.  The family lives in their own house in the community of Tapo.  Ignacio was born in Anta, a distant town.  His desire to grow motivated him to move to Tapo, which is closer to the city.  It was there that he learned what is now his passion: agriculture.  His main crops consist of corn and potatoes.  However, Ignacio is a very wise man, and he also installed a small garden where he grows all kinds of vegetables that the family consumes as food, thus minimizing the household’s food expenses.  Over time he has managed to acquire 6 parcels of productive land, which he cares for with great dedication.  He also owns sheep and cows, which he raises to sell at a higher price.  These activities are going very well, and he hopes that with enough water and light he can get what he needs to improve his quality of life.  Ignacio belongs to the “Santa Rosa” solidarity group and this is his first loan with MFP, and he hopes that by working with them his plans can become a reality.  He promises to make his payments on time, as he has done with previous loans.  He also enjoys being part of his group because all of the members are responsible people and very supportive.  If Ignacio receives your support he will invest the money he is requesting in purchasing natural fertilizers that he will spread on his cornfields.

loans.use: to purchase bags of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María, vive en la ciudad de León, tiene 40 años de edad, es comerciante, vende ropa y calzado, casada, tiene 3 hijos. Ella inicio con  su negocio  a los 16 años de edad su madre  le enseño ya que vendía zapatos y poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia hasta lograr tener su negocio propio. Hoy en día vende ropa y zapato que compra en Honduras y en la ciudad de Managua y vende en la ciudad de León pues le gusta que su tienda ofrezca variedad. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientes durante la época navideña donde las ventas tiendas a elevarse un poco y las ganancias son buenas.  Una de sus metas es lograr entrar a comercializar sus ropas en el Salvador.
texts.en: María lives in Leon. She is 40 and works as a merchant, selling clothing and shoes. She has three children. She started her business when she was 16; her mother taught her, as she used to sell shoes. Bit by bit, Maria gained enough experience to run her own business. She now sells clothing and shoes which she buys in Honduras, in the city of Managua. She sells her products in Leon. She is happy to offer a variety of products. She needs this loan to purchase shoes and clothing to offer her customers during the Christmas season, when sales are a bit higher and earnings are good. One of her goals is to sell her clothing in El Salvador.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Yamil Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Yamil tiene 42 años de edad, vive en barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de San marcos de Colon, junto con el viven sus hijos y su esposa, que le ayuda en su trabajo,  Yamil es bien honrado, responsable y muy dedicado a su actividad, que es la fabricacion de botas de cuero,  actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, este tipo de calzado es muy bien vendido en esta zona, es una zona de ganado y caballos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para fabricar las botas, desea tener mayores ventas y asi tener mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar, desea darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yamil is 42 years old. He lives in the San Francisco neighborhood of San Marcos de Colon with his children and his wife, who helps him with his work. Yamil is very honest and responsible, and he is very dedicated to his work, which is making leather boots. He has done this for four years. This type of footwear sells very well in this region, since it is a region of cattle and horses. 

He will use the loan to purchase materials to make the boots. He wants to have more sales in order to have more earnings, which he needs to cover the costs of his household. He wants to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase leather, soles for boots, thread, hemp, and glue

loans.name: Ubora Wa Kahawa Jama Group

texts.en:
Amos is a 44 years old, a married man with five children.  Two of his children are attending secondary education. He has been growing coffee, maize and beans for over twelve years. He is facing a number of farming problems, basically due to lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Amos is seking financial support to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his growing crops. Also he has a dream to increase his scale of production from 6 to 14 acres in five years to come, and in so doing he will be able to cover medical expenses and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Cruz Mercedes

texts.es:
Cruz Mercedes tiene 22 años es soltera, vive con los papás. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Cruz Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
Cruz Mercedes is 22 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in Aguas frías de Mocache, in Mocache province.

The 'El Progreso' community bank is also located here. The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Cruz Mercedes grows corn and rice on her own land.  She buys her products in Mocache and sells them at the Mocache market. 

She is requesting the loan to buy seed, fertilizers and manure for her crops.  The loan will help her to increase her income for her family and to invest in her crops.  Her dream is to buy a house.  

She enjoys practising sports in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Mcdonald

texts.en: McDonald is 39 years old and married with four children. He is a businessman and sells goats. He has been in business for 2 years. His other source of income is from is farming activities. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to educate his children. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy six goats.

loans.use: To buy 6 goats.

loans.name: Margelyn

texts.en: Margelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Margelyn has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Margelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, 52, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a retired teacher. Three of her children are employed; two are mechanics and another one is employed in a private company. They earn approximately USD 15 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Chenda is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money in her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get a bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Djekafo V Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DJEKAFO V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zanfina, un des villages de la commune de Konobougou,  préfecture de Barouéli, région de Ségou.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, NATA  deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 35 year old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and with the proceeds, she has been able to earn a living and pay school fees for her children. Apart from that, she also practices farming plus mobile money services, from which she earns money to support her family.
She hopes to educate all her children to a minimum qualification of a degree though she is challenged by delays in payments by customers who buy on credit from her.

She needs money to buy more bread, cooking oil and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more bread, cooking oil and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Salydia

texts.en:
Salydia has been a good member of the group since it was started in 2001. She is a single mother aged 44 years with one child who is in college.

She started by selling maize and beans in Sagana market in 1990. In 1998, she realized that people wanted meat but it was not enough in the market. She started rearing cows and goats for sale. In 2001, she borrowed USD.150 bought goats which she later sold and paid the loan back. The small profit she earned was used to pay her child’s school fees and home upkeep

loans.use: She wants to pay school fees for her daughter because the business can't provide all the money required at once.

loans.name: Veselin

texts.en: Veselin V. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Loznitza, near Razgrad. He is married and has a kid. Veselin has his business for more than 10 years. He keeps a small shop for building materials. His shop is one of the oldest and most popular in the town and Veselin has a reputation of a correct trader. Veseiln V. needs this $ 1200 loan for working capital - to enlarge the range of building materials that he is offering.

loans.use: For building materials

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina owns a small grocery stand in the city of Kharkiv. This past year has been tough for her. She had previously owned a business in one of the local markets, but she lost her kiosk due to a reconstruction project. Not willing to give up, she decided to open a grocery business in an older area of the city where there are no new grocery stores. Many large supermarkets are being built in cities throughout Ukraine, but often small grocery stores close to where people live are much more convenient.

Irina had been a client with Nadiya Ukraine while she had her previous business. She established a good credit record and was able to obtain the necessary funding to start her new store. She has been in business at the new location for about 8 months. Her husband, Sergei, works closely with her and they are looking forward to seeing their enterprise continue to develop.

Irina has requested a loan for $900 that will allow her to increase the selection of goods she has available to sell. At this stage in her business development, it is important for her to offer a wide variety of items in order to establish a good reputation and attract more customers. This loan will enable her to continue building a solid foundation for her business so that it will be successful for many years to come.

В Ірини є невеличкий прилавок в м. Харкові, вона торгує харчами. Минулий рік видався дуже важким для неї. В неї був бізнес на одному з місцевих ринків, але потім у зв’язку з реконструкцією ринку вона втратила своє торгове місце. Проте, Ірина не хотіла опускати руки, а, отже, вирішила відкрити крамничку з продажу харчів в старій частині міста, де не так багато магазинів. В України будують багато великих супермаркетів, але дуже часто маленькі крамнички, які розташовані недалеко від жилових районів міста багато зручніші. Ірина познайомилася з „Надією України”, коли починала власну справу. В неї чудова кредитна репутація. Позики допомогли Ірині отримати необхідні кошd

loans.use: Increase available products

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru:
B. Tolib is an active member of MLF MicroInvest, he has been in business for the past 3 years. Tolib orders his merchandise from his vendors. He started his business by selling men’s shoes. Currently he sells men’s clothing. He is married and has 2 children. He works to provide for his family while his wife stays at home. He needs $300 to increase the assortment of merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Баротов Толиб является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 3 лет. Товары заказывает у своих поставщиков. Начинал свой бизнес с продажи мужской обуви. На сегодняшний день он начал продавать и мужскую одежду. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. В семье работает только он, жена домохозяйка. Ему необходимо 300$, для увеличения ассортимента товара.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of  merchandise.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María Báez is 50 years old, separated, and has 3 children. The oldest one is 32 years old and she is a primary school teacher. The second one is 30 and works in a factory that produces plastic articles. The youngest one is 24 and he plays football for a club in the country.

María has had a grocery store in her home for 10 years, where she sells products like fruits, vegetables, bread, dairy, and other daily needs items. She also runs a small restaurant where she prepares food for the employees of a plastic and cardboard recycling firm that is located in front of her house. With these activities she is able to maintain herself and her house where she lives with her oldest daughter.

The business is doing well, and the demand for her products has increased gradually over the last few months. She wants to buy primary needs goods like flour, rice, sugar, and vegetables in large quantities because this way she will be able to get a better price from her providers. For this, she requests a loan of $200 that she will invest in these purchases.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in English:

María Báez tiene 50 años, es separada y tiene 3 hijos; la mayor tiene 32 años que es maestra en una escuela pública, el segundo tiene 30 años y trabaja en una empresa que fabrica artículos de plásticos; el último tiene 24 años y es jugador de fútbol en un club del interior del país.

María tiene una despensa en su domicilio desde hace 10 años y en la misma vende productos como frutas, verduras, panificados, lácteos y otros de consumo masivo. También posee un pequeño comedor donde prepara alimentos para los empleados de una empresa recicladora de plásticos y cartón que está ubicada frente a su casa. Con estas actividades ella logra sustentarse y mantener su casa donde vive junto con su hija mayor.

El negocio marcha muy bien, y la demanda de sus productos ha crecido gradualmente en los últimos meses. Ella desea comprar productos de primera necesidad como harina, arroz, azúcar y verduras en grandes cantidades pues de esta forma obtiene mejores precios de sus proveedores; para ello solicita un crédito de $ 200 que los invertirá en la compra de los mismos.

loans.use: to purchase basic needs items like flour, rice, sugar, and vegetables in large quantities

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Leonarda, my principle activity is business, and I have a small food and drink store located in the center of my community. I have a good clientele and experience in this type of activity. Thanks to the income that I earn from this business I have succeeded in bettering my home and giving an education to my children. Currently they are professionals. Right now I need to restock my business in order to be able to offer a variety of products to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Leonarda, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pulperia, ubicada en el centro de mi Comunidad, cuento con buena clientela y experiencia en este tipo de actividad, gracias a los ingresos que persibo de este negocio he logrado mejorar mi vivienda y dar educación a mis hijos actualmente ellos ya son profesionales. Actualmente nesecito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, butter, rice, oil, bread, milk products and sausages.

loans.name: Georgi

texts.en: Georgi A. works for the railroad company. His mother works in Greece and his father is retired. Georgi has a son that is 6 years old but he lives with his mother. Georgi breeds some chickens and rabbits in the yard of his house and needs some money for fodder. His loan request is for $750.

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: José Lino

texts.es:
After Jose Lino had a terrible accident that made it impossible for him to carry heavy loads, he started a business selling used clothing so that he could carry on supporting his wife and children.

His business has been through good times and bad and, for now, Jose doesn't have enough inventory to offer his customers who want to buy presents over the holidays and/or cold-weather clothing for themselves. Consequently, Jose is asking for a loan of US$475, to be repaid in 2 months, to buy merchandise that he will resale to his customers. With your help, Jose will be able to pull his family ahead despite the problems they face.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Después de que José Lino tuvo un terrible accidente que lo dejó con imposibilitado para cargar cosas pesadas puesto que una de sus piernas no puede soportar pesos grandes es por eso que comenzó a vender ropa usada para poder obtener un dinero que le sirva para mantener a su esposa e hijos.

Sin embargo el negocio que él está manejando tiene temporadas buenas y malas y en este momento José no tiene suficiente mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes que están buscando algo que regalarle a sus familiares y/o ropa de frío que le pueda servir a uno de sus clientes, es por eso que José está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 2 meses y con este dinero José podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener algo que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda José podrá sacar adelante a su familia a pesar de sus problemas.

loans.use: Buy seasonal merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: Rugiatu K. is married and has 3 children.  She sells building materials in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Before her previous loans, Rugiatu used to sell her wares in the open  market. The loans made it possible for her to rent a shop, and the business has grown as a result. She has also increased her stock, and with the profits she is able to meet family expenses.  Rugiatu intends to diversify her business by expanding the range of inventory, and she is requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000 ($525) for this purpose.

loans.use: To diversify the stock in her hardware store

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat R.  is 31 years old and is married with two children.

Shuhrat has been running his business for 10 years. He sells feed for poultry like millet, maize, ground rice and cereal. Through the years of his work, Shuhrat has become popular among the poultry keepers and many of them have become his customers. The business is stable and brings the main income for the family.

Shuhrat has been borrowing from IMON since 2005. He has proven himself a reliable client. Today he requests $700.00 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. Shuhrat plans to purchase the feed for the poultry in order to have the goods in store for the spring season before the harvesting season. Shuhrat thanks all for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing poultry feed in order to have the goods in the store for the spring season before the harvesting season

loans.name: Pilly

texts.en:
Pilly is 35 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 5 years old. Pilly owns a small food shop, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

In the past, Pilly has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
The gentleman Enrique Garcia is originally from the municipality of Cinco Pinos (Five Pines). For 5 years he has been working at his general store, selling food items and electrical appliances in order to put food on the table for his wife and two children. It’s necessary to point out that his business has been growing thanks to the help he’s received from Ceprodel.

Today, he sees a need to invest in his business and is looking for Ceprodel’s support to obtain credit that will allow him to buy more products. The support from Ceprodel will benefit his business, his humble family and himself, as it is his duty to provide them with the necessary living conditions.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Translator.

El caballero Enrique G. es originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica desde hace cinco años al negocio de pulpería el cual atiende vendiendo sus productos comestibles y algunos electrodomésticos con el propósito de llevar a su casa el alimento para sus dos hijos y su cónyuge. Es necesario destacar que su negocio ha venido desarrollándose gracias al apoyo que Ceprodel le ha brindado para la compra de los productos de la pulpería.

Hoy en día, al ver la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para su negocio. Por medio del apoyo brindado por Ceprodel se beneficia tanto el, su negocio y su humilde familia el cual tiene el deber de proporcionarle las condiciones de vida necesarias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akossiwa A. was born in 1978 in Abidjan. Coming from a poor family, she has faced every type of hardship in the world during her life. Due to a lack of means, she has neither schooling nor professional training. She is married to a taxi driver, with whom she has three (3) children. Her main occupation is the sale of foodstuffs (rice, beans, spaghetti). Despite these difficulties, she has come to manage her business with rigor and was able to repay her previous loans. The current loan she is asking for will serve to buy bags of rice, beans, and other goods to strengthen her business and increase profits in order to be able to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Akossiwa est née en 1978 à Abidjan. Issue d’une famille pauvre, elle a rencontré toutes les difficultés du monde dans sa vie. Par manque de moyens, elle n’a ni fréquenté, ni suivi une formation professionnelle. Elle s’est mariée à un conducteur de taxi avec qui elle a trois (3) enfants. Elle a comme activité principale la vente des denrées alimentaires (riz, haricot, spaghetti). Malgré les difficultés, elle arrive à bien gérer ses activités avec rigueur et a su rembourser ses crédits antérieurs. Ce présent crédit sollicité, lui servira à acheter des sacs de riz, haricot et autres pour mieux réussir son activité et la rentabiliser afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and beans

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim S. is 43 years old. He is married with 5 children; the eldest is 20, and the youngest is only 7 years old. Karim manufactures carved wooden doors, window frames, and partitions in the traditional oriental style to order. He has been in this business for 25 years already. Over this period, Karim has become a real expert in his business and has a lot of clients. Since he has a lot of clients and demand, the business is very successful and brings in a stable and significant income, allowing Karim to improve living conditions for his family. Just now Karim has a big order for window frames and doors.

Thus, today Karim is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 950 to purchase input materials for his manufacturing business. The previous loan was managed by Karim without problems, and he promises to repay the current one on time. Karim is counting on your help and he expresses his gratitude to everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing of input materials for manufacturing wooden window frames and doors

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol is a 41-year old woman who has a great responsibility: the support her 12-year old son and provide him with a university education. For some time now, she has worked raising animals to later offer for sale. She also sells milk and dedicates herself to farming, planting primarily potatoes and corn. She hopes that her endeavors will help her to get ahead. Three years ago, she inherited three cows and the land on which she farms from her parents. This helped her tremendously to increase her working capital. Marisol seeks a loan to improve the feed she uses for her livestock, enabling her to purchase a more balanced and nutritious blend of products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Marisol es una mujer de 41 años que siente que tiene una gran responsabilidad, ser el sustento de su hijo de 12 años y brindarle una carrera universitaria. Desde hace mucho tiempo ella trabaja criando animales para venderlos luego, también vende leche. Además se dedica al cultivo, siembra principalmente papa y maíz, con estas actividades ella puede seguir adelante. Hace 3 años heredó unas vacas y las tierras de cultivo de sus padres que la favorecieron enormemente y con ello aumentó su capital de trabajo. Marisol cual solicita este préstamo para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales comprando productos balanceados.

loans.use: Purchase more nutritious and balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Agée de 55 ans, Madame K. Ablavi est demeurante à Kpémé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. C’est une dame très dynamique qui exerce le commerce du charbon de bois depuis maintenant vingt ans.

C’est une activité qu’elle maîtrise parfaitement et qui est devenu pratiquement sa première source de revenu. Vu la variation des prix du charbon sur le marché, elle prévoit déjà une pénurie dans quelques mois surtout quand la saison des plus va battre son plein. 

Pour ce faire elle voudrait faire un stock pour revendre dans la période de pénurie ; ce qui l’amène à solliciter un crédit
texts.en:
Mrs. Ablavi K., 55, lives in Kpémé. She is married and the mother of two children. She is a very dynamic lady who has been selling charcoal for 20 years now.

This is a business in which she is very knowledgeable and which has become her primary source of income. In view of the variation in the price of charcoal on the market, she is already foreseeing a shortage of charcoal, especially when the height of the rainy season arrives.

She would like to put aside a stock to sell during the period of shortage. That is the reason why she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: laying in stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: Dame O. Angèle est née le 23/05/1962 à Agonli. Elle a épousé à ADEOTI Henri et est mère de 05 enfants. Elle habite le quartier Sainte Rita depuis 3 ans et fait la distribution vente depuis un an. Elle revendait de l'huile d'arachide mais elle a très tôt abandonné cette activité au profit de la distribution vente. Elle vient solliciter son cinquième prêt à ALIDé pour satisfaire davantage ses clients.
texts.en:
Ms. Angèle O. was born on May 23, 1962 in Agonli. She married Henri ADEOTI and is the mother of five children. She has been living in the Sainte Rita district for three years and has been doing sales distribution for one year. Having sold peanut oil in the past, she very early on abandoned it for her work in sales distribution. She has come to request her fifth loan with Alidé to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 12 dozen women's shoes, twenty-some kitchen utensiles, and various household products

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Mrs. Prum S. is a farmer in Chroy Pisey Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectare to cultivate rice. She is a 53-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. Although Mrs. Prum S. and her child have different businesses, they still do not have enough money to buy 12 stilts to build a house, so Mrs. Prum S. decided to ask for a loan to buy them for this purpose. She hopes to improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy 12 stilts to build a house

loans.name: Miel Group

texts.en:
Gaby K. is 42 years old and the mother of five children between the ages of 4 and 16. In addition to her five children, she also takes care of three orphaned girls. Gaby runs a restaurant. She has been in business since 2006 and began her business with $50 in capital. 

Gaby has been a member a Hope group named Miel, which means honey, since November 2008. With her first loan she expanded her business by adding vegetables and palm oil, which is in high demand where she works in northeastern Kinshasa. Gaby would like to continue receiving Hope loans in order to achieve her dreams of modernizing her restaurant. She would like to use electrical appliances, such as hot plates, instead of charcoal. She also plans to start a catering service.  

The Miel group has thirty-three members. They are all working very hard to develop their businesses. With their loans, they aspire to meet the increasing demand of their clients and in turn generate higher profits that will help them support their families.

loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances for her restaurant.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 39 años, es separada, vive en casa de su madre con sus tres hijos menores. Desde muy niña apoyó en el restaurante de su madre, cuando formó su familia se dedicó al cuidado de su hijos, pero desde el momento de su separación volvió a la casa de su madre y nuevamente a trabajar en el preparado de los menú para los clientes del restaurante que su madre administra. Le agrada la cocina y el comercio, pero su esposo era muy machista, y no pudo realizarse en el mundo del negocio. Ahora tiene la ilusión de tener un negocio propio y trabajar con esfuerzo para su futuro y el de sus hijos. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. El dinero solicitado le servirá para emprender con su propio restaurante, espera conseguir clientela muy rápido, y está muy agradecida por todo este tiempo con MFP, cuyos créditos le sirvieron para ahorrar y ahora estar lista para iniciar su independencia.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 39 years old, separated and lives in her mother's house with her three small children. She has helped in her mother's restaurant since she was a girl, when she had her family she dedicated her time to taking care of her children. Since her separation, she has returned to her mother's house and again works in the preparation of the food for the customers of the restaurant that her mother runs. She likes cooking and the business, but her husband was very chauvinistic and she was not able to enter the business world. She now has a dream of having her own business and has put all her efforts toward a future for herself and her children. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The funds requested will help her get her own restaurant and she expects to get customers very quickly. She is very grateful for all her time with MFP, whose loans have made her able to save and now be ready to embark on her independence.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start her own restaurant.

loans.name: Roxana Luz

texts.es:
La señora Roxana Luz R. C. tiene 28 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Trujillo 653 del Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry de la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Terminó la educación secundaria y continuó estudios de auxiliar de enfermería en la Cruz Roja pero no los terminó porque se casó a los 19 años y tiene un hijo y una hija que son  pequeños.
Roxana compra y vende ropa por pedido, la que consigue en Lima o Trujillo, su actividad económica la realiza en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas logró su capital.
Con este crédito de 800 que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en mercadería de ropa.
Roxana sueña con tener una tienda grande en Trujillo.
texts.en:
Roxana Luz R. C. is 28 years old and is a member of "The Entrepreneurs II" (Las Emprendedoras II) communal bank. She lives in Trujillo 653 Road of Port Maritime in Salaverry in Trujillo province, department of La Libertad Perú. She finished high school and continued her studies in assistant nursing at the Red Cross. She didn't complete her studies because she was married at 19. Now, she has a young son and young daughter. Roxana buys and sells clothes on order, which she gets from Lima or Trujilla. She conducts business from her home. With her first credit of 300 soles which she repaid in four installments, she gathered capital for her business. With this loan of 800 soles to be repaid in 6 installments, she will invest in clothing merchandise. Roxama dreams of owning a big store in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Carlos Eduardo es supervisor de unas gasolineras de la ciudad, el y su familia están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones y la construcción de una barda lateral para proteccion de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Eduardo is a supervisor for a gas station in the city. He and his family are asking for this loan to place security devices and to build a wall to protect his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To place safety devices and build a wall to protect his family.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Mme Kossiwa G. est le 12 /06/1960 .Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Son mari  n’ayant pas un emploi stable,  elle est la seule à subvenir aux charges de la famille grâce à son petit commerce des produits de premières nécessités. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir son étalage et s’approvisionner régulièrement. Ainsi, elle pourra contribuer de mieux en mieux à l’amélioration des conditions de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kossiwa G. was born on June 12, 1960. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her husband has no steady job, so she is the primary breadwinner, thanks to her little general store selling staple goods. Today she is requesting a loan to expand her shelves and restock her store on a regular basis. Thus, she will be better able to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of staple goods

loans.name: Jorge Aurelio

texts.es:
Jorge es socia del Banco Comunal 30 de junio.
Jorge es casado, tiene 70 años y 12 hijos de los cuales solo 1 hija vive con ella, Jorge tiene un taller de carpintería en su casa , donde realiza trabajos a pedido de sus clientes, también compra y vende maderas.
Jorge necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maderas.
Los sueños de Jorge son incrementar su negocio y comprar una maquina para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of the June 30th Communal Bank. He is 70 years old and married with 12 children, though only one of his daughters lives with him. Jorge has a woodshop in his house where he makes custom-ordered products and buys and sells lumber. Jorge needs a loan of $950 that will be used to purchase lumber. Jorge dreams of expanding his business and buying a machine for his woodshop.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lumber

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Washington is a member of the Santo Domingo Village Bank. He is 34 years old and lives with his two children who are 10 and 8 years old. He owns his own car which he drives as a taxi around the city of Cusco. He has been working as a taxi driver for the past five or six years, and his wife has a small restaurant which she has been running for the past year or so. She serves mainly soups and traditional Peruvian entrees. 

Washington is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy provisions (rice, vegetables) and tables for his wife’s restaurant. He has pledged to repay his Kiva loan in full and on time. 

Washington’s dream for the future is to own his own home (he currently rents). He would also like to own many vehicles and start his own taxi company.  He could then manage other drivers wouldn’t have to work as a taxi driver anymore.

loans.use: Buy rice, vegetables, and tables

loans.name: Ganu Thapa

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganu Thapa M. is a cosmetics shopkeeper in the village of Sainbu-Bhaishipati. She opened her cosmetic shop five years ago. She opened her shop to utilize her free time and to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells different kinds of cosmetic goods in her shop. Now she seeks a Rs 15000.00 loan to invest in her shop. She will use the loan to buy various types of cosmetic goods such as cream, lipsticks, glass bangles etc.

Mrs. Ganu Thapa M. has five members (including herself) in her family. Her husband, Mr. Kesbad Thapa M., has retired from his job. She has one son and two daughters. All of them are now studying.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic goods

loans.name: Omar
