texts.en: Omar is an 18 year old man living in Barja, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a mini-market since 2005, when his father taught him the business. Today, he wants to borrow $1,200 to increase his sales by purchasing a mini-van to be able to deliver to the surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-van.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia es casada, de 40 años de edad, con 2 hijas de 14 y 3 años, la niña mayor esta estudiando en la UNAN Managua el 2do año de nutricion, su esposo trabaja en Nueva Guinea y aporta para los gastos del hogar. La profesora Rosa Amelia trabaja en el instituto San Sebastian de Acoyapa como docente, con 19 años de servicio, esta solicitando su 8vo credito para utilizarlo en la construccion del porche de su casa, de todos sus creditos solo uno utilizo para compra de medicamentos, el resto los ha utilizado para invertirlos en su vivienda, ya que es la unica manera de salir adelante y darle comodidad a su familia, pues es muy dificil ahorrar para invertir.  Manifiesta sentirse satisfecha por la atencion que le ha brindado AFODENIC pues esta con la institucion desde su apertura.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia is 40 and married with two daughters, 14 and 3. Her older daughter is in her second year studying Nutrition at UNAN Managua. Her husband works in New Guinea and contributes to the household expenses. She has been a teacher at the San Sebastian Institute in Acoyapa for 19 years. Rosa Amelia is seeking her 8th loan, which she'll use to build a porch on her house. She has used only one of her loans to buy medicines. She's invested the rest in her house; that's the only way to get ahead and provide comfort to her family since it is very hard to save for investment. She expresses her feelings of satisfaction for the service AFODENIC has provided her, and she's been with the organization since its inception.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a porch

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana que en estos momentos cuenta con 38 años vive en su propia casa, ubicada en la zona oeste de la localidad, junto a su esposo de 46 y sus tres hijos; de 21-18 y 15 años de edad.
Roxana es promotora de la afamada linea de cosmeticos "avon" desde hace mas de tes años. Su esposo el codeudor es trabajador fijo, seguro y antiguo de una empresa de oleaginosas y derivados. 
Actividades que realizan por varios años, por eso sus experiencias.
La competencia es mediana en cuanto al comercio de cosmeticos, porque hay otras personas con la misma actividad, pero lo importante es que ella es antigua en el negocio y ya tiene sus clientes asegurados. En cuanto a su esposo eso no existe, porque es empleado fijo y seguro.
Roxana invirtio los bs. 2,500,- que saco de la institucion en sus productos avon, la mayoria de los mismos ya los coloco en este pasado "dia de la madre".
Este es el octavo prestamo de la sra. Roxana y todos los anteriores los a cancelado excelentemente. Tiene otras deudas en el sistema financiero mismas que se encuentran vigentes, la misma que esta pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Roxana is 38 years old and lives in her own house, located in the western part the city, with her 46 year-old husband and their three children who are 21, 18, and 15.

Roxana has been a representative of the famous Avon cosmetics line for more than three years. Her husband, the cosigner, has a steady, long term job in a company that produces vegetable oils and other derivatives.

They have been working in their jobs for several years so they are both experienced.

There is moderate competition in the cosmetics business because there are other people who sell the same products, but the important thing is that Roxana is established in the business and already has loyal customers. In regard to her husband’s work, this does not exist, because he is a permanent and secure employee. Roxana invested the BS 2,500 (Bolivian Currency) that she received from this institution in Avon products, most of which she already sold for Mothers Day.

This is Roxana’s 8th loan and she paid off all of her previous loans successfully. She has other debts in the same financial system that are still active and being paid back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of Avon products

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita T., 53, is married with three children.  She has had three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public, four days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 Tala (~60 USD). SPBD loans are Makerita’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed killing spray, chemicals, spade, fertilizer and some taro roots

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Maximiliana es separada, tiene 55 años y 4 hijos, Maximiliana vende pescado fresco y congelado en la puerta de su casa, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijas, además los días sábados vende pescado cerca del penal de la ciudad. Maximiliana también vende leña en su casa.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Maximiliana son mejorar su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Manantial Community Bank. She is 55, separated, and has four children. Maximiliana sells fresh and frozen fish in the door to her house. She does this with help from her daughters. Also, on Saturdays she sells fish near the city prison. Maximiliana also sells wood in her house. Maximiliana needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy wood. Maximiliana’s dreams are to improve her business and to help her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Азизахон

texts.ru: Исоева Азиза 1976 года рождения. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж работает дальнобойщиком.Азиза 3 года является активной клиенткой в МЗФ Микроинвест. Исоева занимается торговлей рыбой. Она торгует на базаре Фаровон и в Кайракуме. У неё много покупателей так как рыба полезный продукт. Рыбу ей поставляют поставщики.  Она планирует разнообразить вид рыбы и этим привлечь еще больше клиентов.

loans.use: На закупку рыбы

loans.name: Eloycith

texts.es: La señora Eloycith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Unión hace la Fuerza”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y no tiene hijos.Eloycith, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su negocio de servicio de Recargas Virtuales, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, ya saben de su negocio y acuden a ella. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará recargas virtuales, para la línea claro y movistar, así de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes. Eloycith, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha  logrado. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas y otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Eloycith is a member of the Communal Bank “La Unión hace la Fuerza” (Union is Strength), which is located in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and does not have children. Sra. Eloycith is an efficient woman who needs to generate her own income. She decided to start a virtual reload service out her home. She sells to neighbors, friends, and relatives and her business has been well received. Her business continues to operate and is doing very well.

With her loan of 800 soles, Sra. Eloycith will purchase virtual reloads with the mobile phone carriers Clear Line and Movistar, which will satisfy customer demand.

Sra. Eloycith is pleased with what she has accomplished. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her fulfill her dreams and goals as well as supporting other women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase virtual reloads

loans.name: Sayuni Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Sayuni borrower group in Sakina, Arusha. She is 27 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 6 and 3 years old.

Joyce has owned a food business selling fruits and vegetable for 1 year, she works 10 hours a day and she earns a  monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Joyce`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits and vegetable for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Joyce hopes to save money, pay school fess and expand her business.

Suzana is another member of the same borrower group, she requested the amount of 150,000 In order to expand her crops business.

loans.use: T o buy more fruits and vegetable

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en: Bayaraa is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Arkhangai province in Mongolia.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  Bayaraa and his wife own a raw material, such as sheep skin and wool trading business in their town where they buy raw materials locally and sell the materials in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, for a profit.  He started his business in 2000 with working capital of 150,000 tugrugs (~100 USD) which soon grew to 4,500,000 tugrugs (~3160 USD). Bayaraa has gained a lot of experience and knowledge over the years and he hopes to use this experience and knowledge to keep his business growing. He would like to, one day, own his own store where he can sell the raw materials and expand his customer base.  Bayaraa is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to purchase more raw materials in order to increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Rosa Violeta

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo. Su negocio es la venta de dulces y gaseosas, está contenta  porque esta prosperando, Rosa vende en la puerta de su casa, actualmente se ha comprado un mostrador para los dulces.
Necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, va compra una vitrina, y productos para su negocio como galletas, caramelos y gaseosas al por mayor.
Su negocio ha mejorado, por la capacitación que recibe  de su promotora de crédito, aprendió a ser responsable y ahorrar
El sueño de Rosa es que su negocio siga creciendo, y poner un  negocio de venta de gas

loans.use: compra de una vitrina y productos para su negocio

loans.name: Sham-E-Khamosh Group

texts.en:
This is the Sham-e-Khamosh group, which consists of three members, all of whom live in the 8th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Fahima, pictured in the middle, is the group leader.

Fahima is married with four children (two sons and two daughters), all of whom are currently in school. For more than ten years now, she has earned a living as a tailor. She is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine, as well as threads, scissors, and other necessary materials, in order to sew high-quality clothes for her customers. M. Rafee seeks a loan for his retail shop because he would like to expand his inventory. And last but not least, M. Samy would like a loan for his fruit cart shop because he wants to improve his business in order to better support his family members. Collectively, they are seeking a (group) loan in the amount of 30,000 Afghani ($625), and they appreciate the continued support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve their respective businesses by purchasing necessary materials

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a thirty-year-old married man with one child in school. He lives with his wife and son in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. He works hard to be able to provide for the family.

Daniel is a trader. He has a palm oil production business. Daniel buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in his community. He also sells at the local market.

Daniel has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a rice farmer. She is 47 years old, married and has seven kids. Her oldest child is now 25 years old. She does her best to keep her farm in good shape. She aims to produce quality rice that she can both sell and use to feed her family.

Grace joined CEVI in January 2009 and is thankful for the financial services to which she has gained access. She is currently requesting for a loan of PHP 9,000. With this loan, Grace will be able to buy seeds, fertilizer and other supplies that she needs for her farm.

loans.use: purchasing seeds, fertilizer and other supplies needed at her farm

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en:
Sevinj A. and her family are internally displaced people who have suffered from the war and have lost their home. In 1992, she moved to Bilasuvar city and started her own business. With the loan from AqroInvest Credit Union she was able to purchase her first cow. That is why, seven years ago, she decided to move forward with raising livestock. Every morning, she goes out early so that her beloved cows may graze among the hills all day in the hope that they return happy and satisfied.

Sevinj is motivated to continue in this arduous work by the thought of her future life as she is single and doesn’t have additional financial income. In order to succeed in her business, she seeks to nourish the animals and keep them happy, in the hope of ultimately selling them at a good price. Thanks to her continued activity in her occupation, Sevinj and her elderly parents are able to sustain themselves and this fills her with great satisfaction.

However, with the support of this loan, Sevinj would now like to also purchase more livestock to increase her clientele. She recommended herself as a reliable client with a good loan history. With your support, she will be able to accomplish her business goals.

loans.use: To purchase four cows

loans.name: Ernestina Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ernestina Del Socorro tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo, que es mayor de edad. La señora se dedica a una pulpería, pues ha puesto todo su empeño en mejorar cada día. La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 10 años, en la búsqueda de fuentes alternativas de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Ella empezó vendiendo muy poco, ahora posee una clientela bien establecida, además que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una manera muy humilde. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materias primas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite, carnes y gaseosas. Su sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante, que brinden mayores ingresos a su familia en general.
texts.en:
Ernestina Del Socorro is 49 years old. She is a single mother and has one son, who is an adult. Ernestina runs a small grocery store, and has worked hard to make it better every day. The store is located in her humble home. She began this business 10 years ago, looking for alternative sources of income in order to care for her family. She started out selling very little, but now she has an established customer base. She also has always liked working and making a living in this humble way. The loan will be invested in the purchase of basic materials such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, meat and soft drinks. Her dream is to have a restaurant, that will provide a better income for all her family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funds for business

loans.name: Tilov

texts.en:
Tilov is 37 years old and married with four children. Tilov is a farmer. He has been working in agriculture for four years. In that time, he has gained much experience and a love for the land. Tilov began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. He has been producing crops such as potatoes, onions, carrots and vegetables. Each year, he produces a yield sufficient for his family's consumption and for selling. At the same time, he runs a business of raising and selling cattle. 

Today he is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,500 Somoni. Tilov would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale. Tilov and his family are counting on your help. He thanks all who support him and promises to repay the loan in time.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer in order to improve production

loans.name: Let God Be Group

texts.en: Tenneh K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Let God Be. She is 39 years old and a single mother with three children between the ages of 6 and 16 years old. Their educational levels range from nursery to ninth grade. Tenneh and her family live and work in Saye Town, a community that has both poor and middle-class Liberians, in Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. She was never able to go to school herself due to lack of financial support from her parents. Tenneh’s business is the sale of general goods such as rice, oil and other cooking ingredients. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail to residents of Saye Town. She has been running this business for nine years and is hoping to own a shop in the near future. Tenneh started selling with 4,000 Liberian Dollars but now operates with about 10,000 Liberian Dollars. She communicates with her customers in a good manner and sells good products in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. Tenneh needs this loan to purchase rice, oil, seasoning, etc., for resale. She dreams of being a good provider to her family and well-known as a businesswoman. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Tenneh is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women. Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today!

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil, seasonings, etc., for resale

loans.name: Tula Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tula lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras que desde muy jóvenes han buscado la forma de ganarse el sustento. La señora Soraya Margarita Castillo F. vende nacatamales platillo típico nicaragüense a base de maíz, carne de cerdo, arroz, cebolla, chiltoma, chile, papa etc. Este producto no falta en la mesa de los nicaragüenses en el desayuno del fin de semana.

Las otras integrantes son María Felipa V. A.  quien vende café y leche, María Luisa Gaitán B. comercializa nacatamales y Jeysi del Socorro  tiene un taller de costura. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Tula" consists of four hardworking women who have been searching for ways to make a living since they were very young. Soraya sells nacatamales, a typical Nicaraguan dish made of corn, pork, rice, onion, pepper, chile, potato, etc. This dish is never missing from the weekend breakfast table of Nicaraguans.

The other members are María Felipa, who sells coffee and milk, María Luisa, who also sells nacatamales, and Jeysi who has a sewing workshop. They will invest the loan in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make local dishes

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a business selling plants and flowers in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a  first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Tosin

texts.en:
Tosin is 29 years old and is married with a child who is 8 years old and attends school. Her husband sells clothes to support their home.

To make a living in Ibadan, Tosin sells bags and jewelry at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a bag factory in the future.

Tosin has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization. She is requesting for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more bags and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry and bags to sell

loans.name: Dhan's Group

texts.en:
Dhan R. is from the village of Brgy, Quirino, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 30 years old and the leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Dhan is married and has two school-aged children. He operates a business providing transportaion services. He has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dhan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. He is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dhan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Edwin Wilder

texts.es:
Edwin forma parte del banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”, tiene 27 años y es soltero. Edwin estudia la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco y está cursando el último semestre. Edwin nos cuenta que con tres compañeros de la universidad abrieron un taller mecánico llamado “CRIVERSA” donde brindan servicios de diseño automotriz de estructuras metálicas y muchas cosas más. Ya son tres años que se dedica a brindar el servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Edwin es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyor a su familia, el requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina soldadora, accesorios de computadora y software actualizado. El anhelo del socio es estudiar una maestría en el país de Alemania. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, el socio manifiesta, que se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro, capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal. 
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Edwin is a part of the “Los Diamantes” communal bank. He is 27 years old and single. Edwin is studying for a professional career as a mechanical engineer at “Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco” and he is in his final semester. Edwin tells us that he and three other fellow students opened a mechanics shop called “Criversa,” where they provide automotive structural design services for metal components and other things. He has been doing this for three years and things are going well, thanks to the emphasis he places on his work. Edwin is a hard working and enterprising young man, constantly searching for opportunities to get ahead and help his family. He needs this loan in order to buy a welding machine, computer accessories, and software. He hopes to one day do an apprenticeship in Germany. The communal bank has been functioning for ten cycles. [Edwin] tells us that he is happy and satisfied with the loan services, savings, and capabilities provided during the communal bank’s existence. He is grateful for the opportunity and promises to repay on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools and equipment

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a happy woman. She is also a hard working woman. She sells crates of drinks at retail prices to make a living. She hopes to grow and expand her business. She is 45 years old, married with 6 children. Her husband is a photographer and he also supports their home. Her children are excelling in school and this makes her happy as a mother. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen P. is from the town of Sta. Rita, Concepcion, Tarlac. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Aileen owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily fish balls and other dimsums, to the local community. Aileen has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Aileen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aileen is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Aileen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida G. is a hardworking entrepreneur who is determined to improve her family's standard of living. She joined Kiva partner ASHI in 1996 to gain access to loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams.

The first few loans Zenaida received enabled her to support her family’s sewing business and their business selling curtains. The profit from these businesses has been the main source of family income. She is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for the much larger amount of 45,000 PHP to purchase cotton fabrics and to support the maintenance of their sewing business. The capital will fund further expansion of the family ventures to support her dream for her children and her grandchildren to have a decent way of life.

With working capital, Zenaida’s business will keep on growing and she will be able to give pleasing service to her avid customers. Through the support of ASHI and Kiva, she hopes to see herself and her family soon improve their quality of living and move away from under the umbrella of poverty.

Zenaida hopes for an expanded business, therefore; she is requesting a loan of 45,000 pesos to pay for assorted cotton fabrics and other supplies. She requests this loan through ASHI so that she can support the expansion of her sewing business and be able to meet the growing demands of her customers.

Zenaida’s long-term goal is to have a tailoring shop a year from now so that she can give opportunity of employment to others, especially her extended relatives in her barangay (village). She hopes to maintain long-term sustainable businesses. During the course of her membership in ASHI, she has been a model member dedicated to managing her family’s operations.

loans.use: To buy assorted cotton fabrics and other supplies

loans.name: Los Pinos (Flat) Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO SE LLAMA LOS PINOS ESTA INTEGRADO DE TRES PERSONAS QUE SON LAS SEÑORAS: FLOR DE LUZ P. P., MAGDALI PATRCIO E. Y MARINA E. P., CADA UNA CON DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES, LAS INTEGRANTES SE ENTERARON DEL PROGRAMA POR LOS ANUNCIOS Y COORDINADORES.
DOÑA  MARINA E. P., ES ORIGINARIA DE COAPILLA, CHIAPAS TIENE 72 AÑOS DE EDAD SE CASO  A LOS 18 AÑOS, CON EL SEÑOR PEDRO P. P., DE LA MISMA LOCALIDAD Y TIENE 7 HIJOS TODOS CASADOS.
EL MOTIVO POR EL CUAL DOÑA MARINA SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO ES PARA COMPRAR LOS INGREDIENTES Y ELABORACION DE  PANES YA QUE PARA REALIZARLO NECESITA LO SIGUIENTE, HARINA, ACEITE, HUEVO, LECHE, ROYAL, AZUCAR, ENTRE OTROS,  Y A UN ASI TAMBIEN CUENTA CON EL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO QUE TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO.
LA ACREDITADA MARINA ESTA MUY CONTENTA CON EL SERVICIO QUE LE BRINDA FUNDACION REALIDAD A. C. 
SU SUEÑO DE DOÑA MARINA E. P., ES AHORRAR PARA SEGUIR CON SU TRABAJO EN LA CUAL COMENTA QUE SU ILUSIÓN ES IRSE A “CANCUN QUINTANA ROO”  Y TENER SU NEGOCIO HASTA QUE DIOS LE PRESTE VIDA.
LAS OTRAS DOS INTEGRANTES UTILIZARÁN SU CRÉDITO PARA: LA SEÑORA FLOR DE LUZ P. P., EN LA COMPRA DE CREMAS, PERÓXIDO, TINTES Y CARRETES PARA SU ESTETICA, Y SU COMPAÑERA MAGDALI P. E., EN SU NEGOCIO DE TAQUERIA.
texts.en:
The Pines Group is composed of 3 women; Flor de Luz, Magdali, and Marina, each pursuing different activities. The members learned about the loan program from announcements and from the coordinators. Marina is originally from Coapilla, Chiapas, 72 years old, and married since the age of 18 to Pedro from the same locality. They have 7 children, all married now. Marina's motive for requesting a loan is to buy ingredients and make bread to sell. To do this, she needs wheat flour, cooking oil, eggs, milk, yeast, and sugar, plus other items. She can count on the help of her husband who works in the countryside. Marina is very content with the service offered by the Fundacion Realidad (Reality Foundation). Her dream is to save in order to continue with her work. Her 'illusion' is to travel to Cancun in Quintana Roo, and to keep her business until God takes her life. The other 2 group members will utilize the loan as follows: Flor de Luz will buy creams, peroxide, hair coloring, and rollers for her beauty shop. Her companion Magdali will use the loan to supply her taco shop.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING INGREDIENTS TO MAKE BREADS (SUGAR, EGGS, FLOUR, YEAST, OIL, AND MILK), AND OTHER SUPPLIES FOR 3 BUSINESSES

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun S. is 44 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Sdok Prei village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Moeun S. and her husband, Mr. Cheas S., are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow rice and vegetables for a living. Aside from farming, they also make and sell fishing nets and are able to earn a small profit to support their family. This couple does not have any children.

Mrs. Moeun S. will use the loan to buy raw materials to make more fishing nets to sell.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make more fishing nets to sell

loans.name: Ngueterre Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NGUETERRE est né depuis 09 ans. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de NEMA2. Il est composé de huit braves femmes qui ont une même vision et ont pratiquement le même centre d’intérêt. Se sont des  Femmes très engagées et courageuses. Depuis le début du programme dans leur quartier elles se sont organisées en groupe de solidarité par voisinage et par affinité.

Madame Madeleine B., à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans.
Elle fait le petit commerce comme. Elle achète avec le prêt reçu des balais traditionnels et du jus de citron dans les villages environnants pour les revendre à Ziguinchor et à Dakar. Elle évolue depuis plusieurs années dans se secteur. 
Son objectif est d’augmenter ses bénéfices et satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Alléger les charges financières à son mari
texts.en:
The Ngueterre solidarity group has been born nine years ago. It belongs to the Banc Villageois of NEMA2. It is composed of eight strong women who have the same vision and share their main interests. They women are very engaged and courageous. From the time the program had been launched in their neighborhood, they decided to form a solidarity group of neighbors and friends. Mrs. Madeleine B., to the right in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 53 years old. She has a small business; with the loan, she will purchase traditional brooms and lemon juice in the neighboring villages in order to resell them in Ziguinchor and Dakar. She has been in this line of business for a number of years. Her goal is to increase her revenue and be able to provide for her personal needs, and to alleviate the financial burden on her husband.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing brooms and lemon juice

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina D. is from Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 39 years old and is married with eleven school-aged children.

Josefina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Josefina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim M., 55, is a widowed farmer who lives with three of her children in Takeo province. Since 1985, she has been growing rice and is able to make US$2 of profit a day. She is also supported by two children who work in a garment factory. Kim M. would like to take out a loan of US$450 to purchase cows.

loans.use: To purchase cows.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: abra a commencé il y a plus de 5 ans le commerce de céréales, elle exerce son activité au marché local de hanoukopé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de Lomé.elle a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises, raison pour laquelle elle voudrait s'approvisionner avec 7 sacs de maïs, 4 sacs d'haricots, 3 sacs de farine. elle est célibataire avec une personne à sa charge, c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'elle subvient à ses charges.
texts.en:
Abra started selling cereals over 5 years ago. She sets up shop at Hanoukopé's local market, where her customers are all kinds of people.
She has seen a decrease in her stock of merchandise, which is why she wants to buy 7 bags of corn, 4 bags of beans and 3 bags of flour. She stocks up in the local markets in Lomé.
She is unmarried with one person in her care. She covers her expenses with the revenue from her business.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, beans and flour

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon O. is a widow who lives in Sitio Tuburan, Brgy. Cambaog, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a pottery business. Corazon joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Corazon has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her increase her monthly profits to PHP 12,000, raising the family's standard of living. For her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to buy materials for pottery making so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Corazon O. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To buy materials for pottery making

loans.name: Shafiqan's Group

texts.en:
Shafiqan lives in a small city in Pakistan called Pakpattan. Pakpattan is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and is famous for its sugar production. Shafiqan is a 56 year old housewife. She prefers to spend her time at home by managing the household chores and taking care of her family. She has given birth to 2 sons. Both are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  She is a widow and lives with her brother. Her brother has a scrap business. He has been in this business for over seven years. He also contributes a part of his income to his family to support them financially. 

Shafiqan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her brother’s business. With the loan amount he will buy scrap in bulk quantities to minimize the cost of purchasing and to fulfill larger orders on time. Shafiqan is hopeful that her brother will make good profits from his business after making this investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She is hopeful that it will bring good changes to her family’s life and that their living standard will become better. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Shafiqan”.

loans.use: To buy scrap in bulk quantities for scrap business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix Díaz tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el Barrio La Amistad de Cambyreta,  es casado, tiene 4 hijos. 
El señor Félix, hace 13 años que se dedica a la venta al rubro de gomeria y arreglo de bicicletas.
 Mediante esta actividad pueden solventar  sus gastos y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se le presente. 
El ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de cubiertas para  motos y bicicletas ya que también es solicitado por sus clientes este servicio de reparación de motos y bicicletas.
texts.en:
Sr. Félix Díaz is 51 years old and lives in the neighborhood of La Amistad de Cambyreta. He is married and has four children.

Sr. Félix has been selling tires and repairing bicycles for 13 years. His business enables him to meet his expenses and cover any unforeseen events that may occur. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy motorcycle and bicycle tires since his customers are requesting his repair services.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle & bicycle tires

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi B. is into the production and sale of 'Fante kenkey' (fermented maize dough) at Elmina. Esi has received senior high education. She is married and has nine dependents. Her husband is a security man. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to be able to produce "Fante kenkey' in large quantities. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

At the time of visit, Esi was preparinging a number of  the 'Fante kenkey' balls wrapped in banana leaves she was going to sell.

loans.use: buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for Nora, 40. Her business is located in Agusan del sur. She has a good harvest when the weather is good and no pests attack. She tills a rice field to support her family. She is already a widow and a mother of 2 children, the eldest is 10 years old.

She requested a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. of 4,000 Php for additional capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Thirty-three year old Martin is married and has 4 school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from the town of Kitale, in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 7 years and employs three farmhands. His farm currently produces eggs and milk which he sells locally. He also runs a shop in the same location which supplements his income. 

Martin has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farm. He says that the proceeds from this loan will assist in the eduction of his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his farming and venture into dairy farming. He says poultry diseases is a major problem which sometimes leads to death and a financial loss to him as a farmer. 

He appreciates the flexibility of the repayment terms with Juhudi, i.e the monthly repayment.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Nadina

texts.en:
Nadina M., age 29, is a seafood vendor in her local community. Her wares include fish like mackerel and sardines. Nadina has been engaged in her business for over five years and it brings her approximately 6000 PHP a month. She is separated from her spouse and lives with her five school-aged children in the village of Consuelo, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. 
 
Earlier this year, Nadina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Nadina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory employed as working capital. Nadina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase milkfish, salmon, and other fish to offer for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Nadina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase milkfish, salmon, and other fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau T. is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai. She is engaged and has a small child. To make a living, Sau has a fishing business, primarily harvesting and selling wild-caught fish. She has been in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 270 WST a month.

In 2008, Sau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1800 WST from SPBD which was used to purchase additional fish to raise. She is now requesting a new loan of 2250 WST to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Sau from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with one child. He has a greenhouse business where he grows tomatoes and cucumbers. Alexander has been in this business for 8 years. He enjoys working with the land and providing people with high quality vegetables. Alexander keeps his greenhouses and his household in order. He fixes things himself when they break. His wife, Irina, helps Alexander in this business as well. 

Alexander has three greenhouses and he would like to develop his business further. He would like to borrow 10,000 Hryvnias to build an additional greenhouse. He hopes to grow more vegetables this year and increase income for his family.

loans.use: To build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Mrs. Nov Brok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen people located in Ta Su village, Takeo province. Mrs. Nov B. is the village bank president selected by the other members, who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's lives.

Mrs. Nov B. is a widow who lives alone and has no children. She owns a general store in the local village where she is able to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Mrs. Nov B. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio D. is 55 years old and married with two school-aged children. He is from the village of Unidos Plaridel Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Leoncio owns and operates a specialized retail store. His main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Leoncio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Leoncio joined GDMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Leoncio is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Leoncio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to supplement his family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is a married woman who lives in Puerto Princesa, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a vehicle repair shop. Her husband Elpidio, who is 53 years old, works as a welder to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 28 and 32 years old. Catalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Catalina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase spare parts, materials and supplies that her crew needs to repair the vehicles. She is working hard  so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of the business and to purchase land for their house. Catalina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase  spare parts, materials and supplies necessary to operate her vehicle repair shop

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo P., from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, is 44 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Angelo owns and operates a fishing business harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Engaged in his business for over 10 years, he earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Angelo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 50000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional fish to sell, he is requesting his seventh loan of 50000 PHP to expand the business. Angelo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Irma Carolina

texts.es: Irma Carolina: es de 33 años es casada tiene 3 hijos que estan estudiando, su negocio es un cafe internet y una venta de productos pra el hogar como shampoo,detergente,suavisante,para ropa,etc, esta situado en su domicilio con la ayuda de su esposo ha tenido mucha demanda para su negocio y nececita un nuevo credito para para poder comprar computadoras,un escritorio,y productos para el hogar,y asi dar un mejor servicio a su clientes le da gracias a Dios por haber encontrado esta intitucion que le a apoyado con darle el credito anterior el cual pago con puntualidad.
texts.en: Irma Carolina is 33 years old and she has 3 children who are in school. She has an internet cafe business and she also sells household items such as shampoo, detergents, fabric softeners, etc. Her business is installed in her home and, with the help of her husband; she has had a great deal of demand for her business. She needs t anew loan to purchase computers, a desk, and products for the home. She will be able to provide her clients with a better level of service. She thanks God for having found this organization that has supported with a loan. The previous loan she had was paid on time.

loans.use: to purchase comptuers, a desk, and to purchase products for the home

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn was born in 1955. He is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land, on which he grows rice to sell as well as to feed his own family. 

His wife, Phal, is presented in the picture with him. She owns a general store in a nearby village, where she sells groceries to help support the family. Lorn is the father of four children. One is a fisherman, another helps his mother in her business, and the others study at a local public school. 

Lorn's rice field is far away from the irrigation system, so to improve his product, Mr. Lorn is seeking a loan to buy gasoline to transport water to the field. He will use the rest of the loan to hire farming laborers to help him farm.

loans.use: To buy gasoline to transport water to his rice field.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard, 23, is a hard-working man who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in trading in maize for three years, starting with sales of 5-10 bags of maize per month and now selling 20-30 bags or 50 in a good season. His hardships are limited capital and high transport costs. His desire is to own a regional food store and to educate his children. Richard intends to use the loan facility to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En esta comunidad de Arin conocimos a la señora Josefa de 47 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene cinco hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Calca, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Josefa se dedica a la venta de verduras y también a crianza de animales menores y ella vende en diferentes mercados de los diferentes ciudades como Calca, Urubamba y Cusco. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran hortalizas como por ejemplo papa, maíz y otras vegetales.   

El crédito que ha solicitado Josefa es de 1,200 nuevos soles a Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para comprar más semillas. Josefa es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, in Cusco department, there is a place which is known as Arin community.  It is known for its beautiful landscape, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

In Arin community, we meet 47 year-old Josefa who lives with her partner and has five children.  She lives in her own home which has water and electricity.  It is located in Calca province, in Cusco department.  The main business activities in this area are farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Josefa sells vegetables and also raises animals.  She makes her sales in the markets in different cities such as Calca, Urubamba and Cusco.  Her parents taught her this work when she was very young and now she has her own farmland where she works together with her partner.  With a lot of care, they grow vegetables such as potatoes, corn, etc.

Josefa has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Asociación Arariwa and she will use it to buy more seeds.  Josefa is a hard-working woman who has always known how to improve herself in life and get what she wants.

loans.use: to buy more seeds

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece aldepartamentode Piura.  Los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Desde hace 4 años Maximina a colocado su picantería en donde vende platos hechos a base de pescados y mariscos en su propio domicilio, donde vende cerveza, es un producto que se vende más los fines de semana.  Con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.

Al observar que su negocio va creciendo Maximina a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más cerveza y así pueda obtenermayores ganacias con las ventas que realiza, lo que le permitirá brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Maximina es una mujer emprenderora y muy trabajadora con el único objetivo de sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Maximina is a 38 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and children in her own house.  She has electrical service.  They live in a rural zone in the Tambogrande district, which is in the Piura departments.  The population dedicates itself to agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

Four years ago Maximina set up her pub where she sells fish and seafood dishes in her own home.  She sells beer there, which is a product that sells more on the week-ends.  With the income she gets she will be able to cover the family obligations.

Upon observing that her business is growing, Maximina believes it advisable to request a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy more beer.  This way she will be able to get more income from the sales that she makes.  This will allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

Maximina is a very enterprising and hard-working woman whose only objective is to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of beer.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is 35 years of age, married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has a retail store that she has been operating for almost four years. Her net income is 19,000 PHP per month. Rosalie is requesting a loan for 40,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her retail store. She also plans to set up a mini-eatery in their village to make additional income. She would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Baowendpinda Group

texts.fr:
Mme Sanata est la responsable du groupe BAOWENDPINDA. Elle est marié et mère d’un enfant. Il a 12ans et va à l’école. Elle a une personne a sa charge.

Mme est tisseuse depuis 5ans et vend parallèlement des mangues à la période des mangues. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de kouritenga.Ses clients les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter un Ball de fils de tisse.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle économise et aide son mari dans la popote. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique de pagnes tissés et prendre soin de son enfant afin de lui offrir un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
Ms. Sanata is the leader of the Baowendpinda group. She is married and the mother of 1 child, who is 12 and goes to school. She has one dependent.

Sanata has been a weaver for the past 5 years, she also sells mangoes when they are in season. She obtains her supplies at the Kouritenga market, and her customers are men. 

Ms. Sanata wants to buy a bale of thread for weaving. With her profits, she will save and help her husband in buying food. She plans to open a large shop of woven cloth and to take care of her child to give him a better future.

loans.use: to buy one bale of thread for weaving

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 53 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Arlene has a shop that sells electronic loads from several networks such as GLOBE and SMART. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 in order to buy additional electronic loads.

Arlene has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads.

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Met and her husband cooperate to find a suitable job to earn more income for their family. Met is a fish and lotus seller in a market near her house. Her husband catches fish in ponds, lakes and the river. Together, they can earn perhaps $10.40 per day. To improve their income, Met wishes to borrow about $800 in order to purchase a place to sell fish and lotuses at another market.

loans.use: to purchase a place to sell fish and lotus at another market.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last six years. He is 31 years old and married to Phylis. They have two children who attend school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be Peter's third loan. He repaid both of his previous loans on time. He plans to use this loan to buy ten lambs which he will raise and sell later for a profit.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy ten lambs to raise and sell for profit

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a divorced woman with seven children, four attend school while three have completed school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, knitting babies' hats and pullovers. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of ready market. Dena dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a weaving machine, materials and needles. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a weaving machine, materials and needles.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es: Este cliente se desempeña como profesora docente de un colegio del crucero es el sexto crédito financiado los cuales los ha invertido en mejoras de su casa, este ultimo lo solicito para la compra de uniformes y gastos personales.
texts.en: This client works as a teaching professor in a cruiseship school. This is her sixth loan. She has invested the others in improvements for her house. She is requesting this last one to buy uniforms and for personal expenses.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms for her son and to cover other expenses.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is 31 years old and married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire.

Tam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food stall at her house to sell soft drinks and coffee to the people in her community.

Tam would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of soft drinks and coffee to stock her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and earn more income from her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to save more money and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and coffee to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Tchotchovi

texts.fr:
Tchotchovi est une femme âgée de 27 ans, elle est mariée à un chauffeur et elle a un enfant.
Tchotchovi est une revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend pour sa clientèle composée de toutes personnes des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et exerce seul dans son commerce. 
Tchotchovi sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit pour l’achat de divers produits d’alimentation générale afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
.
texts.en:
Tchotchovi, age 27, is married to a driver and has one child. She's been a reseller since 2005. She buys food products that she resells to a wide clientele. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé, and runs her business on her own.

Tchotchovi is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy various food products and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy various food products

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Mustapha is a 50-year-old married man who is a father of 5 children between 19 and 25 years old. 

Mustapha was recently introduced to KADET.  He runs a video café in Bombolulu and has been running this business for the last twelve years. This marks Mustapha’s first borrowing from KADET.  With this loan, he plans to purchase a DVD player and a UPS back-up system. He hopes to use the anticipated profits which will be generated from the business to repay the loan and gradually expand his business.

In the future, he would like to own a retail shop as a secondary income generating business.

loans.use: buy a DVD player and a UPS

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es: Rene Antonio  es un señor trabajador y emprendedor de 32 años. Él es transportista tiene un taxi desde hace seis años en el que invertirá el crédito para mantenimiento del vehículo, cambio de aceite, llantas…etc. y otra parte en reparaciones a la vivienda.
texts.en:
Rene Antonio, 32 years old, is a hardworking and enterprising man. He is a taxi cab driver with his own taxi. He has been doing this for six years. 

He will use the loan to maintain his car, change the oil, and for tires and the other part of the loan will be used to make home repairs.

loans.use: to maintain his car

loans.name: Cassien

texts.en:
Cassien is 54 years old and is married with seven children aged between 17 and 34 years old. Cassien owns a business selling jerrycans, sacks, and so on. 

This is his fifth successful year in this business and the hours of his work are from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. He currently employs three people to help him. 

Cassien has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his business by buying more jerrycans and sacks to sell. With his profits, he will be able to save for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more jerrycans, sacks, etc.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es: Valeriana, de 52 años es una mujer dulce. Vive en compañía de Lino, su esposo desde hace 33 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo cuidan de Elmer, el menor, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Gracias a la herencia de su padre, quien tenía hectáreas de terrenos productivos, pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos gracias a la siembra. Sus principales cultivos constan de maíz, papa y alfalfa, los que cuida con mucho esmero y en la temporada de cosecha, los comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de Huancayo. Ya tiene 15 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo logró adquirir un auto con el que realiza trasporte público en las rutas de Hualahoyo hacia La Punta, ahí obtiene una ganancia extra. Gracias al apoyo de su chofer a quien le paga un salario. Ahora planea abrir un negocio de tornos y soldaduras, pues desea tener un ingreso estable para su vejez. Sabe que lo logrará, ya que recibe el apoyo de su esposo; quien trabaja en una reconocida mina del país. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Hualahoyo al progreso” y este es el undécimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Valeriana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en:
Valeriana, 52, is a sweet woman. She lives with Lino, her husband of 33 years. They have 3 children together, but only the youngest, Elmer, lives in their home with them in Hualahoyo. Thanks to an inheritance from her father, who had hectares of farmland, she was able to take care of her children with the harvest. Her main crops are corn, potatoes and alfalfa, which she takes good care of. During harvest time she sells them in the market in Huancayo. She has been doing this for 15 years, and was able to buy a car that she uses for public transport on the route from Hualahoyo to La Punta, which gives her additional income. She has a salaried driver who works for her. Now she wants to open up a hardware store because she wants a stable income as she gets older. She knows that she will be able to do it with help from her husband, who works in a mine. 

She belongs to the group "Hualahoyo al progreso" and this is her 11th credit with MFP. She hopes that your support will help her realize her plans. On her part, she promises to make her payments, as with previous loans. She is grateful to be part of the association because all of the members are responsible and united. Valeriana will use her loan to buy natural fertilizers for her corn crop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Nancy is providing multipurpose cab or jeepney services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the jeepney.

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the jeepney.

loans.name: Ilda Maria

texts.es: La señora Ilda a sus 48 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ropa interior para venderla posteriormente a crédito a sus vecinos, familiares y amigos. La señora Ilda lleva 27 años desempeñando este oficio. Con motivo de la temporada de navidad, la señora Ilda requiere comprar surtido de ropa interior con el fin de tener mercancía disponible para suplir la demanda de fin de año. Con lo anterior, la señora Ilda podrá aumentar sus ventas y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de un hermano que vive con ella y esta en situación de discapacidad mental. El sueño de la señora Ilda es tener una casa propia para su hermano y ella.
texts.en: Ilda is 48 years old. She buys underwear, which she then sells to her neighbors, family, and friends on credit. Ilda has been doing this for 27 years. Due to the Christmas season, Ilda needs to purchase supplies of underwear with the goal of having merchandise available to meet the end-of-year demand. With these supplies, Ilda will be able to increase her sales, and in this way improve her quality of life and that of a brother who lives with her and is mentally incapacitated. Ilda's dream is to have her own house for herself and her brother.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Amidar's Group

texts.en:
Amidar's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Amidar is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamwonge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past four years, Amidar has been working hard to manage her retail shop and fresh fruit stand, which sells fresh fruits, other foods, and home products to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Amidar has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruit and other food items for resale, and will help Amidar to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. Amidar hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a big home. 

Amidar is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Amidar's future prospects by helping her to learn English, writing, and financial literacy.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and other food items for resale.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de Jesus tiene 40 años es casada, vive con el esposo  y los  hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz hace 15 años.

Mariana  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres estudia la Biblia.
texts.en:
Mariana de Jesús is 40 years old. She’s married and lives with her husband and children in Agua Frías de Mocache, which belongs to the Mocacha Cantón.

The “El Progreso” (Progress) communal bank is located in Aguas Frías de Mocache in the Mocache Canton. The members of this bank have been short cycle corn and rice farmers for 15 years.

Mariana grows rice and corn on her own land. She buys her supplies in Mocache and sells at the Mocache market.

She requested the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure for her crops.  The loan has helped her increase her income for her family’s use and to invest in planting.

Her dream is to buy a house.

She really enjoys studying the Bible in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Luis Bernardo

texts.es: El señor Luis Bernardo se ha caracterizado por ser una persona demasiado pujante en la vida, donde le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para conseguir su propio sustento y el de sus padres. Luis Bernardo se dedica al alquiler de equipos de construcción como andamios, tablones, soportes, entre otros, y de esta manera se gana el dinero necesario para vivir en su residencia. Gracias a la buena reputación de sus productos en el municipio donde reside, Luis Bernardo tiene muchos pedidos por parte de sus clientes, sin embargo, Luis Bernardo no tiene la capacidad para atender todos los pedidos y se ve obligado a renunciar a alguno de ellos. Es por esto que Luis Bernardo aspira a tener un mayor inventario de sus productos en alquiler y poder así alquilar más productos a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus padres.
texts.en: Luis Bernardo has been noted for being a very driven person in life.  He has had to work very hard to support himself and his parents.  Luis Bernardo leases out construction equipment like scaffolding, beams and supports, among others, and this is how he generates income necessary to live at home.  Thanks to the good reputation of his products in the town where he resides, Luis Bernardo has many customer orders.  However, Luis Bernardo does not have the capacity to fill all the orders he gets and sometimes has to say no to some of them.  This is why Luis Bernardo hopes to have better inventory of equipment to rent so that he can rent out more items to his customers thus improving his income and improving his and his parents’ quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Elena is making & peddling snacks like rice cakes, sugar coated rice or suman & bitso-bitso. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.

Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa operates a fufu selling business in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). Fufu (also known as foofoo or foufou) is a paste made from starchy root vegetables put into a mortar and beaten smooth with a pestle until the desired consistency is reached. The soft dough is served and eaten with soup, such as a light tomato soup, groundnut soup, or palm oil fruit soup. Theresa is a single mother with 2 children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Theresa uses her income to provide for the entire family. Theresa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, tomatoes, fish, and chicken, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.
