As a middle school graduate, Theresa understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use her profits to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, tomatoes, fish and chicken.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.en: Ketty is 34 years old married and lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. She trades majorly in used clothes mainly buying and selling to men and women in her area. She is such a hardworking woman determined to raise and educate her children. She started the business seven years ago with the support of her husband, and she is proud of the progress, although challenged by increasing transport costs, competition and limited capital to expand her business. She hopes to expand her clothing business in future. Ketty has requested for a loan to buy more clothes for selling to her customers.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is an active member of Life in Africa. She is young, dedicated and very determined to make a secure future for herself. She originally came from Western Uganda but moved to Kampala where she lives with an aunt who agreed to help her with her education by taking her in and paying the school fees. She finished her secondary schooling but going on to the University became impossible due to lack of funds. But she would not be stopped.

She found the Womens Vocational Education Center where she managed to enroll in a course to learn catering. She graduated after 2 years and is determined to use what she learned to start a business. She currently works Monday through Friday at Life in Africa and runs a small scale catering service on the weekends. She saved carefully and has been able to buy things she needed such as warmers, plates, forks, knives, and table cloths which she rents out to her customers.

Her client list has grown and now she is ready to expand her small business. This will entail the purchase of more equipment so she will be able to cater to more customers and handle larger gatherings. For this reason she is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000. She will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

Below is her budget

300 plates @ 1000/ ------------300,000/

150 forks @ 1200/ -----------180,000/

150 knives @ 1000/-----------150,000/

4 big saucepans @ 40000/ -----160,000/

Transport----------------------10,000/

Totals ------------------------800,000/

WE Team to benefit: Transport 4 liA

loans.use: Buying Catering Equipment

loans.name: Nury

texts.en:
Nury has been working for two years selling a natural product line called Herbalife. She used to be overweight and came into contact with this company as a consumer. She saw results and began selling the products. She was given the start-up capital by her daughter, who works. Nury prepares foods with these products and promotes them to her friends. She works in her business from 6:00AM to 1:00PM.

She needs the loan to increase her inventory of natural products so that she can increase her number of clients.

Nury was born in Cañar. She is 39 years old. She has 3 children, one of whom works and helps with household expenses. Her husband left her 5 years ago, but he provides her with a small amount of money every month. Thanks to the efforts of Nury and her daughters, the family is trying to get ahead. With Nury’s profits, they have an income that allows them to cover certain expenses. Nury is an enterprising person who is always looking for something to do. Her aspiration is to strengthen the business and to continue supporting her children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Nury lleva 2 años vendiendo productos naturales Herbalife. Ella sufría de sobre peso e ingreso a esta empresa como consumidora. Ella vio los resultados en ella y se dedico a venderlos. El capital para iniciar se lo dio su hija que trabaja. Nury prepara los alimentos con estos productos y los promociona a sus amigos que ya la conocen. Su negocio se mueve a partir de las 6:00AM hasta las 1:00PM.

Ella necesita el préstamo para incrementar los productos naturales y poder captar más clientes.

Nury nació en Cañar. Tiene 39 años. Con 3 hijos, uno de ellos ya trabaja y apoya en el hogar. Su esposo la dejó desde hace 5 años pero si le pasa una mensualidad pequeña. Gracias al esfuerzo de Nury y sus hijas luchan por salir adelante. Con el ingreso de Nury tienen una entrada que les permite cubrir ciertos gastos. Nury es una persona emprendedora que esta buscando siempre hacer algo, su aspiración es fortalecer bien el negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: To increase inventory of Natural Herbalife products.

loans.name: Lusitania

texts.en:
Lusitania is applying for her second loan with Kiva and Mifex. She owns a stand where she sells typical Ecuadorian dishes, such as "encebollado", a fish stew made with albacore and yucca. With her first loan she was able to improve the cart where she sells food. She added wheels and an umbrella to the cart in order to become mobile and travel to crowded places where she could sell. Lusitania did so well she paid her loan off early.

She is requesting this second loan because she wants to help her husband in a new business idea they have. Lusitania has noticed that the new buses from the city have stops that are still far from most people's homes. She wants to invest in a motorcycle cart so her husband can provide this taxi service to the people of the area. They are hopeful that with this loan they will be able to make improvements to their home.

loans.use: Invest in a used motorcycle cart for her husband

loans.name: Alvan

texts.en: Alvan is married and has 3 children. He is 57, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He has sheep. He started this business 15 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy grass and fodder for his sheep.

loans.use: to buy grass and fodder

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
Ceferina is 50 years old and married. She has a 9 year old son who is currently in the primary grades in a local public school. Ceferina talks about how the family's priority is making sure that her son continues to study so that he will some day be a professional with better opportunies in life than those his parents have enjoyed. Ceferina and her husband were not able to finish school.

Twelve years ago Ceferina opened her own business. She has a bar where she sells fast food and a variety of beverages. Thanks to the good earnings generated by her business, she has been able to buy herself a house and she has now opened a second location in the municipal market, manned by her husband.

Despite their age, Ceferina and her husband would like to continue their progress. For that reason, they decided to take up their studies again. Ceferina dreams about being able to enter the university and earn a degree; she'd start tomorrow if she could.

Ceferina is applying for a loan of $1000 to invest in the purchase of a refrigerator with glass door for her new location. This would allow her to sell more soft drinks and beer, the products for which she receives the most demand.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ceferina tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 9 años que está cursando sus estudios primarios en una escuela pública de la ciudad. Ceferina cuenta que la prioridad de la pareja es que su hijo siga estudiando para que algún día pueda llegar a ser un profesional y obtener mejores oportunidades en la vida ya que ellos no pudieron culminar sus estudios.

Hace 12 años Ceferina abrió su propio negocio, ella tiene un bar donde vende comidas rápidas y diferentes tipos de bebidas. Gracias a las buenas ganancias que le generó este negocio a podido comprarse una casa y ahora han abierto otro local en el mercado municipal que es atendido por su marido.

A pesar de la edad, Ceferina y su marido desean seguir progresando, es así como la pareja decidió retomar sus estudios y actualmente cursan la secundaria durante la noche en una escuela pública. Ella nos cuenta que la pareja es un ejemplo para sus amigos y familiares que apoyan y felicitan a la pareja por seguir adelante con sus estudios, Ceferina sueña con poder ingresar a la universidad y obtener un titulo el día de mañana.

Ceferina solicita un crédito de $ 1000 para invertirlos en la compra de una heladera con vitrina para su nuevo local, de esta forma podrán vender más bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas, ya que son las de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator with a window to  store and display beverages

loans.name: Santos Daniel

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Santos Daniel. I’m a merchant and I have a food and drink shop located in my home called “Pulpería DAYLI.” I have been dedicating myself to this type of activity for several years, and it generates income to cover family expenses. Currently I need to restock the business since the clientele grows each day, but I don’t have sufficient capital for that investment. It is important to mention that this is a family business in view that my wife and my children collaborate with me in their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Santos Daniel, soy comerciante, cuento con una pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación, llamada pulperia DAYLI, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente necesito surtir mas el negocio ya que la clientela cada día es mayor y no se cuenta con el capital suficiente para dicha inversión. Es importante mensionar que este es un negocio familiar en vista que mi esposa y mis hijos me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: To buy sugar, butter, oil, flower, eggs, toilet paper and soft drinks

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is 35 years old, married, the mother of 6 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She has been in this business since 1995. She is in need of a loan of $250 to buy more foodstuffs and provisions.

loans.use: To buy provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. makes and sells snacks. She wants the loan to purchase more ingredients so that she can increase her inventory of snacks and increase sales.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Arely Guadalupe

texts.es:
Arely Guadalupe P. P. is a young married mother of two, one of her kids is in high school and the other in primary school. This woman's business is a corner store. She started it when she noticed that her husband's income was not sufficient. The start up was very difficult because she had no idea how to start a small business, because prior to that she was a pork butcher. Nevertheless, with experience she started earning and with time, she started to build her business, and has managed to help her children.

Arely has been working with CEPRODEL for 6 years now and feels very satisfied with the timely credits she has been granted, helping her supply the needs of her business and of her daily clients. She has 14 loans in her credit history which she has invested in the purchase of products which is a major need to acquire them to survive in her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Arely Guadalupe P. P. es una joven casada y con dos hijos que están estudiando uno en la secundaria y el otro en primaria. El negocio de esta señora es una abarrotaría, lo comienza cuando observa que los ingresos de su esposo eran muy pocos. Su inicio fue muy duro ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo comenzar el negocio por lo que se dedicaba solamente al trabajo en el destace de cerdos. Sin embargo, con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera ha preparado a sus hijos.

Arely trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 6 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 14 créditos que los ha invertido para la compra de sus productos que es su mayor necesidad adquirirlos para poder sobrevivir con su humilde hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en:
Sobir sells food (such as confectionaries, juice, sugar, and macaroni foods) to local stores. When Sobir started the business six years ago, it was only retail sales. Gradually, he expanded the business by purchasing goods wholesale and distributing them. The business became stable and successful.

Recently, Sobir paid for his son's wedding party and, as a result, is low on capital. He will use this loan to buy goods to increase his inventory.

Sobir is 42 years old, married, and has four children. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase goods to increase inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. is 29years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in Benin-City, Edo State, Nigeria. Mary sells general provisions and drinks in her community. She learnt this business from her mother and has been in business since 1999.  Mary now needs a loan of US $875 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more Drinks and Provision for sale

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
The Gaviotas (Seagulls) assocation has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for 3 years. The group is formed of 18 women that work very responsibly.

For the most part, they used to sell used clothing, an activity that for the moment has a lot of legal problems, and it's not very profitable anymore. This is why they decided to search for another type of business. Now with the help of the tailoring shops that Pro-Mujer offers, they design all types of clothing, that is to say: school uniforms, blouses, dresses, and pants. They also make backpacks and camera cases. They say that they need more capital to be able to buy raw materials and special machinery to make these products and in this way to make their businesses prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La asociación “GAVIOTAS” pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace 3 años, grupo formado por 18 mujeres que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad.

Ellas en gran parte se dedicaban a la venta de ropa usada, actividad que de momento tiene muchos problemas legales, ya no es muy rentable, entonces decidieron buscar otro tipo de negocio. Ahora con la ayuda de los talleres de confección que ofrece Pro-Mujer, diseñan ropa de todo tipo, es decir, uniformes de escuela, blusas, vestidos, pantalones de vestir, también confeccionan mochilas y estuches de cámaras. Afirman que necesitan capital para poder comprar materia prima y maquinaria especial para la fabricación de estos productos de esta manera lograr que sus negocios prosperen.

loans.use: They need capital to be able to buy raw materials and special machinery to make their products

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: K. Muhabbat is 55 years old. She is married and has a son. Her son is already married and has children of his own. Her husband helps her with the business. Muhabbat is a market vendor. She is selling foodstuff such as cotton-seed oil, sugar, tea, macaroni, and flour. She has been in this business for twelve years. The business is located in the local market, allowing Muhabbat to serve many clients and to have her clientele. The business is successful at generating the stable income which allows Muhabbat to support her family. Now Muhabbat wants to increase the range of goods that she sells so she is requesting this loan. Muhabbat promises to repay her loan within 6 months promptly and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty S. T., a 58-year-old woman, has seven children and works as a farmer. She started planting rice in 2004 but her farming is just to feed the family. Her husband is a horse-cart driver in the village and, on average, he earns $4/day.
The family is in a financial crisis due to inflation. Their income used to be able to support the family's daily expenses but inflation in recent months make all the basics like groceries, gas, rice and everything more expensive. To earn an extra profit, this couple would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a small tractor to plow the farmland and to rent  the tractor to the other farmers who have no cow or small tractor to plow the land.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor for farming and renting to others.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Mr. Sareth E. is a motorbike-taxi driver in Trear Chaoeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is 38 and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while two others are attending school. The remaining one is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Sitha Ros, is a farmer. She usually hires a laborer and some cattle to plow her rice field, but this time she does not have enough money to do so.

Thus, her husband, Mr. Sareth E., is requesting a loan to help pay for a laborer and cattle. He will also use part of the loan to purchase fertilizers to help increase crop yields. So far, Mr. Sareth E. has obtained one previous loan from AMK to build a new house and has succeeded in paying off the loan. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer and cattle to plow her rice field and purchase fertilizers to help increase crop yields.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 06 enfants, A. Rosa est née à Lomé en 1969. Avec 04 personnes à charges elle a excellé dans le commerce de chaussures. Très dynamique et dévoué elle lutte pour l’éducation de ses enfants. Dotée d’une bonne capacité de gestion, elle a entreprit le commerce de chaussures. Commerce qui lui a réussi jusqu’à ce jour.  
     
Cependant, vu la demande de plus en plus forte, A. manque de moyens pou accroître son commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son chiffre et veiller à  l éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Rosa A. was born in Lomé in 1969. She is married and the mother of six children. With four dependents, she excels in the shoe business. Highly dynamic and dedicated, she fights for her children's education. Equipped with a knack for management, she began trading in shoes, an occupation in which she has been successful to this day. Nevertheless, in the face of increasing demand, Mrs. A. lacks the means to grow her business. She is requesting a loan to increase her turnover and to look after her children's education.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of shoes

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Dame B. Victoire est née le 30/06/1960 à Porto-Novo, la capitale administrative du Bénin. Elle est mariée au sieur KPADONOU et est mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle revend les chaussures et sacs usagers de friperie et aussi des bassines, des pagnes et autres. Elle commencé cette activité depuis 7 ans et habite le quartier  Hindé depuis 15 ans. C'est pour faire face à la demande de ses clients qu'elle est venue solliciter pour la cinquième fois un prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoire B. was born June 30th, 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Mr. KPADONOU and is the mother of one child who is going to school. She retails shoes, bags of used clothing, as well as basins, cloth, and other wares. She has been doing business for the last seven years in the Hindé neighborhood, where she has also been living for 15 years. She is seeking a fifth loan from ALIDE to meet her customer demand.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and used clothing

loans.name: Thoar

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoar N. is a farmer in Sla Village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Soy Touch, helps out with their farm. Aside from this business, he is a motorbike taxi driver who can only make a small income to support his family. They have two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the younger one is attending the local school.

Although these family members have different businesses, they still cannot support the family well so Mrs. Thoar N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income after her cow has been sold. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Michael

texts.es: Michael tiene 25 años, es conviviente, tiene una hija y por ahora vive en la casa de sus suegros. En su niñez se dedicaba a la chacra, después, en busca de oportunidades, migró a Lima con la finalidad de trabajar en otra actividad que nos sea la agricultura, pero no se imaginaba que su pareja estuviera embarazada, fue el motivo por el cual regresó para hacerse cargo de su hija. Hace tres meses formó su familia, junto a su esposa e hija, en primera instancia va a construir su casa a base de umiro que es como unas palmas que le sirven para el tejido de las paredes, de ese modo ya vivir aparte y en el futuro piensa poner una tienda de abarrotes, su dificultad por el momento es la falta de dinero para poder agilizar la construcción de su casa. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprará hojas de umiro que le costarán un aproximado de S/250, y madera para la puerta.
texts.en:
Michael is 25 years old, lives with his partner, has a daughter, and, for now, is living with his in-laws. As a child he worked on a small farm (chacra), then migrated to Lima looking for other opportunities other than agriculture. At the time he did not know his partner was pregnant, which is why he returned to help raise his daughter. Three months ago his family came together, wife and daughter, and their first goal is to build a house out of umiro (a local plant from which the leaves are used to build walls) so as to be able to live on their own and, in the future, Michael plans to add on a sundries store. The challenge right now is a lack of money to expedite the construction of the house. This is the first time he has applied for a loan with MFP. With the money he hopes to buy umiro leaves which will cost approximately 250 soles and wood for the door.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase home construction materials

loans.name: Slmb Ii Group

texts.en:
These are teachers from the Sierra Leone Muslim Brotherhood (SLMB II) Primary school in Magburaka. It was founded in 1961 and named after its founding mission. SLMB II caters to children between the ages of nine and twelve (classes four-six).  SLMB II has a total of 581 pupils with a staff of seventeen teachers and administrators. They are very proud of their 98% pass rate on the most recent National Primary School Exams (NPSE). Last year, of the 103 pupils sent to take the exams,102 passed successfully.   

This is the group's first loan with SMT.  They heard of SMT from colleagues in other schools who have benefited greatly from SMT’s services. The use of the loan varies amongst the teachers.  Some of the staff members will start a small business.  Those who are already small business owners will invest the loan into their businesses. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture for their domiciles and others plan to pay either for their children’s education or to pursue further studies themselves. 

Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus making teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivator is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classroom have to find other ways of making ends meet. The vast majority of them engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (though this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest it in something productive. Many want to go to school but could not afford the cost. Some will want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salary is not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs.  And with their monthly salaries, they can repay easily via a payroll deduction type of system.

Forty-one year old Francis T. (third from right) is the head teacher at SLMB II.  He was born in Makeni Yoni, a village about forty-three miles from Magburaka town. He is married to a teacher and the two have six children.  Three of his children are in primary school and three in secondary school. Francis will invest his loan in business. He has already been in business for two years now. He buys and sells palm oil, ground-nuts and rice. With this loan, he will invest all of it in palm oil alone. He is expecting to be able to get at least twenty-five “barters” of palm oil (five gallons of palm oil make one barter). He purchases the palm oil in the nearby village of Makump, about nine miles round-trip from Magburaka.  A barter of palm oil costs something between Le 40,000 and 50,000. There are no constant prices; prices fluctuate depending on the season and the availability of the palm oil. Francis is very excited about this loan as the profit it will generate for him will make him “feel like I’ve been a successful somebody in life.”

loans.use: Buying and selling palm oil to supplement his teaching salary

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Norma es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Norma tiene una panificadora llamada Alondras que esta ubicada cerca al mercado Nery García en un local alquilado, Norma elabora panes típicos y biscochos, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo local y en los terminales terrestres para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de 4 personas.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y harina.
Norma sueña con tener una panadería en su casa, terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of Banco Comunal Desarrollo (‘Development Community Bank’). She is 30-years old, married with 3 children, and owns a bakery called Alondras next to the Nery Garcia market in a rented location. Norma makes bread and biscochos (sugar cookies), which she sells from her store as well as the bus terminals. She hires 4 people to sell bread in the terminals. Norma needs a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy sugar and flour. She dreams of finishing construction on her house and running her bakery business from home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar and flour

loans.name: Kuisun

texts.en:
Kuisun has very good sense of humor and her jovial spirits help her face difficult times. She’s been immersed in raising animals since her childhood and for that reason she decided to remain in this business. She works very hard to obtain the income that will satisfy her family’s necessities. The immense love that she feels for her children and her faithful husband motivates her to keep working hard. She wishes to buy more animals and in this way to increase her income.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing feed for her animals

loans.name: Sandra Nohelia

texts.es: La joven Sandra tiene 28 años de edad, reside en laureles norte, con dos hijos que estudian la primaria, su esposo trabaja de conductor, ella redesempeña de operaria en zona franca, pues es cansado ya que tiene que trabajar rápido para poder ganar mejor, este es su tercer ciclo de préstamo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro frontal en su casa. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa, cambiar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sandra is a young woman of 28 years of age who resides in Laureles Norte with two children who study in primary school. Her husband works as a driver. She works in a tax-free area, and it is a tiring job since she has to work fast to be able to earn more. This is her third loan cycle with Afodenic. She will invest in buying construction materials to build a frontal wall on her home. Her plans are to be able to finish building her house and change jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Som Oeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Som Oeurn T. is a villager in Srey Chey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Loek Tet, is a palm-juice tapper. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less than enough income to support their household. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Som Oeurn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income for her family. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income for her family.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo Martín y sus 4 hijos; Betzabeth de 21, Sonia de 15, Jesús de 10 y Víctor de 8 años de edad, en su casa propia. Ella y su esposo se dedican al alquiler de luces y equipos de sonido, desde hace 3 años en un espacio que acondicionaron en su casa, proveen estos equipos para fiestas de cumpleaños y reuniones sociales diversas. Les favorece mucho tener este negocio, ya que les arroja buenas ganancias, a demás de ser un trabajo tranquilo, en el cual pueden apoyarse mutuamente. Sonia quiere ofrecer siempre novedades a sus clientes, por ello, esperan agrandar su negocio con mejores equipos para obtener mayores ganancias, y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Hace un año que trabaja con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de luces más modernas, así como parlantes y mejores accesorios para fiestas.
texts.en:
Sonia is 40 years old and lives with her husband Martín and their four children, Betzabeth, 21, Sonia, 15, Jesús, 10, and Victor, 8, in their own house. She and her husband have rented out lights and sound equipment for three years from a space they set up in their house. They provide this equipment for birthday parties and various social gatherings. It suits them to have their own business, because it brings in good earnings and is a tranquil job in which they can support each other. Sonia wants to offer new innovations to her clients, which is why she wants to improve their business with better equipment. This way, they can earn more money and increase their family's standard of living. Sonia has worked with MFP for one years and has always been punctual with her payments. The money she is requesting is to buy more modern lights, along with speakers and better accessories for parties.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying lights and equipment to rent out for parties

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary G. is 53 years old, married and blessed with four children. She lives in Zone 3, Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. Her husband is an electrician and a plumber. She engages in food and snack vending. She is also into food processing and catering services.

Mary is working so hard to earn money for the family. Everyday, she peddles the food and snacks in their neighborhood and nearby villages. Due to financial incapacity and increasing demands of her business, she wants to apply a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 7000 to purchase additional materials and ingredients. If granted, this will be a great help for the family to generate more income. This will be Mary's second loan.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food and snack vending

location.town: Zone 3, Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Oem M. is forty-five years old and married. She lives with seven of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband work a farm and breed ducks, typically making $6 each day. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work in the fields. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have created a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Oem M. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan to purchase feed for her ducks, a purchase that she believes can bring an increase to her daily income.

loans.use: To buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina P. is from the village of Mohon, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Rosalina is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalina sells clothes. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing to the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new products to sell

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos. La vivienda donde habita es prestada, es decir, es de su familia que vive en la paz, ellos cuidan la casa. Simona se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado, se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo atras. Cuenta con muchos clientes. el esposo de Simona, es propietario de un vehiculo que lo hace trabajar de taxi.  El nivel de competencia es alto, ya que existen varios puestos de venta de comida. El destino del credito es para capital de operacion, compra al por mayor de ingredientes que ella usa con mas frecuencia en sus comidas. Como ser arroz, fideo y otros. Es el tercer credito al que accede Simona, en los dos anteriores creditos mostro un buen comportamiento. Si ancedentes negativos en el sistema financiero
texts.en:
Simona is 50 years old, married, and has 2 children. The home that she lives in is barrowed, that is to say, it belongs to family members that currently live in La Paz; Simona and her family take care of the home. Simona dedicates herself to the sale of food in the market, an activity that she has carried out for many years; she has many clients. Simona’s husband owns a vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services. Simona has a lot of competition given that there are many food stands. The loan will be used for operation capital to purchase ingredients wholesale that she uses frequently in her food such as rice, noodles, and other items. This is the third loan that Simona has requested, and in both previous loans she exemplified good behavior and had no negative past credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to purchase ingredients wholesale).

loans.name: Shirmohi

texts.ru: Ширмохи Назарова проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 37 лет. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Ширмохи более 4 лет занимается торговлей, она имеет торгвую точку на рынке, где в основном занимается продажей одежды. Клиентка просит кредит, для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Shirmohi N. lives in the Hamadoni district. She is a 37-year-old widow with four children. For more than four years, Shirmohi has been engaged in business: she has a market stall where she is in general involved in selling clothing. The client is requesting a loan in order to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El señor Abelardo no aparece en la foto en su representación sale su esposa la señora Nora Nelly.
Abelardo R. P. es un señor con el trascurso de los años fue haciendo mejoras en su vivienda con ahorros propios, pensando el en bienestar de sus tres hijas para  dejarles un buen patrimonio y dar confort. Ahora el recurre a nuestra institución recomendado por su hermana que con crédito anterior también le ayuda a mejorar su casa el señor R. se interesa por que ya no tiene capital para terminar de hacerle los acabados como enjarre de la casa.
Su esposa es una señora emprendedora que aparte de atender su casa ella se dedica a la venta de tortilla de harina caseras para dar sustento a su familia y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares aunque el trabaja en maquiladora prefieren darle lo mejor a sus 3 hijas
texts.en:
Mr. Abelardo does not appear in this photo, in his place appears his wife, Ms. Nora Nelly. Abelardo R. P. is a man who, over many years, has improved his house using his own savings. He thinks about the well-being of his three daughters and wants to leave them comfortable and with a nice property.

Now he comes to our institution on the recommendation of his sister who, using a previous loan, also helped him improve his house. Mr. R. is interested because now he does not have any capital for the finishing touches on his house, such as plastering the outside of the house.

His wife is a very enterprising woman who, beside taking care of the house, sells home-made flour tortillas to help support her family and help her husband with the family expenses. Even though Mr. R. works in a factory, they want to give the best to their three daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plastering his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock of clothing

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita M. is from the village of Bulao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Marita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cold beverages including soft drinks and juices in the local community. Marita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Bulao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina O., a 50-year-old mother of one child, is a rice farmer. She tills and grows rice to supply her family with food, clothing and other basic needs. Currently, her family owns a 1-hectare farm. Her husband, Melchor, is the one managing their farm to ensure a bountiful harvest for the family. 

Marina is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming items like fertilizers and insecticides.

She is a new CEVI client. The reason why she chose to obtain loan with CEVI is because they offer the lowest interest rate of 2% a month.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Kegue

texts.fr:
Cette dame qui tient des citrons dans sa main fait partie d’une A. dénommée « K. KEGUE » ; il s’agit d’un groupe de solidarité constitué de 05 femmes, où les membres du groupe mettent ensemble leurs ressources pour le bien être de tous. La dame qui tient du citron est veuve et assure seule l’éducation de son enfant ; elle vend des citrons depuis 2007.
Deux femmes du groupe vendent du charbon ; l’une d’entre elle est mariée alors que l’autre est veuve ; la première a débuté son commerce depuis 2007 alors que la seconde exerce son activité depuis 2006. 
Une troisième femme vend de l’huile de palme et elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2006.
Enfin la cinquième dame vend de la boisson locale et cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses 04 enfants ; elle autre a débuté son commerce depuis 2004. Tous les membres du groupe « K. kegue » sollicitent un crédit de WAGES pour renforcer leurs activités ; elles n’ont aucune inquiétude pour rembourser ce prêt car elles comptent sur la caution solidaire et l’obligation morale des unes envers les autres.
texts.en:
This woman, who is holding the lemons in her hand, is part of an organization known as "K. KEGUE". This group consists of 5 women and the woman consolidate their resources for the well-being of everyone in the group.

The woman that holds the lemons is widowed and is responsible for the education of her child on her own. She has sold lemons since 2007.

Two women in the group sell charcoal; one of whom is married and the other is widowed. The first started her business in 2007 and the second began her enterprise in 2006.

The third woman sells palm oil and debuted her business in 2006.

Finally, the fifth woman sells local drinks, which enables her to provide for the needs of her 4 children; she started her business in 2004.

All of the women in the group "K. Kegue" are requesting a loan to strengthen their activities. They are not worried about repaying this loan because they count on their solidarity and each woman's moral obligation to one another.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal, palm oil, lemons and sacks of corn.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel H. is married and has two children. He has been through senior high education. Samuel sells soft drinks, like malt, coca cola, etc. at castle near Eguase, which he has been doing since 2004. His wife is a trader. Samuel uses his income pay for the children's school fees and the general up keep of the house. Samuel will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel wishes to re-invest his profit into his business.

loans.use: Samuel will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband financially to provide for the family.

Mariama is a petty trader. She sells all kinds of cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. Mariama sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Lidio Mariano

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo del departamento de Chinandega, el señor Lidio Mariano G. se dedica arduamente a su actividad agrícola por medio de la siembra de hortalizas con el propósito de levantar una excelente cosecha y así llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos.

El señor Lidio actualmente está sembrando chiltomas y tomates pero para esto requiere los insumos agrícolas como son insecticidas y fertilizantes y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de estos insumos y a lo inmediato iniciar a aplicarlos para obtener una cosecha exitosa y continuar dedicándose a su actividad agrícola con mucho mas desempeño.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Viejo, in the Chinandega region, Señor Lidio Mariano G. works hard in the agricultural trade, planting vegetables with the objective of raising a bumper crop so that he can feed his family, which consists of his wife and two children. Señor Lidio is currently planting chiltomas (small peppers) and tomatoes, but this requires agricultural supplies such as insecticides and fertilizers. For this reason he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these supplies, which he will immediately begin to apply to obtain a successful harvest so that he can continue to perform his agricultural activities well.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Mrs. Sary Muon Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people in Rumchek village in Takeo province have joined together to request a group loan. All of the members will use their portion of the  loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sary M. was selected as village bank president  by the members. She is a silk weaver in the village, and has many customers. Mrs. Sary M. is seeking a loan to buy more silk to weave, to meet her customers' demand. Mrs. Sary M. is 47 years old and has four children.  One of her children is a teacher, the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
Khanlar A. is married and has three children. These three children are still in school and help him with his store.

Khanlar has more than 20 years' experience with his business selling groceries. With his small savings and on his own initiative, he decided to set up the store nine years ago. He thought about it because there wasn’t this type of business in his neighborhood.

Thanks to the store, Khanlar was able to buy a small used car, which he uses to do deliveries in the mornings from time to time. His wife doesn’t work and when Khanlar needs to go out she is in charge of selling the groceries. Khanlar works every day of the week from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. This hardworking father is motivated by his great love for his family. He wants to use the loan to invest in his store. He is sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to increase income

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank consisting of nineteen members in Cusco. The group is called Killa (“moon” in Quechua). Elizabeth lives with her partner, a metalworker, in Cusco. Elizabeth is 21 years old and is studying hotel administration in an institute in Cusco.

Elizabeth started a small business one-and-a-half years ago to be able to pay her tuition costs. She stands in a busy street corner in Cusco with cell phones and people passing by pay to use her phones to make calls. Elizabeth started with two cell phones and recently added two more. She plans to continue running this business until she graduates next year. Afterwards, she hopes to get a job in the tourism industry and sell her business to one of her younger sisters or cousins.

Elizabeth appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: To pay for her phones and for her studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna T. is an entrepreneur and a married woman.  She runs a grocery store at Chanika ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of goods at her grocery including foodstuffs, soft drinks and other home utterances. She purchases the goods from wholesale and retail shops in the city market shopping center. She plans to expand her business but funds are the limiting factor. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 500,000 to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Juan Ubaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan, tiene la actividad económica de servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi, vive en casa con sus padres ya que es soltero, actualmente el colabora al  sustento de su familia, el tambien se encuentra estudiando y desea salir profesional para asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida. 
El cliente trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año 2007 en banca de emprendimiento y encontrandose en su segundo credito bajo este programa individual, demostrando buen historial crediticio ya que es una persona responsable y trabajadora.

El destino del credito sera principalmente para el reacondicionamiento de su vehiculo con la compra de llantas para poder desarrollar mejor su trabajo.

El Sr. Juan esta muy agradecido con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Juan provides urban passenger transportation services. He is single and lives with his parents. He contributes to family expenses. He is also studying and wants to become a professional so that his quality of life will be better. He has collaborated with our institution since 2007 as part of a communal bank; this is his second loan as an individual. He has had good credit history and is a responsible, hard-working person. The funds will be used primarily to service his vehicle with the purchase of new tires so that he can do his work more efficiently. Juan is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn V. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Medelyn is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Medelyn is starting a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Medelyn is just starting this business.

In 2010, Medelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Medelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase inventory to sell & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Medelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase  inventory & working capital

loans.name: Dare

texts.en:
Dare is 41 years old and married with 3 children. His children attend school and they are excelling in school. Dare sells gas cylinders. His wife also sells sarongs to support their household. 

Dare is well known in his community. Demand for his cylinders is high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more cylinders to sell. He hopes to grow and expand his business. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gas cylinders to sell

loans.name: Christinah

texts.en:
Christinah is 36 years old, married to Charles Githinji, and they have one child in nursery school.  She has been baking and selling cakes in Naivasha town for the last two years and she has been making good profits out of this.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy wheat flour and cooking oil in bulk. This will make it possible for her to capitalize in making more cakes to sell.

Her future dream is to move to a more permanent place and increase her production.  She also hopes to supply her products to big supermarkets around the town.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking oil in bulk.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail A. sells vegetables such as okra, garden eggs (African eggplant), and fresh pepper at Akotokyire.  Abigail has been educated up to junior high level.  She is married and has three wonderful children. Her husband is a mason. She uses the income she generates from her sales to help her husband in provide food, clothing and shelter for her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional vegetables for sale. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys was born in 1978 and is still single. He owns a small business selling various products such as soap powder, cosmetic products, plastic cups and so on. Aloys has an experience of five years in his business but his profit is not enough to expand his business and sort out his personal problems. The hours of his business are from 5 in the morning to 10 in the evening every day except on Sunday.  His business is known in the region and that is the reason Aloys needs to expand it.

Aloys is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to grow his business through purchasing the other products like beans, green bananas, sugar, and other foodstuffs so that he can satisfy the demand of his customers. In this way, Aloys will be able to obtain more profits. Using this increased profit, Aloys expects to get married.

loans.use: The purchase of soap powder, cosmetic products, plastic cups and so on

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. is from the village of Magalalag, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 50 years old. Maria is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Maria has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,500 whenever she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2005, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Maria is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Maria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Manchester United Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Sallay B., who is pictured second from right. Sallay is age 40 and was born in Mabontor village near Magburaka. She is married with five children. Her husband is a businessman. Four of her children are attending primary school and one is in secondary school. For many years now, Sallay has been selling rice and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With this loan, she will expand her business by buying rice and palm oil to add to her current stock. 

In the picture are members of the "Manchester United" Group and loan officer, Mohamed L. Tarawalie, on the right, handing over the loan. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rice and palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Shany

texts.en:
Shany E. T. runs a micro-enterprise called Exclusive Designs where she makes and sells handicrafts in the manner she learned as a young child, which is when she first dreamed of opening this kind of business. She started her training with ceramics, working with them for two years before moving on to new techniques with “country wood” and, ultimately, paint on canvas. She continued taking short classes to improve her art and currently works in the style of Britto, a Brazilian artist, making principally necklaces that go well with her other beautiful accessories. Given this orientation, her clients are mostly woman. 

Shany has been working with  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 8 years now, during which time she has received 10 loans that have gradually helped her to grow the business. Besides the loans, FMSD has also helped her learn small business techniques through entrepreneurial training sessions and access to various fairs and special events. She is very open-minded and always trying to learn new things to improve her business and herself as a person. Shany wants to use this Kiva loan to buy materials to use in the creation of her handicrafts that she can then sell in Bogota at the Feria Empresarial de la Mujer (“women's industry fair”).

Shany's dream is to begin exporting her products, as well as to get her own store and home for her family. Her biggest challenge is liquidity: clients often don't want to pay her up front for their special orders meaning she has to pay for the materials out of pocket. This is especially true when she goes to fairs and needs to make a lot in advance. This loan will help her overcome that, ensuring rapid production of the anticipated handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy materials used in the creation of her handicrafts

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia G. is from the village of Laturan, Libona, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Lucrecia is married and has four adult children. Lucrecia owns and operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies and also buying and selling different kinds of junk like plastic and steel in the local community. Lucrecia has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2006, Lucrecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 21,000 PHP and was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Lucrecia is now requesting her eighth loan from HSPFI, for 23,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sofia Karem

texts.es:
Sofía nació, vive y trabaja en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican al turismo. Sofía tiene 25 años y tiene su pareja pero que todavía no se casaron, hace mucho tiempo atrás ella se dedicaba a la fotografía en la ciudad del Cusco y tuvo que dejar de trabajar porque estaba embarazada. 

Decidida  a ser feliz con su pareja, Sofía se mudo a la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde vive junto a su familia de su esposo. Sofía permanecía en su domicilio al cuidado de su hijo (José de dos años y medio) entonces su esposo le motivo para que ella abriera un pequeño restaurante y de nombre le pusieron “Doña Rumania” que debía estar ubicado en la avenida principal de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Actualmente, Sofía sirve menú y comidas especiales a varios clientes cada día. La pueden encontrar en su restaurante, que está equipado con varias mesas, sillas y una zona donde prepara sus comidas, los 7 días de la semana, desde muy temprano hasta bastante tarde en la noche, o hasta que se agote los platos de comida. Hace siete meses que abrió el restaurante y le va muy excelente. Sofía es una mujer emprendedora y alegre. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su restaurante y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora del almuerzo. Ella sirve para cada cliente un plato de sopa de casa, un plato de fondo, un vaso de refresco y un postre. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Sofía espera recibir $300 USD. Por el momento, su casa está a medio construir y está equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para techar su casa y desea comprar tejas y palos. Sofía pertenece a un banco comunal  “La amistad de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Sofía was born, lives and works in Ollantaytambo city, where the majority of the townspeople work in tourism. Sofía is 25 years old and has a partner, but they aren't married yet. Years ago Sofía worked in photography in Cusco city but have to leave her job because she was pregnant. Determined to be happy with her partner, Sofía moved to Ollantaytambo city where she lives together with her husband's family. Sofía used to stay home and care for her son (José, 2 1/2 years) until her husband prompted her to open a small restaurant which they called 'Doña Rumania', owing to the fact that it is located in the principal avenue in Ollantaytambo. Sofía serves a daily menu and special plates to a number of customers each day. You can find her in her restaurant, which she is equipping with tables, chairs and a zone to prepare the food, 7 days per week from very early in the morning until late in the night, or until the food is exhausted. She opened the restaurant 7 months ago and it is going very well. Sofía is an entrepreunerial and vivacious woman. A regular flow of customers visit her restaurant and the business is bustling during the lunch hour. Sofía serves each customer a plate of the house soup, a main meal, a glass of juice or something to drink, and a dessert. At the moment Sofía's house is half-constructed and is equipped with basic necessities. She wants to invest the money from this loan into her house's roof and purchase tiles and wooden planks. Sofía belongs to the communal bank “La amistad de Ollantaytambo”, part of Asociación Arariwa in Cusco city, Perú.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing roofing material such as tiles and wooden planks

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en: Edelita G. is from Barangay Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 28 years old and is married with two infant children. Edelita owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling fish meals. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Edelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Edelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her son's business.

loans.name: Luci Magdalena

texts.es:
la joven Luci Magdalena G. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, cuenta con cliente fijos.
Su negocio está ubicado en la colonia Venecia, recibe la ayuda de su mama para la elaboracion de las tortillas, todos los dias Luci se levanta bien temprano para empezar la produccion y tenerla lista a las 7 de la mañana.
las ventas son desde las 7:00 A.M., hasta las 8:00 P.M.,
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, agua.
Los fines de semana Luci vende tamales, elotes cocidos y tamalitos de elote.
Luci es una mujer con muchos deseos de superarse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luci Magdalena G. is a young woman who works making and selling tortillas; she has done this type of work for the past 6 years and has many loyal customers. Her business is located in the Venecia colony. Her mother helps her to make the tortillas. Every day, Luci gets up very early to start making the tortillas to have them ready by 7 am. She sells from 7 am to 8 pm. She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, and water. On the weekends, Luci sells tamales, elotes, and tamalitos de elote. Luci is a woman with goals of progressing and moving forward in life.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, lime, water and matches

loans.name: Patrick Nyutu

texts.en:
Patrick M. is a 50-year-old gentleman who is married with three children aged 25, 22 and 18 respectively. He is the sole breadwinner in the family as his wife does not work. He is a welder who has been welding for the past 12 years and he is able to make a profit of about Kshs 28,000 every month. Besides, he has some dairy cows which help him in his secondary business of selling milk.

Patrick is a client who has been in KADET for a while. He is now servicing his third loan after successfully repaying the other two well and on time. He is planning to use the loan to buy stock of metal bars for his welding business. He hopes to make a profit which he will use to boost his business.

Patrick has future plans to open other branches so he can improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy stock of metal bars for welding

loans.name: Luwayo Women's Group 2-Lugazi

texts.en:
K. Lawrence belongs to the Luwayo Women’s group-Lugazi. Lawrence traces his beginnings in business to the time when he was a wholesale seller. Savings from this business enabled him to start his taxi business. It was about 12 years ago when he took root in his taxi driving business in Luwayo-Lugazi. Lawrence also raises poultry and does animal husbandry. 100,000 shillings is what he makes in a week. 

Lawrence is happily married with 8 kids. With this loan he says he wants to revamp his taxi business. By improving his operations through repairs, safety checks, and maintainence, he says he will be able to travel longer distances than before. This will earn him greater profits. In the event of this happening he says he will buy another car.

loans.use: The expansion of his  operations through repairs,checks and maintainence on his taxi

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio  solicita 500 $us.  Se dedica a la elaboración de carteras y mochilas escolares  cuya producción la vende a los intermediarios en las ferias de la ciudad. Vive junto a su   esposa y sus hijos  los cuales son mayores de 17 años, en la zona Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto.  Es el segundo  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2009. 
Con el crédito solicitado Julio comprará materiales como cuerina (es un cuero muy delgado), forros y telas para continuar con su negocio de elaboración de carteras y mochilas escolares.
texts.en:
Julio is asking for 500 USD. He makes wallets and school bags. His products are sold by market sellers in the city markets. He lives together with his wife and their children who are over 17 years of age in the Huayna Potosi area of the city of El Alto. It is his second Impro loan and his first through Kiva. He has been a client of the bank since 2009.

With the credit he is asking for Julio will buy materials such as "cuerina" (very delicate leather), linings and fabric in order to continue his business of making wallets and school bags. Julio solicita 500 $us. Se dedica a la elaboración de carteras y mochilas escolares cuya producción la vende a los intermediarios en las ferias de la ciudad. Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos los cuales son mayores de 17 años, en la zona Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto. Es el segundo crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2009. Con el crédito solicitado Julio comprará materiales como cuerina (es un cuero muy delgado), forros y telas para continuar con su negocio de elaboración de carteras y mochilas escolares.

loans.use: to buy items such as cuerina (delicate leather), linings and fabrics to make wallets and bags.

loans.name: Nana Esi

texts.en: Nana Esi O. smokes fish for sale at Elmina. Nana has received a junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a security man. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fish to smoke to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke to meet the increasing demands of her customers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe, in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sarah has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Sarah hopes to own a salon. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work, being a young girl.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Karembo Mtava

texts.en:
Karembo Mtava D. is  30 years old. She is a single mother of one child and she supports three people. Karembo has been in the salon business for the last two years.

This marks her second loan from KADET, and she plans to purchase a new dryer and add more stock, e.g., chemicals, shampoos, etc. to her business inventory. From the anticipated profits, she plans to start a hotel business. Karembo’s dream is to expand her business and cater for her family’s needs.

loans.use: purchase a new dryer and add more stock in the business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora, con un pequeño negocio desde hace más de veinte años una pulpería que inicio con fondos propios y luego con financiamiento de la institución, en donde ha invertido en más productos de consumo, una variedad de cosméticos lo que ha logrado más demanda de clientes.
Con este nuevo crédito comprara productos de cosméticos, golosinas, granos básicos y frutas para hacer refrescos y vender, ya que la idea es invertir más para lograr mejores utilidades, y poder cubrir sus necesidades personales. Y que gracias Afodenic hace posible la mejora para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman.  She has been running a small general store for more than twenty years.  She started her business with her own funds and with financing from the institution.  She invested in more consumer products and a variety of cosmetics for which she has the highest customer demand.  

With this new loan she will buy cosmetics, candy, basic grains and fruits with which to make refreshments to sell.  She wants to invest more in her business in order to increase her profits and be able to cover her personal expenses.  Thanks to Afodenic for making it possible to better her future.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, candy, cosmetics and fruit to make refreshments to sell.

loans.name: Norly

texts.es: Norly, de 28 años, trabaja  para sacar adelante a sus 2 jóvenes hijos,  juntos viven en su casa que es  propia y esta  ubicada en una comunidad de la selva central peruana.Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra café y plátanos en sus 5 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas propios. Su experiencia y dedicación, le permitieron incursionar en el negocio de venta de frutas y es por esta razón que una vez a la semana viaja a otra ciudad donde distribuye, no solo sus cosechas, sino  también los productos de los agricultores de su localidad. Según manifiesta  la venta de plátanos en sus variedades de seda e isla, son tan buenas, que en cada viaje obtiene una ganancia neta de 150 a 200  soles. Pero como buena negociante, quiere invertir en la instalación  de una tienda de comestibles; donde pueda ofrecer  productos de primera necesidad, pues por la zona donde vive carecen de un negocio de comestibles y deben viajar a la ciudad para poder comprar los alimentos.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmas”, es su  séptimo préstamo con MFP, y comparte nuevas experiencias en las constantes reuniones que tiene con los integrantes de su grupo de trabajo.Su mayor ingreso económico lo obtiene de sus plantaciones de plátanos, es por esta razón que esta  pensando en  comprar 2 mil mamones (plantas pequeñas de plátano), y espera  obtener nuevos y mejores frutos para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Norly is 28 years old.  She works to get her two young children ahead in life.  They live in their own home in a community in the central Peruvian jungle.

Norly has been farming for ten years.  She grows coffee and bananas on her 5 hectares of farmland.  Her experience and commitment have allowed her to break into the business of selling fruit and, once a week, she travels to another town to deliver not only her own harvests but also the produce of other farmers from her town.  Norly tells us that she sells Seda and Isla bananas.  They are so good that on every journey she makes a net average profit of 150 to 200 Peruvian soles.  However, as a good businesswoman, Norly would like to invest in setting up a grocery store where she can offer staple food products since the area where she lives lacks a grocery store and the residents have to travel to the city to buy food.

Norly is a member of the "Las Palmas" community bank.  This is her seventh loan from MFP and she shares new experiences in the constant meetings that she has with the members of her working group.  Her biggest financial income comes from her banana plantations.
