For this reason, she is planning to buy 2,000 'mamones' (small banana plants) and hopes to make new and better fruits to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy plants to improve her crops

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem T., 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. T. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 1 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The four children are employed, earning an income of USD 2 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 8 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for  the children to commute to work

loans.name: Jocart

texts.en:
Jocart M. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 23 years old, married and has 1 infant child. Jocart owns and operates a business providing general services to local community members. Jocart has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Jocart joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocart is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocart from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Saruulsaihan

texts.en: Saruulsaihan, 31, is divorced and lives with her parents and brother and her daughter in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her father works for a private company. She started an animal rawhide trading business in 2006 with a working capital of 200,000 MNT. She operates her business at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia. Her mother helps her with the business. Saruulsaihan is a hardworking and polite person who says, " I am trying to expand my business and save money in order to build a house where we can have a comfortable life". She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase animal rawhide for her business.

loans.use: To purchase animal rawhide

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza N. is from the village of Bucana in Sicayab. She is 65 years old. Lorenza is widowed and has 6 adult children. Lorenza sells "bibingka," a sweet pudding made from rice and fresh coconut milk, in the local community. Lorenza has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 2,700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

In 2006, Lorenza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Lorenza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Lorenza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients to make her treats. This loan will be Lorenza's 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Arlene Cenas Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Arlene C. is 52 years old, married and is a resident of Purok Makiangayon, Maningcol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Arlene is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Arlene C.’s Group.
Arlene is married to Vidal C., a fisherman and farmer. They are blessed with five children, all married. To help her husband, Arlene decided to engage in fish vending and some farming activities together with her husband. For 40 years, she has been able to maintain the said business activity and now she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,000 PHP per month, which is so helpful to their family income.
Arlene joined the cooperative in 2007. As an active member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) program of PMPC, a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of 5,000 PHP as her sixth loan, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital for her sari-sari store business.
The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions of Arlene’s family, to meet their basic needs, for loan repayments to PMPC, and for possible business expansion. About group loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 58 años, es casada y vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y su nieto de 10 años. Casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería, actividad que lo ha practicado su familia durante muchos años. Es así que la experiencia que tiene le ha dado la ventaja de mejorar sus cultivos ya que siembra papa y maíz. Por otro lado, cada día más se intensifica en la ganadería y actualmente cría vacas, carneros y chanchos y lo vende de manera ocasional mientras espera el momento de que debe cosechar y venderlos a los comerciantes de la ciudad más cercana a su  comunidad. De esta manera logra tener los ingresos para su familia, además que su esposo lo ayuda en esta tarea que en ocasiones requiere de mucho esfuerzo. Es su veinteavo crédito que tiene con MFP, se alegra de ser parte de su banco comunal  y aunque en la actualidad es un grupo reducido puede confiar en cada uno de ellos porque son sus amigos. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Reyna is 58 years old, married and lives in her own house with her husband and 10-year-old grandson.  For almost all of her life she and her family have been in agriculture and livestock farming.  Her expertise has given her the advantage of improving her crops which are potatoes and corn.  She is also spending more and more time with her livestock farming and is now raising cows, sheep and pigs which she sells while waiting for the harvest season to arrive so she can sell produce in nearby cities.  This is how she makes an income for her family.  Sometimes her husband lends a hand when an extra effort is needed.

This is her 28th loan through MFP.  She is happy to be a part of the communal bank because, although it is not a large group, she can confide in everyone because they are friends.  

She plans to use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for the potato and corn crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy S. is a 47-year-old, married woman from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She and her husband have four adult-age children. To earn a living, Lucy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she runs a sari-sari (variety) shop, and her primary source of income is derived from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Lucy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Lucy joined HSPFI to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Recently, Lucy successfully repaid a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital purposes. Lucy is now requesting a new loan, this time in the amount of 20,000 PHP ($475), which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, junk food, and beverages. Notably, this loan would be the sixth loan taken out by Lucy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as canned goods, junk food, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man. He has been involved in the agriculture field for the past 18 years. He owns a farm in his hometown in Lebanon, where he resides with his wife. His farm produces milk and its derivatives and different types of vegetables – all sold to the local markets. His revenue is very important since he is the main income source for the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase agricultural spices and seeds needed for his work. He says that with these purchases he will be able to better monitor his products, farming and growth.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural spices and seeds.

loans.name: Astrid Margarita

texts.es: Astrid vive en el municipio de Soledad a 15 minutos de Barranquilla donde se dedica a la venta de mercancías variadas como bolsos, perfumería,  accesorio y en general ropa femenina. Ella  es una joven casada que planeó su vida como emprendedora desde hace 3 años, cuando una amiga le enviaba ropa muy buena marca desde los Estados Unidos  y  Astrid la vendía entre su primer mercado doméstico: su familia, amigos y algunos conocidos, gradualmente con su trabajo y dando respuesta oportuna a su clientela fue aumentando,  y en la actualidad no solo vende ropa sino también calzado, bolsos y perfumería en general a una clientela no menor de 32 clientes fijos y algunos otros esporádicos que le compran a crédito y de contado respectivamente. Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará jean y suéteres principalmente. Su sueño es comprar un apartamento, estudiar Radiología y viajar para conocer. Mientras Astrid trabaja para construir sus sueños, continua esforzándose en su negocio y manejando unos buenos índices financieros que muestran solvencia para responder a sus obligaciones oportunamente.
texts.en: Astrid lives in the Soledad municipality some 15 minutes from Barranquilla where she sells various merchandize among them purses, perfumes, accessories and mostly women’s clothing. She is a young married woman that planned her life as an entrepreneur some 3 years ago when a friend sent her brand name clothing from the United States and Astrid sold it in her first domestic market, her family, friends and some acquaintances. Little by little with her hard work she began to see that her customers increased and at present she not only sells clothing but also shoes, purses and perfumes. Astrid has a customer base of 32 steady customers and some sporadic ones that buy on credit and cash. This is her first loan that she has with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; she will mostly buy jeans and sweaters. Astrid’s dream is to buy an apartment, study Radiology and travel to get to know the world. While Astrid works to build her dreams, she will continue to work on her business and to manage her finances that show her solvency and to be responsible to her obligations when needed.

loans.use: buy jeans and sweaters.

loans.name: Mary Bethanie

texts.en: Mary Bethanie is 42 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a tailoring business in the Philippines, and has applied for a loan for PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials and other supplies for her shop. Mary Bethanie has been in this this line of work for 20 years and is committed to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and other supplies for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Olouwatobi Group

texts.fr: OLOUWATOBI est un groupe constitué D. trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Adèle Nelly. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds D. roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès D. ALIDé. Adèle Nelly est née le 24 Janvier 1970 dans une ville du Bénin et est mariée à  un certain Paul. Le couple à deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adèle Nelly a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux D. ses enfants, Adèle Nelly mène comme activité la vente tissus, D. mèches et des chaussures par le système D. distribution. Adèle Nelly exerce cette activité depuis près D. sept ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges D. sa famille. D. façon secondaire, Adèle Nelly vend du jus D. bissap. Adèle Nelly s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Adèle Nelly et aux autres membres du groupe OLOUWATOBI, D. rehausser le niveau D. leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
OLOUWATOBI is a group maD. up of three persons whose president (the member who is raising her hand) is named Adèle Nelly. The members of the group all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. In order to increase their working capital, this group is asking for a loan from ALIDé for the second time. 

Adèle Nelly was born on January 24, 1970 in a town in Bénin and is married to Paul. The couple has two children, both enrolled in school and under their roof. Adèle Nelly went to school up to the secondary level. To support herself and her children, Adèle Nelly has been working at selling cloth, hair extensions and shoes through the distribution system. She has been in this business for almost seven years, which has permitted her to cover the various expenses of her family. 

Secondarily, Adèle Nelly sells hibiscus flower juice. She buys her supplies in one of the biggest markets of Bénin. This second loan will certainly permit Adèle Nelly and the other members of the group called OLOUWATOBI to raise the level of their activities and grow their clientele and their income.

loans.use: to buy cloth, hair extensions, shoes, and dried hibiscus flowers (to make juice).

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa de 54 años de edad, casado con víctor de 56 años con quien tiene un hijo llamado Anel de 15 años de edad. Juntos viven en la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. Aunque Elisa creció en una localidad rodeada de quincha y barro,  eso no significó que seguiría por el mismo camino, es así que hace 10 años ella empezó con la venta de golosinas en las afueras de un colegio que encuentra en su misma localidad. En estos últimos años ella abrió una tienda de abarrotes donde expende productos de primera necesidad, por lo que su esposo la apoya en la atención hacía los clientes. Ella se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, ya que le genera ganancias y con eso contribuye a cubrir los gastos de su hogar. En el futuro espera construir su casa de material noble, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para poder establecerse en su negocio y en su economía. Con los 3.000 nuevos soles, desea adquirir más productos de primera necesidad para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Elisa is 54 years old and she is married to Victor, 56 years old. They have a child named Anel and he is 15 years old. They live together in the community of Puerto Mayo in the district of Pichari. Although Elisa grew up surrounded by thatch and clay it did not mean that she would follow in down the same road. Therefore 10 years ago she started selling sweets outside a school located in her own community. In the past few years she opened a grocery store where she carries essential goods. Her husband helps her in attending the clients. She feels satisfied with her work especially because it generates and income and with it she is able to contribute towards the household expenses. In the future she hopes to build a house of sturdy materials with the goal of improving the quality of life for her family. This will be her second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She hopes to have the support of each one of you to help her establish her business and her finances. With the 3000 nuevos soles she wants to purchase more essential goods to supply her store.

loans.use: to purchase essential goods to supply her store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 35 years old and lives in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-aged children.

Yolanda is a farmer who owns and operates her own business. She plants and harvests corn to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for ten years. Each quarter, she earns about PHP 12,450 from her cultivation. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 at GDMPC to pay for the cost of soil-plowing labor and purchase fertilizers.

Yolanda has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, she hopes to expand her corn business and purchase land for corn production.

loans.use: To pay for soil-plowing labor and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 39 years old, married, and has three children aged two to seven. For ten years he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle transport business) in a busy but competitive area. He describes himself as a focused, visionary and devoted man.

Julius is a very good client who pays back his loans on time. He intends to use this loan to purchase another motorcycle.

Julius is very determined to do well. In the future, he hopes to venture into the matatu (mini-bus) and taxi business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Benkola Ii Group

texts.fr:
BENKOLA II est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Klè, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées par les femmes du groupe sont entre autres le riz, le dah, le niébé et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, SITAN la  deuxième assises à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola II Group are married women who, on average, are 45 years old and have five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Klè, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice, roselle, black-eyed peas and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Sitan, the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing. She has around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow rice. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. Sitan expects to make an average profit of around 20,000 CFA francs by the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy agricultural supplies and tools.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with one boy and two girls. They live in a house that they own which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a milk business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby.  Umazi faces a major challenge of the lack of a ready market, hence leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business and of purchasing goats and cows. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase a plot of land. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To  purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepcion

texts.es: Ramona De La Concepción tiene 52 años, ella es una microempresaria su negocio es una pulpería. Ella se levanta desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche que sus clientes llegan a buscar. Tiene un hijo de 14 años, ella deposita las  esperanzas de lograr ayudar a su hijo para que en un futuro sea una persona exitosa. Su sueño es tener un punto de ventas para incrementar sus ingresos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, fósforos, sopas, papel higiénico entre otros  Trabaja para lograr sus sueños y los de su familia continua manteniendo su negocio para mejorar cada día.
texts.en: Ramona De La Concepción is 52 and a micro-entrepreneur who runs a grocery store.  She works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. attending to customers who come to shop at her store.  She has a 14-year-old son who she wants to help become a successful person in the future.  Her dream is to have another sales location to increase her income.  She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, sweets, detergents, matches, soups, toilet tissue, etc.  Through her work she wants to make her dreams come true for the family, and to maintain her business and improve every day.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sweets, detergents, matches, soups, toilet tissue, etc.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, one girl and three boys, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
Saumu operates a clothes sales business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers. Saumu dreams of educating her children and improving her living standards. 
With her 30,000 KES loan, Saumu wants to purchase bundles of clothes and dress materials for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and dress materials for resale.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, 33, is a hardworking business man. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last four years, he has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. He also does farming.

In the next five years, Edward wants to manage a supermarket. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar and rice for resale. He decided to joined Faulu Kenya to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a chop bar (a place where people come to eat). She also sells soft drinks such as malt, Fanta, Sprite, and others. She is married to a teacher and together they are blessed with five children. She assists her partner to provide the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy food items to cook to sell, and drinks to sell. She anticipates renovating the chop bar.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook to sell, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Seferina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción, comercio y servicios. 

La señora Seferina indica que hace cinco meses que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una promotora que llego a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca que  viene trabajando hace un año, el que aprendió de su amiga.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de coca) que adquirirá de La Paz y lo comercializa en su lugar de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.

En la fotografia se puede observar que una de las socias esta mal ubicada y solo aparese medio cuerpo; ademas tenemos a dos amigas de la asociación que se encuentran en el fondo del salon.
texts.en: The “Flor Naciente” community bank are about to start their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office. The bank has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Seferina. The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include production, commerce and services. Seferina says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five months. She joined through an invitation from a loan officer who came to her house. She currently has a business selling coca which she has been working in for one year. She learned the business from a friend. Seferina will use this loan to grow her business (buying coca). She will buy her products in La Paz and sell them from her sales location. This work allows her to make income with which to support her family. She lives with her partner and has two children. When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Seferina replied that she enjoys the meetings. In the photograph, you can see that one of the members is badly positioned and you can only see half her body. We also have two friends in the back of the room.

loans.use: to buy coca

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Don Alcides, de 48 años de edad,  vive en el Espinal una comarca de Estelí, es soltero, su nivel de estudio es básico solo llego hasta tercer grado de primaria, el es agricultor y también se dedica a la ganadería. El aprendió este oficio por medio de su padre quien le enseño todas las actividades propias del campo, comenzó preparando la tierra, después se encargaba de ordeñar y cuidar el ganado así fue adquiriendo experiencia. Hoy en dia tiene 3 manzanas de tierra donde siembra frijol y también tiene vacas, el trabaja junto con su hermano para sacar adelante su negocio. El requiere el préstamo para comprar un novillo. Ya que esto le ayudara para poder trabajar en la preparación y arar la tierra para siembra. Uno de sus planes futuros es tener un finca productora de leche.
texts.en: Alcides is 48 years old and lives in Espinal, a region of Estelí. He is single and has a basic level of education as he only studied up to third grade. Alcides works as a farmer and also raises livestock. He learned this business through his father who taught him agricultural work. He started out preparing the soil and then took charge of milking and caring for the cattle. This is how he gained experience. He now has three manzanas (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of land where he grows beans and also keeps cows. He works together with his brother to get ahead in his business. Alcides needs this loan to buy a young bull. This will help him in his work preparing and plowing his soil to get it ready for sowing. One of his future plans is to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy a young bull

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, de 43 años es una luchadora madre; pues saca adelante a sus 3 hijos a los que cuida y sustenta económicamente, sola, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San pedro de saño. Con esfuerzo sacó adelante a sus hijos. Los cuales le apoyan con cariño. Su principal actividad es la agricultura, los que realiza en terrenos agrícolas arrendados, pues no tiene unos propios. Sus cultivos de papa, habas y trigo le brindan buenas ganancias en cada cosecha. Pues comercializa en la capital del país, ya tiene 19 años de experiencia en todo este tiempo, también se dedicó a venta de menestras en el mercado de Huancan, donde el precio de compra es mayor. También tiene 2 toros con los cuales realiza arado de tierra, pues cuando alquila otros, le cobran 100 nuevos soles por día y eso no le conviene. Ahora trabajará con más ahínco para brindarle una mejor educación a sus hijos. Este es el décinotercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Delfina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en:
43-year-old Delfina is a tenacious mother who provides for her three children.  She cares for her children and supports them financially on her own.  They live in their own home which is located in the town of San Pedro de Saño.  Through her efforts, Delfina gets her children ahead in life.  They, in turn, support her with affection.

Delfina's main business is farming.  She grows her crops on rented farmland as she does not own her own.  Her potato, bean and wheat crops make her good profits with every harvest as she sells them in the capital city.  She has 19 years experience.  Delfina also sells mixed vegetables in Huancan market where the purchase price is higher and she has two bulls which she uses to plow the soil.  When she hires others, they charge her 100 soles a day which is not good.  Now Delfina will work with more determination in order to provide her children with a better education.

This is Delfina's thirteenth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can carry out her plans.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she has done with her previous loans.  Delfina enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  With your support, Delfina will invest the money she has requested in buying natural fertilizers to spread over her corn crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 59 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 5 children. Lydia has a business selling rice cakes and earns about PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy rice. a primary ingredient of her snack vending business. Lydia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, she would like to have her own store in the locality.

loans.use: To purchase rice, a primary ingredient of her snack vending business.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna emprendedora, madre soltera, ama de casa con su negocio de alquiler de cuartos siendo su fuente de ingreso.  Con el préstamo anterior logro cambiar la puerta de uno cuarto que la tenia deterioradas. Generándole mayor comodidad a sus inquilinos. Para este nuevo año tiene como proyecto seguir mejorando las ventanas y puertas de sus habitaciones que  alquila, las paredes y otros descompuestos de la infraestructura de su casa.
Con el préstamo comprara materiales como: puertas,  ventanas, cemento para rellenar algunas partes quebradas, verjas que colocara en ventana y puerta, pintura para aplicarla a las paredes de los cuartos así dándole mejor presentación  al negocio, adquiriendo mayores clientelas y generándole ganancia.  
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo  al desarrollo de su negocio y nivel de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is an entrepreneur, a single mother, and a homemaker who has a business of renting out rooms as a source of income. With her previous loan, she was able to replace the door of one of the rooms that was in disrepair. This provided more comfort for her tenants. For the upcoming year, she plans to continue making improvements to the windows and doors of each rental unit, the walls, and other parts of the infrastructure of her house that are in need of repairs.

With this loan Reyna will buy materials such as doors, windows, cement for filling up cracks, security grates for the windows and doors, and paint for the walls of the rooms. This will give her business a better appearance and help to acquire more tenants and generate income. Reyna is grateful to the microfinance organization for its assistance with developing her business and improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase materials so that she can continue making improvements to her home.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 30 year-old married woman with five children, all of them in school. She has had a food-stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for three year. Victoria is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Yanina Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Yanina Margarita,  es comerciante de ropa de todo tipo y para todas las edades, tanto para damas y caballeros, ella posee su tramo en el mercado municipal, aparte que en su vivienda también ella pone a  la venta los productos que ofrece, teniendo su negocio desde hace 11 años. 

Ella ha expresado que necesita mercadería nueva para aprovechar la temporada navideña que en este tiempo aumentan las ventas y las demandas. Es por esta razón que se acerca a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de pantalón de varón, pantalón de damas, blusas, camisetas cuello de varón, toallas para baños, colchas y trajes de niño con el único fin de continuar comercializando la ropa y cubrir la demanda de los clientes.
texts.en:
Yanina Margarita is a merchant of all types of clothing and for all ages, both ladies and men's.  She has her own section in the municipal market.  She also offers for sale products at her home.  She has had this business for 11 years.

She has expressed that she needs new merchandise to take advantage of the Christmas season, since at this time sales and demands increase.  It is for this reason that she has approached Ceprodel to request a loan to buy men's pants, ladies pants, blouses, men's collared shirts, bath towels, blankets, and baby outfits for the sole purpose of continuing to market the clothing and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy men's and ladies pants, blouses, men's collared shirts, bath towels, blankets, and baby outfits.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La señora Claudia, se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir femeninas, actualmente esta confeccionando blusas y vestidos, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado por el octavo anillo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, esta viviendo en condición de anticrético. Es una excelente trabajadora y emprendedora, con el tiempo desea tener un taller de costura mas grande y poder emplear mano de obra y así comercializar sus productos en los diferentes mercados a nivel nacional ya que por ahora solo entrega a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Santa cruz, con el dinero del crédito comprara una heladera para su uso personal y un equipo de sonido. La Sra. Claudia agradeció por el apoyo brindado y por la rapidez con la que se la atendió.
texts.en: Claudia sews women's clothing. Currently, she is putting together blouses and dresses. Her home is located in the eighth ring of the city of Santa Cruz. She is living in the condition of anticredito. She is an excellent worker and entrepreneur.  Eventually, she hopes to have a bigger sewing workshop and be able to employ a tailor and in that way market her products in the different markets at a national level. Since now, she only gives her products to the distinct markets of the city of Santa Cruz. With the money from the loan, she will buy a refrigerator for her personal use and a stereo. Claudia is thankful for the support and the speed with which she was attended.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a stereo.

loans.name: Jemarie

texts.en:
As a responsible house wife, Jemarie engages in selling AVON, Natasha and MSE products to generates income. She is 30 years old and has one school-age child. Her ambition in life is to become financially stable in the future. In this regard, she planned to improve her business and make it viable source of income. Despite problems and competitors in the area, she still has the determination to continue the business.

She is asking for an additional capital of P6,000 to buy additional stocks of AVON, Natasha and MSE products like lotions,body sprays, roll ons, colognes, under wears, jewelries and foot wears to sell in their community. She hopes that she will improve the business and make it profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body sprays, roll ons, colognes, under wears, jewelries and foot wears to sell

loans.name: Mchekwisha

texts.en:
Mchekwisha is from Mombasa, Kenya. She resides in the rural area of Tiribe, a town on the south coast of Kenya. She's a businesswoman and the owner of a retail shop. She has been doing this work for more than three years and she has become very well known among the customers who go there.

Mchekwisha is a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead. That's why she works so hard. She opens her shop at 7:00 am and closes as late as 9:00 pm.

She's requesting this loan to be able to increase her stock. She will buy noodles, snacks, soft drinks, flour, tissue papers and instant products.

loans.use: to buy noodles, snacks, soft drinks, flour, tissue papers and instant products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, soap, sugar,flour, fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of soap, flour, sugar, vegetables. Her business goal is to have a big grocery within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soap, flour, sugar, vegetables

loans.name: Soyainoi

texts.en:
Soyanoi is married with four children. She joined Umoja women group and became a very active member. She actively advocates for the education of the girl – child because she did not get the opportunity to go to school. She is a committee member of Inkiito primary school.

Soyanoi started her small steers’ project with money she had saved for sometime from her bead work. This was after she attended a training organized by WEEC on “THE NEED TO SAVE”. She managed to buy two small steers. She later sold the steers at USD 125.She then took a loan of USD 130 from her group, added to her sales proceeds and purchased four steers. She is currently fattening them and intends to market them when the prices are most favorable.

loans.use: Soyainoi wants to buy three steers and will stand a chance of buying good young steers at a better price especially when she buys them at once.

loans.name: Nafesa

texts.en:
Nafesa is 34 years old and lives with her 5 children in district 8 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Nafesa has a tailoring and embroidery business in her home, sewing clothes for her neighbours. Because of family problems she can't open a shop in the bazaar.

She took a loan from AFSG to buy a new sowing machine and fabric and other materials. She hopes to continue with her tailoring business so that she can pay the family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy fabric, a new sewing machine and string

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Mrs. C. continued a family tradition when she took charge of the furniture upholstering business founded by her father in 1963. She is the mother of two sons, who are at studying at university. The money that PRISMA will lend her will be used to buy materials to cover orders she has from clients, and part of it will be invested in remodeling her shop. She would like to build an exhibition room in which to showcase her products and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. C. continuó la tradición familiar al hacerse cargo de la Tapicería fundada por su padre en 1963. Es madre de 2 hijos que estan estudiando en la universidad. El dinero que PRISMA le brinde lo utilizará en la compra de materiales para cubrir con los pedidos de sus clientes y otra parte la invertirá en la remodelación de su local, ya que piensa construir una sala de exhibición para mostrar sus productos e incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: The money will be invested in buying materials (fabric, foam, thread, needles) to cover orders from her clients. Another part of the loan will be invested in physical improvements to her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beatuy supplies, articles for the hair and improve her salon.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng S. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her family, Leng S. operates a Karaoke business in her community, where her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. Together, they earn on average around $7 each day. One of her children works in a private company and the rest are students. Mrs Leng is humbly applying for a loan to expand her Karaoke business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Seutaatia

texts.en:
As a member of the Matafaa Center, Seutaatia maintains her focus on her family, which she struggles daily to support. With rising prices and community commitments from her village, it is tough to make ends meet. Seutaatia pushes herself as hard as she can to improve her family’s living conditions.

She hasthree kids who are working, but their family’s main income is from fishing, which her husband is locally renowned for because of his excellent catches. He goes fishing twice per week, while she does the selling. This earns them a profit of $350 USD after all costs.

She is able to continue borrowing from SPBD to support her family and to save extra money for her future plans. These plans involve buying a fishing boat to increase their income and improve living conditions. This is her dream and it motivates her to keep working hard.

loans.use: To buy cement, timber, and fishing nets

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a small entrepreneur who owns a small shop selling clothes. She is married to Ernest Martine, who works with the Tanzania police force. She has two children aged 12 and 14 years. She has five years experience in business and she loves her job. This is her second loan request. She is asking for a loan to buy new show cases and hangers for her business. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: Buy new show cases and hangers

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en:
Vusala (her husband is pictured) is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives with her family in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. Vusala has been in this farming for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer for improving her farm. 

Note: Vusala's husband is pictured as Vusala did not want her picture taken for cultural reasons.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Mrs. M. D. H. belongs to the Las Aves Fenix Community Bank located en 241 Jr. Grau Street, Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 54 years old and has 5 children. All but one still depends on her. She is married and her husband is a cargo operator. With the first loan of 300 soles(Peruvian currency) that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in a small pantry shop.

Currently she has a grocery store and she also rents sound equipment for local social events. She gets up at 6 a.m. to start working on her house chores and at the same time she runs her business until 8 p.m.

With the 1,000 soles(Peruvian currency) loan, which she promises to pay back in 5 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 box of oil, 2 boxes of eggs, 1 package of detergent, 1 box of soap, 1 package of noodles, 1 package of flour and 1 box of carbonated beverages.

Olga feels that her life has change. She feels more calm and at ease economically because her business allows her to be close to her family and tend to her customers. Olga can contribute to the household and although she has aged and lost one of her children, those are not things that can stop her determination to achieve important things in life. She give thanks for the support that the Manuela Ramos institution gives her in a constant basis.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Aves Fénix, ubicado en Jr. Grau 241, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 54 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, pero uno aún depenD. D. ella, es casada y su esposo es operador D. carga. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en una pequeña bodega.. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega y alquila equipos D. sonidos para eventos sociales. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para dedicarse a las labores del hogar y simultáneamente atienD. en su negocio hasta las 8 p.m. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 caja D. aceite, 2 cajas D. huevo, 1 paquete D. detergente, 1 caja D. jabón, 1 paquete D. fideos, 1 paquete D. harina y 1 caja D. refrescos. Olga siente que su vida cambió, está más descansada y tranquila económicamente porque su negocio le permite estar cerca D. su familia y esperar a sus clientes, además pueD. aportar en su hogar y también que a pesar D. su edad y a la pérdida D. uno D. sus hijos no es impedimento para lograr cosas importantes y agradece el apoyo que Manuela Ramos le brinda.

loans.use: Buying groceries like : rice, sugar, oil, eggs, etc. to supply her store

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Chuyên - Vọng Nguyệt - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Chuyên is 28, she raises pigs and sells grocery. Her husband is a construction worker. Her family income is 6.25 USD a day. She needs a loan to buy more piglets to raise.
Mrs Hà raises pigs as well. Her husband is a construction worker. She needs a loan to invest more into pigs raising.
Mrs Thế raises pigs and sells grocery.
Mrs Lợi and Hường need a loan to start raising livestock.
They all wish to obtain more loans after this one.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Chuyên 28 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt. Chồng chị làm thợ xây, thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị là 100 000 đồng/ ngày. Chị muốn vay để thêm vốn chăn nuôi . Chị Hà làm nghề chăn nuôi, chồng chị làm thợ xây, chị muốn vay thêm để có vốn chăn nuôi. Chị Thế làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt, chị muốn vay vốn để chăn nuôi. Chị Lợi và chị Hường vay vốn để chăn nuôi.
Tất cả các chị đều thích được vay lâu dài.

loans.use: raise pigs

loans.name: Sahila

texts.en: Sahila K. has been raising livestock on her own since 2003. She is 28 years old and married with two children. They live in Imishli, a region in southern Azerbaijan. She is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to be repaid over 18 months. She will use the loan to purchase two more cows at an estimated cost of $500 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase two cows.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Mrs. Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank "Señor D. Mayo". She owns a hardware store which is based out of her home in the district of Catac, Recuay province, department of Ancash. With the loan of $575 USD, which will be paid in 6 installments, she will purchase 20 units of piping, 50 bags of cement, 12 brooms, and 5 rolls of barb wire. She is 49 years old; she is married and has one son. Her husband is a farmer and together they help each other to cover household expenses and their son's education.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yolanda, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor D. Mayo, cuenta con una ferretería, su negocio sé ubicado en su domicilio del distrito D. Catac y provincia D. Recuay, departamento D. Ancash. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 20 unidades D. tubo, 50 bolsas D. cemento, 12 unidades D. escoba, 5 rollos D. alambre púa. Ella tiene 49 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y juntos se apoyan con los gastos D. su hogar y la educación D. su hijo.

loans.use: With the loan, she will purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
Mahfirat Ergashevna M. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is 24 years old, married and has 2 children. Mahfirat sells fertilizer at the local market in Tursun-Zoda. This business is the sole source of income for her family since her husband is currently out of work. Right now Mahfirat needs to buy more fertilizer from wholesalers, and so she wants to take out this loan, which she will pay back in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Махмудова Махфират Эргашевна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 24 года, замужем , имеет 2 детей. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей минеральных удобрений на местном рынке в городе Турсунзаде. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Так как муж клиентки временно не работает. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков товар.Для чего ей нужны деньги,поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Lydia B.

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Lydia K..  She is not married but she has  one child, aged 12. In 2006, Lydia established her crops business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. She is assisted by her brother. Lydia requires a loan in order to buy additional stock of maize in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy additional stock of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Ominahon

texts.ru:
Ominahon H. lives in the Gissar district. She is 56 years old, married, and has two children. She has a high school education. Ominahon works in Gissar's communications center. To earn additional income she buys and sells telephone cards used to add credit to mobile phones. She has more than two years of experience in this business. Now she would like to buy more cards than usual from wholesalers. To do this she needs a loan to be paid back over 10 months. She is a joyful and hardworking woman in spite of her age.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанова Оминахон жительница района Гиссар . Возраст 56 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее.Оминахон работает в Узле связи поселка Гиссар. Дополнительным зароботком является купля продажа телефонных карт для пополнения баланса мобильных телефонов.Имеет опыт работы в этом бизнесе более 2 лет. Сейчас клиентка хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков телефонных карточек больше обычного.Для чего ей нужен кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.Несмотря на своей возраст она очень жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Katty Gissella

texts.es:
Mrs. Katty belongs to the communal bank “El Arenal” in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and is the mother of one small son and her husband is an electrician. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (US $100), Kathy decided to invest in the purchase of beauty products.

Today she sells soft drinks, ice, candy and she also has two motokars (three-wheeled motorized form of transport) which gives work to drivers.

With this loan of 1,200 soles (US $ 425), which will be repaid in six months, she will buy two cases of soft drinks, 500 bags of ice, candies, and she will also maintain her 2 motokar. Katty is very content belonging to Manuela Ramos because it gives her the opportunity to continue improving her business; it is for this that she puts a lot of work into her business because she wants it to grow, and she won’t give up until she has also created a business for selling cell phones.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Katty pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años es madre de 1 pequeño hijo, su esposo es Técnico Electricista. Katty con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/.300 decidió invertir en la compra de productos de belleza. Hoy esta vendiendo gaseosa, hielo, golosinas y también cuenta con 2 motokar que da a trabajar a choferes. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 cajas de gaseosa, ½ millar de bolsa para hielo, golosinas, también dará mantenimiento a sus motokar. Katty esta muy contenta de pertenecer a Manuela Ramos porque gracias a ello le da la oportunidad de seguir incrementando su negocio; es por ello que le pone mucha algarabía a su negocio porque quiere seguir creciendo y no desmayara hasta formar su negocio de venta de celulares

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, ice, candies and maintenance of motokar.

loans.name: Tomasa Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa B. es una persona muy esforzada que desde hace varios años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas al por mayor las cuales las oferta en su propio hogar de habitación.

Desde hace varios años se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel ya que los ha utilizado para mejorar la condición del negocio por medio de la compra de las gaseosas y por este motivo ha mejorado el bienestar de sus pequeño hijo. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar las gaseosas y así comercializarlas en su municipio de San Rafael del Sur en la ciudad de Managua.
texts.en:
Tomasa B. is a very hard working person who has worked selling soft drinks wholesale out of her own home for the past few years.

For the past few years she has been supported by loans provided by Ceprodel and she has used them to improve the condition of her business through the purchase of soft drinks and has improved the well being of her small child. Today the reason which she has gone to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan with which she will purchase the soft drinks and then sell them in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in the city of Managua.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Cheam M., 30, is married and lives with three children and her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has been working selling bananas to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 1.30 per day. Her husband is a farmer growing corn. On average, he makes US$ 2 per day. Cheam M. would like to take out a loan of US$ 500 to hire workers to plow their farmland and harvest their crops.

loans.use: To hire workers to plow their farmland and harvest their crops.

loans.name: Alipia

texts.es:
Alipia es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa casa del Saber en quechua.
Alipia es madre soltera, tiene 58 años y 1 hija, Alipia vende ropa, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, Tacna a donde viaja dependiendo de la demanda, sus ventas los realiza al crédito y ofrece a amigos, familiares y en instituciones, también viaja a las provincias de Ayacucho.
Alipia necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, polos, pantalones.
Los sueños de Alipia son ampliar su negocio, tener una boutique y ofrecer a mas personas sus productos.
texts.en:
Alipia is a member of the microfinance institute called Yachay Wasi, which means House of Knowledge in Quechua. Alipia is a 58-year-old single mother who has one daughter. Alipia sells clothing, which she obtains in the city of Lima, Tacna, where she travels to depending on demand. She accepts credit for her clothing, which she sells to family, friends and institutions. She also travels to the provinces of Ayacucho. Alipia needs a loan of 750.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing jackets, t-shirts and pants. Alipia dreams of expanding her business, opening a boutique, and offering her merchandise to more people.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jackets, t-shirts and pants

loans.name: Loyda Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. F., soltera, de 39 años de edad con 1 hijo, lo tiene su papá, pero ella le ayuda.  Está solicitando su credito # 3, el que utilizara para la construciion de un baño y su cocina, trabaja como auxiliar de enfermeria con 16 años de servicio en el Centro de Salud de Acoyapa, sus 2 creditos anteriores los ha utilizado para la construccion de su vivienda, pues es hasta con los creditos que AFODENIC le ha otorgado que ella cuenta con una vivienda, le faltan muchas condiciones, pero espera que con futuros creditos podria llegar a contar con una vivienda digna que es lo que todo ser humano.  Sus creditos anteriores los ha pagado en tiempo y forma es una excelente clienta, cuenta con el respaldo moral de su jefe y compañeros de trabajo, manifiesta que por ningun motivo se retirara de AFODENIC, pues esta satisfecha con la atencion que es recibida cuando se presena a la institucion, ya que todo su personal es muy especial.
texts.en:
Ms. F. is 39 years old and single. She has one son who lives with his father, but she helps support him. For sixteen years she has worked as a nurse's aide in the Acoyapa Health Center. She is requesting her third loan, which she will use to construct a bathroom and a kitchen. Her two previous loans were used to build her house. In fact, without Kiva's partner AFODENIC Ms. F. would not have a house. The house still lacks many amenities, but she is confident that with continued support she will have a decent home, just as all human beings deserve. She has repaid her previous loans on time and is an excellent client. Her boss and colleagues give her moral support.

Ms. F. attests that she will never withdraw from AFODENIC because she is very satisfied with their service and she believes that all of the staff are very special.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom and kitchen

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 27 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y su pequeña hija. Hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza de animales, ya que tiene sus tres vaquitas, las cuales cuida y alimenta de manera adecuada para luego venderlas en los mercados. Todas las mañanas, Rosario las ordeña y sale a vender leche en los mercados o por alrededores de su domicilio, gracias a ello puede tener ingresos diarios para cubrir los gastos de alimentación diaria de su hija y los de sus padres a quienes también viene apoyando. Este es quinto préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas de pago  con sus cuotas anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita comprará de una vaca para aumentar su producción y venta de leche.
texts.en:
Rosario is 27; she is a single mother and lives with her parents and her little daughter. Three years ago she decided to go into livestock; she has three calves which she is rearing and fattening in order to sell them in the market.

Every morning, Rosario milks her cows and goes out to sell the milk in the markets or door to door; this provides her with an income to maintain her daughter and her parents, who also depend on her.

This is her fifth loan from MFP; to date, she has always repaid promptly. She will use the money to buy a cow to increase milk production.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Urozali

texts.en:
Urozali is 20 years old. Despite his young age, he has been raising sheep already for three years. He tries to invest as much time as possible in his animals. He tries to bathe and vaccinate his animals, which is very tedious, because there is only one place to bathe the rams and it's not easy to reach. But without a doubt, the results please him: to be able to see clean and healthy animals is a great source of satisfaction. Now he plans to invest the money that he is requesting in the purchase of a good breed of livestock to improve the quality of his animals. He will then generate more income, and with it, improve his quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Tsévié, Mme Abra K. est mariée et à en charge six (06) personnes. Très soucieuse de préserver son foyer et de soutenir son mari dans les dépenses du ménage, elle s’est lancée dans la préparation et la vente de denrées alimentaires au bord de la route à l’air libre tous les soirs. En vue de construire et aménager un hangar sous forme de restaurant et stocker suffisamment de denrées alimentaires (riz, mais, huile et autres…), elle sollicite un financement. Les bénéfices lui serviront à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr.s Abra K. was born in Tsévié in 1970, is married, and has six persons to support. Anxious to preserve her household and to help her husband with the household expenses, she started a business preparing and selling food every evening on the roadside. To construct a hangar and turn it into a restaurant, and stock enough food supplies (rice, corn, oil, ...), she's seeking a loan. The profits will be used to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a hangar and turn it into a restaurant

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Mrs Vanny A., a 52-year-old mother of six children, lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. Two of her children are Chinese noodle sellers who own a small restaurant, and three of the children are enrolled in the local school. Vanny A. has a successful pig breeding business and wants to expand it by purchasing two more piglets. She would use the rest of loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr Nuon Sothea, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a construction worker.  Vanny A. and her husband are both shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets, and also a breeding cow

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionisio J. A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.
Dionisio trabaja como albañil, en construcciones particulares de esa ciudad y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa.
Con anteriores créditos el señor Dionisio realizó  la construcción de cuatro habitaciones, de las cuales dos ya fueron concluidas y ocupan con su familia.  
El crédito es para la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra fina.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Dionisio J. A. lives in his own home in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city El Alto. Dionisio works as a builder for private constructions in El Alto. His wife is a homemaker.

With previous loans Dionisio was able to begin the construction of four rooms, two of which are already completed and occupied by his family. This loan is for the construction of two rooms in a fine project.

This is the sixth time he has applied for a loan. Analysis of his socioeconomic condition found that he is favorably qualified and can receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Abdul Wali

texts.en:
Abdul Wali K., who is 35 years old, is married and the father of 3 children. He lives in Jalalabad city Nangarhar province and he is involved in agriculture in his own village in the Angoor Bagh. He has six years experience in this work and is a very hard worker. He has studied in the past during the war in Afghanistan up to three classes.

Abdul has two sons and one baby sister. He lives with his parents in a small rental house in Angoor Bagh. His senior son is studying in fifth class at a public school in Jalalabad city and in his spare time he helps his father with the farming. The other one is not able to go to school. Abdul has a lot of dreams for the future of his children but his income is so small. He wants to increase it because he pays 3000AF per month rent for his house.

Abdul wants to buy some things for his land but he needs an individual loan; therefore he requested that the lenders of AFGS to give him a 40000AF individual loan. Also he has his own capital of 100000AF but he invested it in his business. He wants to increase his income to become 500AF (~10USD) per day. And he says if he receives this money he will buy some seeds and necessary things for his land and more. 

Thanks Kiva loan!

loans.use: Buying seeds and necessary things for his land

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru:
Даврон Косимов по национальности узбек, проживает он в г.Истарвшане.
Основной деятельностью, который приносит хорошую прибыль в его семью,является животноводство. У Даврона огромный 18 летний опыт в этой сфере деятельности. Дома, он имеет 7 голов крупнорогатого скота. 
 Даврону 45 лет, он живет с женой Мукаддас и 4 детьми. Жена Мукаддас, помогает ему в уходе за крупнорогатым скотом.Кроме этого, супурги занимаются сельским хозяйством, а сам Даврон подрабатывает штукатурщиком. В этой же сфере деятельности, ему всегда помогает сын Чавшан.
 Займ Даврон хочет получить для откорма скота,с последующей его продажей. 
 Требуемая сумма 1200 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Davron K. lives in the city of Istaravshan. His primary business, which brings in a good profit for his family, is animal husbandry. Davron has an 18-year experience in this business field. He owns 7 cattle at home. Davron is 45 years old and lives with his wife Mukaddas and 4 children. Mukaddas helps him to take care of the livestock. Besides this business, the husband and wife are also involved in agriculture, and Davron works as a plasterer. His son Chavshan helps Davron with the latter work. Davron wants to obtain a loan to feed and then sell livestock. He needs a sum of 1200 somoni with a term of 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en: Brigida B. is engaged in a general store business in her village at Barangay Estrada Mallig, Isabela. She also manages a furniture shop business and a vending vegetables business. Brigida is seeking the financial support of lenders to lend her a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional working capital. She believes that her business profit will allow her family a comfortable lifestyle in the future by simply using the amount wisely in her business. She also wants to have extra income so she will have savings. With the help of her four children, Brigida is able to maintain her chosen business and she hopes to sustain it for the future welfare of her children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Emilio D. tiene ya mas de ocho años dedicándose a la venta de tamales por las callas en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Está es la fuente de ingresos de su familia, a su negocio le esta haciendo falta un equipo mas moderno de sonido, para anunciar sus alimentos.
   Don Emilio D. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales pago puntual mente, ahora esta solicitando nueva mente un préstamo para poder comprar el equipo que requiere, sin descapitalizar su ingreso familiar.
texts.en:
Emilio D. has been selling tamales (a dish made mainly of tortilla dough and vegetables boiled in a banana leaf) on the streets of Nuevo Laredo for eight years. This is his family's source of income, but he needs some more modern sound equipment to announce his food.

Emilio D. has had two previous credits with FVP, both of which he has repaid punctually, and now he would like another one to be able to buy the sound system that he needs without having to take away from his family's income.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sound equipment for his work/Comprar de equipo para trabajar

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en: Hicham is a 49-year-old married man living with his wife and three children who are still in school. In 2004, he opened his own Arabic restaurant, which specializes in Hommos and similar famous Arabic dishes. Today, Hicham is requesting to borrow $1,200 to renovate his shop and make some modifications in order to attract more clients.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and make some modifications

loans.name: Fuente De Bendicion Group 3

texts.en:
Damiana R. is the group leader of the solidarity group Fuente D. Bendicion (or Fountain of Blessing). This group is maD. up of friends and neighbors in the small coastal town of Sabana D. la Mar. 

With this loan, Damiana will buy fruit, vegetables and habichuelas (Dominican beans) which are used in a popular Dominican bean dish. Damiana has already repaid two loans and is excited to take out a bigger loan to grow her business even more.

Damiana is a 39-year-old mother of four (ages 16,14,12, and 9) and since starting her business, she has been able to make sure all of them go to school. Her dream is to grow her businesses enough to be able to send them to college. 

On behalf Damiana and the entire Fuente D. Bendicion group, thank you for providing an opportunity to those who need it most!

loans.use: To buy more fruit, vegetables, and habichuelas

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia, nació en la provincia de Urubamba, ella tiene su domicilio en av. mariscal castilla s/n, situados a 1 hora con 20 minutos desde la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad viuda,  es madre soltera, ella  tiene  3 hijos y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la provincia de Urubamba, exactamente en el mercado antiguo en el puesto nº 5, ella tiene este negocio desde hace 11 años, conoce muy bien su negocio, por lo que tiene el éxito asegurado en las épocas de declive, ella solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería y abastecer su negocio.

Nuestra socia valora y agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Celia is a native of the province of Urubamba and lives in her home in Mariscal Castilla, an hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco, Peru. She is a 43-year-old widow and mother of three. She alternates her household obligations with work in retail. She has a small convenience store in Urubamba, exactly in the old market at the fifth sales post. She has had this store for 11 years and knows her business very well, which has ensured her success even in times of recession. She is requesting the loan so she can purchase more merchandise and stock her store. Celia values and is grateful for this support and also promises to fulfill her payment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Erenea

texts.en:
Erenea J. is from the village of Katipa. She is 61 years old. Erenea is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Erenea raises pigs for sale. Erenea is just starting this business.

In 2006, Erenea joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erenea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Erenea is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Erenea from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
S. Ganbaatar is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His wife works as a storekeeper, his oldest son has finished school and works for a construction company in the capital city, and his two youngest daughters are university students.

Ganbaatar currently operates a mobile dairy product business in his town. He started this business in 2005 with capital of 100,000 MNT. Since then, he has grown his business and found much success. He attributes this success to his hardworking attitude and good communication skills. Today, his working capital exceeds 600,000 MNT. Ganbaatar has used the profits from his business to provide his children with a good education and improve his family's quality of life. For the future, he says, ”I wish to have my own store.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase new products to sell through his dairy trade business.

loans.use: To purchase new dairy products

loans.name: Tuihailiah Group

texts.en: Nessie is a 40 year old Liberian business woman who resides along the Dama Road, Foyah District, Lofa County.  A widow with 5 children and a 12th grade education, she has been selling oil goods for about 3 years now, and faces challenges due to financial shortage and illness. She has been successful, however, in attracting customers through good treatment. Her dream is to build a provision shop which will enable her cater to her children’s education and medical needs.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale oil for resale

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi es una mujer dinámica  y entusiasta vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 32 años y es madre de cinco hijos, todos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de repuestos y accesorios para autos, actividad que lo realiza junto a su esposo, esta tienda funciona en su domicilio. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en prendas de vestir para vender en el mercado.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que le permitirá invertir en fibra de vidrio y accesorios para vender. La meta de Deysi es ampliar su local  y seguir adelante en este negocio.

loans.use: Invertirá en fibra de vidrio y accesorios para vender piezas de autos.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 26 years old. She is married and has given birth to one boy who is in school. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.
